On your turn you either: a) place or advance workers on 2 (out of 7) Action Tracks, pushing previously placed workers down into more advantageous spaces; or b) retrieve 1 worker from an Action Track and pay for the resources offered at the space the worker is on. To build a structure, you need to collect a matching blueprint (for a bridge, monument, church, etc.) plus various resources (wood, stone, iron, and/or gold) as specified for the structure being built. Finally, you must claim the building site with the blueprint and deliver the resources needed to that site. On completion, you earn victory points (VPs) and receive a crest from the District where the site is located that will score additional VPs at the end of the game.

The player who contributes most to the construction of Budapest will earn the greatest number of Victory Points and hence win the game.

—description from the designer

name: Outer Banks Vacation Game
description:
In this family game, in the storytelling style of "The Game of Life", players travel by spin-and-move along a board. Along the way, they encounter Shopping, Dining, and Family Activity Cards which represent real-world businesses in the Outer Banks area. By earning Fun Tickets (VPs) and avoiding Vacation Bummer Cards, players vie to have the highest score after all players reach the finish line.

The box contains: quad-folding board, six pawns, spinner, Fun Tix money, Shopping Cards, Dining Cards, Vacation Bummer Cards, and instructions.

—user summary

name: Merchant Princes of Byzantium
description:
It is a time of chaos in the ancient empire of 14th century Byzantium. Political, social and economic upheavals are pushing the old empire to breaking point. For clever merchants it is a time of great potential. Attempt to accumulate, trade, bribe, trick and manipulate your way to becoming the richest and most influential Merchant Prince in Byzantium.

Game Summary: Players assume the role of an inspired merchant in ancient Byzantium, determined to develop a trading empire across the region of Anatolia during the upheavals of the time. Each player has a different character and special power taken from a range of different neighbouring cultures. Players buy trade goods in far off markets to sell in the bazaars of Byzantium, while doing their utmost to undermine and obstruct their rivals and avoid the various historical hazards of the time. Players use Trader markers to purchase and move goods appearing across the board, avoiding dangerous local events and rival player skulduggery. Later in the game players can attempt to secure influential government roles worth bonus victory points but require each role to be voted upon by all players so bribery and deal making is a must! The player with the largest and most influential merchant empire at game end is given the title of Merchant Prince of Byzantium.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Voting, Worker Placement

name: Landships: Titanic Battles in The Age of Iron and Steam
description:
Landships is a tactical miniature wargame system, designed for novice and experienced players. The game is a simple system to learn and play, though there is enough depth that it will take time and experience to master. It is a 1/300 (6mm) steampunk wargame set in the fantastic world of Artrusia, where orcs, humans and other races fight each other.

The main feature of this game is that the miniatures are made to print in 3D printers. The player buys the files and print as many times as he wants. Our goal is to take advantage of these new technologies for wargames and give the player more diverse and cheaper options regarding the miniatures. We are aware that it is a new technology, but we want to go ahead and serve an audience that is already using 3D printing to play.

—description from the publisher

This basic game contains:

- 1 rulebook in pdf format
- 1 game scenario
- 1 player aid
- Paper Counters to replace 3D miniatures
- Action Cards for printing

Miniatures for 3D printing in STL format

Orcs
- Landship
- Steam Mech
- Light Tank
- Heavy Tank
- Steam Artillery
- Steam Infantry

Humans
- Landship
- Steam Mech
- Light Tank
- Heavy Tank
- Steam Artillery
- Steam Infantry

Tripeds
- Attack Triped

Accessories
- Triped template shoot ruler
- Artillery Templates
- Steam Points
- 2 buildings
- Aerolites

Buy the game here: https://www.wargamevault.com/product/275108/Landships--Titan...
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Yat'Z Dungeon Raid
description:
Your adventure begins on the outskirts of a small village where you have heard tell of a dungeon near the village’s church. The barkeep at the local tavern spoke of adventurers who have entered the dungeon seeking treasures untold, but have never returned. The priest of the church told tales of the blood curdling sounds that creep from behind the dungeon’s locked doors. The information you’ve been given does little to deter you, and others, from the promise of riches and glory. You are sure that your adventures have brought you face to face with far worse than what may await in the bowls of this dungeon. You step up to the locked doors. You feel the familiar rush of adrenaline and nervousness beginning to pound through your body…

Welcome to YAT’Z Dungeon Raid!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Everwar
description:
- Introduction -

Everwar is a fast, fun and accessible wargame, with a diesel punk aesthetic and a pixel art graphic design, very characteristic of mid'90s video games (hello Advance Wars!). The universe of Everwar is based on a fun and solid game system (easy to learn but hard to master) which develops an interesting plot that, in addition to providing a rich background, regularly introduces new mechanics and playable elements that add depth and freshness to the gaming experience through regular updates.

- Background -

The story of Everwar is set in an alternative universe that shares certain similarities with our own world. The events take place in Domum, a planet where the technological advance of humanity has evolved exclusively around internal combustion engines and fossil fuel.

In Domum, wars between nations have occurred on a global scale on numerous occasions throughout recent history. This has molded belligerent societies accustomed to enduring the sacrifices of long confrontations.

The base game of Everwar brings us to Erisland Kingdom, a nation that is mired in a bloody civil war for the succession to the throne. But something is about to change the course of history in a terrible way, and neither Erisland, nor any other nation of Domum, is prepared for it.

- Gameplay overview -

During a game of Everwar, the player's objective is to fulfill one of the scenarios victory requirements. This may include collecting a certain amount of victory points, capturing an enemies HQ or taking control of strategic objectives.

To do so, players will take non-consecutive turns in which the initiative is based on the orders issued to their armies.

Every turn, players will simultaneously choose orders that will allow them to move and engage in combat with a different number of units. Initiative is determined by the number of units activated by an order, the player activating the least number of units will gain the initiative during the turn.

Everwar has a dice-based combat that uses a rock(tanks)-paper(artillery)-scissor(infantry) system to determine the number of dice each player gets. This, together with terrain bonuses and flank bonuses, brings a fast and simple yet highly tactical combat experience.
categories: Print & Play, Video Game Theme, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Phase Order

name: Ad Astra
description: The Game of Interstellar Empire Building. A game of interstellar conquest, diplomacy and economics. The game concentrates on the military competition by the major political powers within a region for control of economic resources, and hence domination of the region. Many minor worlds scatter the region and act as flashpoints for conflict between the major worlds. Comprised a large hex star map, a 42-page A4 booklet and two sheets of stiff card counters (not pre-cut). This is a hex-based wargame with diplomacy elements. One scenario (Power Struggle after the Collapse) is provided along with guidance for how to create your own. The game is designed to be highly customizable.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: ひゃっぴきいっしゅ (Hyappiki Isshu)
description:
Publisher's summary
ひゃっぴきいっしゅ (Hyappiki Isshu) (Animal Karuta) is a Japanese card game for children.

In this varation on the classic karuta game Hyakunin Isshu, historical personages are replaced with color-coded animals. There are two ways to play: either with a group like normal karuta, or as an intense head-to-head battle for two.

日本の伝統ゲームである百人一首の「決まり字」というゲームとしての面白さを、どうぶつと色で表現したカルタゲームです。
2人で遊ぶ真剣ルールと、みんなであそぶルールの2種類があります。
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game
publishers: Studium Mundi (スタジオムンディ)

name: Slanguage
description:
Slanguage is a party game in the spirit of Balderdash and Wise and Otherwise. But Slanguage uses international slang as its base.

One player is designated as the Reader each round. That player reads the literal translation of a slang phrase and states the country of origin. The other players write an explanation of the meaning of the slang keeping it secret from other players. They pass their guesses to the reader.

The reader shuffles the written guesses and then reads them to the group without telling who wrote which guess.

Finally, players vote for the explanation that they think is correct. Players score points for getting the correct answer. They also get points if someone else guesses theirs as the correct answer.

—description from the designer

name: Fantactics
description:
Legendary Multi-unit Tactics

Cooperative Play with 2 teams

Take cover, use opportunity fire.

Flank, use tactical abilities.

Join or leave a game in progress.

"Like Chess for Parties"

—description from the publisher

name: Dig & Play Egyptian Tomb
description:
Join the search for priceless Egyptian treasures. Dig up dazzling jewelry and ancient artifacts, then set off to discover the whereabouts of a mysterious Egyptian tomb. It’s an excavation adventure and a cool board game too!

The aim of the game is to be the first to find the hidden Egyptian Tomb. The person who throws the highest number starts first. The first to reach Egyptian Tomb wins. If you throw the dice and the number is too large, you move forward to the tomb and then backwards the remaining spaces. You must throw the exact number.

It may sound simple to reach the Egyptian Tomb first, but you will encounter many obstacles along your journey. Watch out by scorpions and try not to fall in the river or you will find yourself behind your competitors. It’s an exciting adventure full of mystery and danger.

—description from the publisher

name: トキシカル (Toxical)
description:
Publisher's summary
In the gameトキシカル (Tokishikaru) (Toxical), each player is leading 10 survivors on a desert island. They are hunting wild animals to survive until they are rescued. But some animals have toxin that would cause members to die.

The toxic animals are determined by players at the beginning of the game. Players collect escaping tools while avoiding toxic animals. The game ends when they complete a set of tools as a team. Each player adds up their own points for members survived and tools collected, and the player with the highest total wins the game.

プレイヤーはそれぞれ、10人ずつのメンバーを率いて無人島にいます。
助けが来るまで、野生生物を狩って食料にして生存を目指します。
しかし一部の生物は毒を持っており、うっかり食べると高確率でメンバーが死亡します。
どの生物が毒を持っているかは、開始時に他のプレイヤーが事前に決定します。
生物の代わりに見つかる脱出アイテムを集め、全員でそろえるとゲーム終了です。
生き残っているメンバーの人数に、獲得した脱出アイテムを加えたものを得点とし、最も高いプレイヤーが勝利です。

name: Ice Fox: A Diamond Heist Micro Game
description:
Ice Fox is a diamond heist/chase theme 18-card micro game for 2 players. One player takes on the role of the world renowned international diamond thief, Ice Fox, whose mission is to elude capture, steal the diamonds in the museum, and escape through the Exit. The other player takes on the role of the Guard trying to capture the elusive Ice Fox and protect the diamonds, Both characters have unique abilities and gain new abilities as the game goes on. Will the Ice Fox's luck run cold, OR will the Guard be put on ice?

The Ice Fox and Guard start on different "tracks" in the museum that only intersect on certain tiles. In each turn, a new tile is added to the map and the player can perform a set number of actions to meet their objective. The Ice Fox can move, turn off lights in a room, and steal a diamond when a diamond room is revealed. The Guard can move, turn on lights in a room, and apprehend. Ice Fox's objective: Get a diamond (or more if you're feeling lucky) and get out. Guard's objective: Capture the Ice Fox!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Universe of Words
description:
Amazing Cards Game With Alphabet for adult and kids. Easy to play at home and study new words for kids.


This game is fun for kids and adults.



Very suitable to play together in the family when going camping, party...



Good for thinking and teaching kids new words.



Help children practice memory and creativity


In Universe Of Words have:


Number of regular cards: 26x2 = 52 cards
Double card: On the card contains pairs of letters such as: tr, cr, br, wr, ch, ou, ng, th, qu. Number of 18 cards
Skip card: Number of 5 cards
Skipx2 card: Number of cards 5
Draw card: Number of 10 cards (5 +1 cards, 5 +2 cards)


First, deal each player ten cards and put two cards on two star cells on the table The remaining cards should be placed face-down, to form the "draw" pile. The first person has to match one of his/her cards with placed cards on table in order to make a meaningful word. If the player doesn't have anything to match, he/she must pick a card from the draw pile. If he can play what is drawn, great. Otherwise play moves to the next person. You do not have to continue picking up until you come across a card you can match it with placed cards on the table. When you have one card left, you must yell " SOS " (meaning one). If you don't call " SOS" and you get cought by another player, you must pick up two cards from the draw pile. Once a player has no cards left, she/he is the winner.
“ H” & “ F” card: Except for those who beat this card, the one who slaps his/her hand on the table the slowest must draw 2 cards from the draw pile.
The skip card: this card will skip the person next to you, and let the following player have her turn right away.
The skip cardx2: his card will skip the two people next to you, and let the following player have her/his turn right away.
The draw +1/+2 card: The player next to you will have to pick up one card/ two cards if you play one of these.
The wild card: This type of card lets you change the letter on your card. For example, if you don't have anything to match, you can throw drown the wild card and announce the letter you want to change.
The reverse card: If you play that card, then the order of play is reversed. Instead of the player on your left playing after you, it will pass to the one on your right. In other words, if play is proceeding clockwise, this card will change it to counter-clockwise.

name: Cultistorm: The Investigator Expansion Pack
description:
‘Reinforcements have arrived’ in the form of the Investigator Add-on pack, which includes 4 brand new detectives for use in the game.

Stephen Dawson, the master of Cults, spends his free time wandering the forests of Arkham alongside his loyal Pointer companion. Together they sniff out any signs of dark rituals!

Special Agent Tony Russo is an expert in finding missing people. His skills allow him to manipulate cultist trophies. He also gets a special introduction in the Short Story Collection.

Jacob Burns was a priest before he encountered the forces of evil. After seeing these powers at work he decided to join the detectives in their fight against the cultists. His character receives 6 extra cards, which are best used in the ‘Dark Rituals’ expansion.

Serena Higgins’ story also holds a special place in our Short Story Collection. She is the dimension wanderer of the team and also receives 6 extra cards, which are best utilised in the ‘Otherworlds’ expansion.

The new detectives come with miniatures, character boards, and unique detective decks utilising their skills.

—description from the publisher

name: History to Heaven
description:
Create a new human's history!
You become leaders of human beings, and lead them to the perfect paradise with 52 great men.

Each players picks out 1 card from their hands, and the biggest number card wins.
However all cards have different special abilities, and these make complex strategy.

Repeat 10 times that putting 1 card from hands.
In the end, a player with the largest sum of paradise points will win.

Players are forced to choose which cards to put out in a very limited choice, whether to offer additional as support, or not to take out.

It is a game that you can play freely many times with 50% luck, 50% strategy.

---STORY---
- The purpose of humankind is to be happy -
- The place where is satisfied all, we will call "Heaven" -

This is the universe of the parallel world.
On the Earth there, a new history of mankind was about to begin.
Great persons who lead people are born in different century, and struggle to make a new history over and over, to bring humankind into the heaven.

The era of the game starts from the 1st century, and it will end in the 10th century.
The players become leaders of humankind, to develop humankind with great persons, and to guide people to the heaven.
Eventually the player who get the highest total of heaven point will win.

---Game flow---

Deal cards
Place 1 card face down
Face up card or pass +1
Influence"Struggle"
Support (You can add Power. But supporter's Influence does not activate and does not remain in History)
Winner determined
Influence "Victory","Defeat"
One winner remains in History
To the next century


(At the end of the 10th century, player who have the highest total of Heaven win in this game)

—description from the designer

name: I Love You
description:
Five killers kill each other. Who survives to the end?

Each player chooses one character board and uses it, and fighting with all players.
Who survived to the end will win.
Squares on the board means Life and Action at the same time.
Player can move by reducing Life as much as you want. Then, activate the effect of the stopped mass.

6 Effects of Masses(Attack, Attack and Move, Hide, Get Resource, Get Card, Recovery).
6 Skills(Attack×2, Defense1/2, Avoid, Revenge, Break Resource, Get Card).
5 Effects of Cards(6 Lives, 7 Resources, Avoid, Move Again, No Avoid and Hide).

Darkest burning sun rises today too.
At the end of the world, which killer can survive to the end.
It is...

—description from the designer

name: Changing Challenges
description:
A chess-like game with gravity - you move your pieces in order to achieve victory, but you must also make sure not to tip the board, because that makes you lose.

—user summary

name: Gaining Gravity
description:
Perhaps your opponent is able to knock you out – but he might be more interested in capturing preys. Don’t let him discover that he can knock you out.

The main strategy in Gaining Gravity is to balance between caution (don’t be knocked home by your opponents game piece) and greed (capture as much prey as possible).

—description from the publisher

name: Gravity Chess
description:
A gravity game where the pieces move according to chess rules. Each player has one king (weight 6), three queens (weight 4), four rooks (weight 3), four bishops (weight 2), and four pawns (weight 1).
You win by a) taking so many opponent pieces that the board cannot be placed level, c) placing your king on the center line without your opponent being able to take it, or c) taking your opponent's king.

—user summary

name: Race to the Moon
description:
Race to the Moon is a two-player competitive deck-building game set in the historic Space Race. The players take the roles of the USA and the USSR as they try to be the first nation to land a man on the moon. Players begin with similar but asymmetric decks, unlocking new cards that can be acquired as they advance in science and technology.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Wall
description:
Year 1961. The construction of the Berlin Wall begins with simple barbed wire fences. From one day to the next, the inhabitants of the German Democratic Republic are locked up in their own country.
This makes many more want to flee, not only because of the siren songs of the West, but also because of the possible separation from their family, the disagreement with the regime,... an endless number of reasons with a common denominator: "they want to be free people".

A semi-operational game in which one of the players will lead the Stasi while the others will have to try to get some of their citizens to escape to West Berlin.

name: Lady Majonna
description:
In Lady Majonna, a.k.a. レディ・マジョンナ, the players are witches at the "Royal Magical Academy" and the "Lady Majonna Cup", an annual race, is about to begin. The players use their cats and magical items to advance and hope to win the race. After several races, the player with the fewest negative points wins.

Players move by using poker-style hands: two pairs, three of a kind, three card straight flush, and four card straight flush. Players draw cards from a draw deck or in order from other players' discard piles. The players can use their cat to reserve cards for their next turn.

The winner of a race earns no points. The other players lose 1 point for each card left in hand and 2 points for each magic item left in hand.

name: Ate the Game
description:
Ate the Game is a party game that combines word-guessing and role-playing. A cluegiver draws a series of cards with words ending with the suffix -ate and tries to get their team to guess as many as they can in one minute, while also playing a role as defined by a Mandate card.

Set up:
Divide into teams of at least two people. Separately shuffle the ATE deck (cards with words that end in -ate) and the MANDATE deck (cards that dictate how the cluegiver must act while giving clues).

Gameplay:
The Mandator draws an ATE card and one MANDATE card. When they are ready to begin, the opposing team starts a 60-second timer.

The Mandator tries to get their team to guess as many ATE cards as possible while performing the MANDATE card.

At the end of a turn, the playing team has one chance to guess the current MANDATE card. If an ATE card remains unguessed when time is up, the opposing team has one chance to steal the card with a correct guess.

Correctly guessed ATE and MANDATE cards are one point each. A stolen ATE card is two points. A skipped ATE card (The Mandator is only allowed to skip one ATE card per turn) is minus two points.

The game ends when each player on a team has performed as the Mandator twice. The team with the highest score wins or play a tie-breaker round.
mechanics: Acting, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: JoJo Siwa Bust A Bow Dance Game
description:
"An exciting, rhythmic memory game!"

Players clip three bows into their hair. Each, on their turn, rolls two large dice which indicate a dance move to be done and a color on the mat on which to perform it. Each player performs all previous dance moves before adding their roll results to the routine. When a player makes a mistake they must remove one of their bows and the game resets. The last player to have a bow or bows remaining is the winner.

name: Nobody, inside!
description:
中の人なんかいない！ (Nobody, inside!) is a mix of trick-taking and blind auction bidding, for 3-6 players. The deck shows visitors to a theme park, with the low cards also doubling as the costumed characters trying to get the visitors to ride on the attractions.

The game is played in alternating rounds of trick-taking and blind auctions. During the trick-taking, players follow normal trick-taking rules (follow the lead if possible, play a trump otherwise).

The winner of the round then leads a blind bidding, placing costumed cards face-down plus chips. Players that don't want to or cannot play a costumed mascot play a visitor instead, face-up as a discard. The winner of the auction collects visitors fom the other players, and sets the next trump colour.

At the end of the game, the players get points for the visitors they have earned, and a bonus for colour majorities.

The deck consists of cards 1-15 in 4 colors. Ranks 1-8 are "Visitor" cards, and ranks 9-15 may either be a "Visitor" card of rank 9-15 or rotated 180 degrees to be a "Costumed" card of rank 1-3. The game also comes with bidding chips which are distributed to the players.

The lead player has the option of starting a "Visitor" trick or a "Costumed" bid. A "Visitor" trick proceeds as a standard trick-taking game with players each playing a card from their hand (following suit if possible), and the winner being the player that played the highest ranked trump card, and if none were played, the highest ranked card in the lead suit.

In a "Costumed" bid, any player, including the lead player, that plays a "Costumed" card, plays it face down. Such players can also add up to 3 of their bidding chips to their card. Any player who does not want to or cannot play a "Costumed" card instead plays a "Visitor" card face up. At the end of the trick, the highest combined value of chips and "Costumed" card takes the trick, with the latter played breaking ties. The trump suit for "Visitor" rounds is determined by the last "Costumed" card color to win a "Costumed" trick.

The winner of the "Costumed" trick chooses between scoring all "Visitor" cards played to the trick that match the color of the winning costume or acquiring cards of this color from in front of the other players.

Players play a predetermined number of rounds, with the rules suggesting 3. Points are earned based upon the visitors scored during "Costumed" tricks and the number of colors of visitors obtained during "Visitor" tricks.

—user summary

name: kiSabadulos: Toys are going into the world
description:
DIY KIDS sold by HOMESCAPE is a series of escape room style educative puzzle games specifically for kindergarten and pre-school age children.

The second in the series is: "Toys are going into the world" where the plush toys of a little girl, fed up with being left on the floor night after night, decide to leave. The group of players has to help the protagonists navigate through their journey and discover in the end that all has happened in the girl's head while dreaming (but of course she will never again leave her room untidy before going to bed).

Children in groups of 1-4 (aided by an adult game master) solve a total of 11 varied puzzles to advance the story and achieve the final goal. The quest is expected to be completed in 75 minutes, and the team scores points for extra time left as well as puzzles solved without hints. The game comes with a game master guide to set up and play through the adventure.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Educational, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Hunt for the Big Five
description:
Find and shoot Africa’s “Big Five” animals (with your camera) on a three-day African safari to earn victory points (VPs). The player with the most VPs at the end of the game wins. Watch out, though -- because an animal can charge and wound you if you get too close! A few special cards can spice things up, too.

Both players secretly “bid” on which of two areas they want to visit. To do this, they choose one or two Animal cards with coins to influence their safari guide.

The card(s) are then revealed and the player with the higher total of coins chooses where the hunt will take place; i.e., which area will be visited. This player then plays another Animal card from his hand, which must match the chosen terrain, and rolls the die. If it falls within the range (1, 1-2 or 1-3) on the card then his shot is successful and he retains this card and its VPs, visible to both players.

Play continues over three decks, and a winner is determined. A 3-point bonus goes to a player if he shoots all of the Big Five.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Print & Play

name: Sovereign: Solve, Conquer, Expand
description:
Sovereign is a game similar to Risk, Settlers of Catan, and Monopoly, if all were rolled into one game.

Players will manage their TEMPER Attributes in order to remain in power. TEMPER stands for Trustworthiness, Economics, Military, Population, Environment, and Resources. Each of these Attributes are needed to maintain a healthy nation and a healthy ruler.

Players will spend 1/2 of each Round in a specific phase, played at the same time. Event Phases are set up as follows:

Players draw event cards.
Players solve event cards in one minute.
Players vote on other player's solutions.


The second phase is the Action Phase, where players expand by buying tiles or trading for them, build Resource collectors, or make armies. There's a lot you can do during this phase.

Players will play until either all are eliminated or one Sovereign remains.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Trading, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Alchemental: Rise of the Celestial Sphere
description:
A 2-4 player epic fantasy deck building game set in the Celestial Sphere universe.

Objective: to forge the philosopher's stone before your opponents do.

Game-Play: use Elementals to defeat your opponent(s)' typhonn, gain and mine Alchemics to forge shards. Once eight shards are made, you can forge the Philosopher's stone and WIN.

This game is rooted in alchemy and offers a truly unique gaming experience by introducing new species and lore outside of traditional fantasy tropes.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battle For Abbaye Des Ardenne: The First Step to Caen
description:
The Battle for the Abbaye des Ardennes is a small scenario pack created by the Lone Canuck Publishing, but never offered for sale. This scenario pack was made available to ASL tournament directors to be given out as prizes.

These scenarios are a mix of large and very large numbers of troops. Here is a summary of the seven scenarios:


#1 The Contest For St. Contest. Operation Charmwood opened up on 8 July 1944 for the 1/7th Royal Warwickshire Regiment whos objective was the Norman Village of St. Contest. Waiting for them was III/SS-Panzergrenadier Regiment 25. 3 boards, one overlay and 10 turns.



#2 First Big Fight. Buron France 8 July 1944. The 3rd British Division has captured Lebisey, but the British 59th Division was still struggling with its initial objectives. Once more Buron would be attacked with St. Contest in the hands of the German's 12th SS-Hitlerjugend Division. 3 boards, one overlay and 10 turns.



#3 Crazy Carriers. Gruchy France 8 July 1944. The Stormont, Dundas, Glengarry Highlanders, and Sherbrooke Fusilirs began their attack protected by a hail of shells that threw up great clouds of dust. Under the heavy shelling the Germans were forced to crouch in the bottom of their trenches. When the artillery lifted, the Germans came to life and brought their machine guns to bear on the advancing Highlanders. 4 boards and 9 turns.



#4 Able Forward. Authie France 8 July 1944. The North Nova Scotia Highlanders planned to push south and capture Authie and then Franqueville while the Glengarries would take the old chateau about a half mile from Authie. As they advanced German mortar and 88 fire tore into the infantry companies. Under this relentless fire from the German SS, the order "Able Forward" was given. Three boards and 10 turns.



#5 No Taste for Cold Steel. 8 July 1944. The Canadians attempt to pry fanatical Hitler Youth from Cussy and the Abbey. Two Boards and 7 turns.



#6 Storming the Abbey. 8 July 1944. Cussy France. The Regina Rifles reach and attack the Abbey des Ardennes, the command post of SS Panzergrenadier Regiment 25. Two boards, 7 overlays and 9 turns.



#7 Tip of the Spear. Upon entering the small village of Buron, The advance party of the Fusiliers come into contact with hidden German machineguns and anti-tank guns, determined to stop the Canadian advance. Three boards and 10 turns.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Template of War
description:
Temple of War is a heavy wargame using an innovative combat and skirmish system. The game will come with several full-fledged campaigns and can be played from 1 to 10 players (or more). The campaign is built in such a way that the players can play different stages at the same table or individually at home, and update the state of the game/world based on their progress. It's possible to drop out or jump into any game at any time, as each player controls their own army/faction. The game can adapt to any situation on the fly, without the need to restart or wait for each other. The game will come with an app, so you will be able to engage in a campaign with anyone around the world.

The theme of the game is based on a never before used (in boardgames) high-fantasy IP that will be revealed later next year.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Trading

name: Master Spy!
description:
Four master spies seek to gather information for their respective governments and return to their headquarters. This is a pure roll-and-move game. Player order is determined by an initial die roll, and all movement is determined by die rolls. The track is 65 spaces long and includes obstacles like "Lose 1 Turn" and "Roll 2 to Leave." If, during the game, a player lands on an occupied space, that player must return all the way to the start space.

Some spaces on the board require players to draw a "Confidential Card." These include such directions as "Return to the Warehouse. Confirm report that premises are now being used by a Foreign Government, as a base for operations. (Lose two turns.)" and "Conditions now favorable in your sector. Roll die two times. Add up the total and move ahead."

The winner is the first player to reach the finish space.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Fat Cats
description:
In this ancient game of strategy, each player seeks to immobilize and remove all their opponent's pieces. Although an easy game to lean a high level of tactical skill is needed to win. (Source: Game Box)

In detail it is played like this. Each player selects a set of 5 pieces in their color and both players place those pieces on the outer lines on opposing sites. Now players take turns and during their turn, they can move one of their pieces one space from one corner of a square to another. If a player manages to trap an opponents piece the trapped piece is removed from the board. The player eliminating all pieces of the opponent wins the game.

name: The Boys Combat Card Game
description:
Straight from the pages of The Boys comics, players take the role of The Boys. In a world where costumed heroes soar through the sky and masked vigilantes prowl the night, someone's got to make sure the "supes" don't get out of line. And someone will! Billy Butcher, Wee Hughie, Mother's Milk, The Frenchman, and The Female are The Boys: A CIA-backed team of very dangerous people, each one dedicated to the struggle against the most dangerous force on Earth - superpower! Some superheroes have to be watched. Some have to be controlled. And some of them - sometimes - need to be taken out of the picture. That's when you call in The Boys!

This cooperative game allows the players to take the role of The Boys. Players will play allies, actions, and moves against the various Supers that come up, trying to take them out with straight brawn, or finding devious ways to take them out with things like blackmail! Protecting the public can be a dirty job, and... that's what The Boys do!

Superheroes are drawn each round, and must be dealt with, or they will cause collateral damage. If they cause too much damage, the players lose!

Can you help to protect the public from out-of-control super-powered "heroes"?

—description from the publisher

name: Victoria Harbour on Board
description:
Victoria Harbour On Board is one of the Hong Kong On Board series. The chess pieces are designed with local characteristics, and players can use them to travel through different districts in Hong Kong. Victoria Harbour On Board can bring players closer together and enhance their understanding of the different districts in Hong Kong. It is a very special souvenir with Hong Kong characteristics. (from game box)

Players start their custom, Hong Kong-themed pieces at square on on the heavy paper playmat. They then roll a die to progress to square 81 encountering various Hong Kong landmarks on the way. Similar to Snakes and Ladders, these landmarks can move you ahead or send you back on your path. For example, landing on square 23 lets you take the tram to square 29. While essentially a reskinning of Snakes and Ladders, the Hong Kong theme and nice metal tokens makes this a fun souvenir that can spark memories of a visit through playing the game.

—user summary

name: BattleClaw
description:
Want to be a mighty BattleClaw warrior? Play the exciting Battle Mode and Advanced Battle Mode game at home — or anywhere you want!

You and one other player can face off for an epic match of BattleClaw in both Battle Mode and Advanced Battle Mode! Take turns using your claw to catch Jinlins and create powerful beasts to attack your opponent. The first player to defeat all 3 of the opponent’s beasts wins the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight: Snow & Ice Battlepack
description:
Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight Snow & Ice Battlepacks include 4 randomly selected Kaiju Battlecards (2 of which are new random 'Snow & Ice-themed kaiju) , 3 random Zone cards (1 of which is a new random Snow & Ice Zone) , 2 Bonus Cards and rules!

This is a standalone pack and can also be integrated with any other Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight Battlecards.

Based on the original kaiju characters of game designer and manga artist Alex Strang, Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight is an action-packed (yet simple to play) monster-fighting game using large ‘Battlecards’.

Each player uses a Battlecard to represent their giant monster. The large-size illustrated card has all of the monster's abilities and strategic moves arranged on the back, using a unique tactical grid system for battling and tracking results.

Kaiju Battles can end in many ways, from total defeat (monster explode!), concession, running away, draws, and more.

Also: Circular Zone Cards represent various planets and other galactic environments that affect gameplay, and Bonus Cards provide surprising extra moves and events that can alter battles.

The game can be played with 2 players, and becomes even wild with multiple players.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Pattern Recognition, Simulation

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – Humvee-TOW Tank Expansion
description:
The Hummer, Humvee or HMMWV (High Mobility Multipurpose Wheeled Vehicle) is a modern take on the ubiquitous Jeep of World War II fame. The Humvee has a station located above the cab which is capable of mounting a variety of weapons including the awesome TOW (Tube launched Optically tracked Wire guided) anti-tank guided missile.

This pack contains:
2x Unassembled Plastic Humvee Tanks
2x Humvee-TOW Tank card
2x Hero cards
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – LAV Tank Expansion
description:
When the United States Marine Corps wants to rapidly scout an area ahead of their unstoppable advances, they turn to the Light Armored Vehicle armed with a 25mm cannon in a fully rotating turret. When more firepower is needed the LAV-AT, with its ‘Hammerhead’ TOW guided missile launcher, will make any enemy tank crew think twice.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled Plastic LAV-25 or LAV-AT Tank
1x LAV-AT Tank card
1x LAV-25 Tank card
1x Hero card
3x Crew cards
1x Upgrade card
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Dragon Class
description:
The senior dragon students will have graduation test. Whose dragon will pass the test with flying colors?

Dragon Class is a deck building game dealing out 10 cards to each player. All players have 3 times to prepare and take the test.
Tests consists of 5 questions, depicted as different colors. The player who revealed the most cards in the same color as the test card earns the highest score.

The player with the highest score after taking all three tests wins the game.

name: Potion 21
description:
Potion 21 combines roguelike elements such as randomly generated dungeons and permadeath with a game everyone already knows: blackjack, making it a great entry-level tabletop game.

Each round consists of constructing a dungeon and getting as far as you can without overdosing on potions (the equivalent of "busting" in blackjack) or being killed by monsters (the equivalent of having a lower score than the dealer).

As the game progresses you get better potions and raise your starting power, but when you die you lose everything and start the whole game over.

The first player to collect 3 immortality potions win the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Night of the Wererabbit
description:
Do you like kittens that explode? This is not it.

Do you like short statured fantasy types who like to battle monsters?

Well we've got the monsters but no Elves or any magic (not counting Cousin Cleatus's moonshine, that could be magic or a curse). However, what we do have is plenty of liquor, bad judgment, and a whole lot of firepower!

Welcome to Night of the Wererabbit the number one game about money, monsters, and moonshine. Prepare for a wild and crazy ride, all the while trying to survive the horde of monsters and even more brutal hangovers.

Now before you go asking whether we've been hitting the moonshine too much the answer is yes. The other question you might be asking is what in the world are we talking about. Well buckle up buttercup, and let us lay some know how on you.

Night of the Wererabbit is a card game for 2-5 players (unless you buy the expansion pack for up to 8 players) where your objective is to fight monsters, collect the bounties for killing them, and reach the goal of $10,000. With $10,000 you can buy whatever your redneck heart desires; A NASCAR commemorative plate collection, a new whiskey jug, or getting Uncle Maynard out of jail, anything you want, embrace your inner redneck.

—description from the publisher

name: Danmark Rundt
description:
Each player gets 16 Danish cities/towns to visit: 6 cities that all have to visit and 10 random cities/towns. To move around, roll a die and move the rolled number of dots unless you roll a six, in which case you draw a question card. If you answer the question correctly, you get to move a number of dots forward (related to the difficulty of the question).
You win by getting to all your 16 cities/towns first.

—user summary

name: わたしのボブジテン (Watashi no Bob Jiten)
description:
User summary
わたしのボブジテン (Watashi no Bob Jiten) is an expansion pack for the game ボブジテン (Bob Jiten).

Watashi no Bob Jiten is not a game. It is a set of blank cards. Write down your own words to make your original Bob Jiten.

name: ボブジテンぷらす (Bob Jiten Plus)
description:
User summary
ボブジテンぷらす (Bob Jiten Plus) is a mini-expansion for ボブジテン (Bob Jiten).

A new character Chris is introduced. While Chris is active, question master may not say more than three words.

name: ボブジテンその２ぷらす (Bob Jiten 2 Plus)
description:
User summary
ボブジテンその２ぷらす (Bob Jiten 2 Plus) is a mini-expansion for ボブジテンその２ (Bob Jiten 2).

New character Michael is introduced. While Michael is active, question master must keep smiling while conveying the word.

name: The Battle of Britain: Adlerangriff
description:
In the summer of 1940, almost a year after the outbreak of The Second World War, Great Britain stood alone in Europe against a triumphant Germany. Adlerangriff is the German word meaning Attack of the Eagles, the assault on south-east England by The Luftwaffe which was to be undertaken prior to the invasion of the British Isles and this term was used by the Germans to define what the British referred to as The Battle of Britain.

Whilst Fighter Command R.A.F was spread over airfields in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Island, only those squadrons in the south-east would be able to interfere with an invasion which, it was expected, would take place along the south coast between Dover and Weymouth. The battle will, therefore, be fought over the area covered by No 11 Group. If the Luftwaffe can permanently destroy the Sector Stations and Airfields of No 11 Group, thus immobilizing the fighters that use them, the invasion can be undertaken.

—description from the publisher

name: Cleared to Land
description:
Cleared to Land is an exciting and dynamic card game. The objective of the game is to be the first to get rid of all your cards. The first player to get rid of all their cards has won the round. The remaining players count the value of the cards left in their hand, and the amount is allocated to the winner of the round as victory points. When a player has 500 victory points or more, the game is over. That player has won the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Solidarisk
description:
The game Solidarisk aims to raise awareness of business creation and the social and solidarity economy through the CIGALES (Club d'Investisseurs pour une Gestion Alternative et Locale de l'Épargne Solidaire) venture capital investment club. During the game, each team (from 2 to 4 people) plays the role of members of a CIGALES club that will decide whether or not to support the business projects submitted to them. Companies created or supported will be faced with the various hazards of the economic world (crisis, unemployment, competition, innovation, regulation etc.), which will spark debate between all players and require choices from them.

All aspects of the economic life of a company are thus brushed aside in a fun way and can be the means for the entrepreneur to rebound, develop and bring knowledge to the players.

The game is based on real business projects.

The game Solidarisk was created in 1999 by the Fédération des CIGALES on the initiative of AESOPUS, a European program, and has been reissued in partnership with the University of Poitiers.

—user summary

name: kiSabadulos: The colours of Easter
description:
DIY KIDS sold by HOMESCAPE is a series of escape room style educative puzzle games specifically for kindergarten and pre-school age children.

The third in the series is: " The colours of Easter" where the group has to obtain coloured pencils via completing different Easter-themed tasks, so that they can fix the currently black and white colouring page that represents Easter.

Children in groups of 1-4 (aided by an adult game master) solve a total of 8 varied puzzles to advance the story and achieve the final goal. The quest is expected to be completed in 60 minutes, and the team scores points for extra time left as well as puzzles solved without hints. The game comes with a game master guide to set up and play through the adventure.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Educational, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Manchester United Starplayer Dice Game
description: 5 exciting, action-packed STARPLAYER football dice games for 1 to 8 players aged 5 to adult! Score GOALS, PENALTIES, DEFEND and WIN CUP MATCHES by rolling 5 cool PENALTY DICE and 2 super-cool FOOTBALL DICE! Keep score using the Man Utd Score Pad or collect one of the 4 sets of 5 Man Utd WIN cards featuring Fred The Red to win the STARPLAYER CUP card! Be top of the League and win the STARPLAYER TROPHY card! HOURS OF GREAT MAN UTD FUN

name: Octo Grabbo
description:
Far, far away, down in a beautiful tropical ocean there lives a little octopus named Octo Grabbo. Octo has a pink body, 8 dexterous tentacles, and one big mouth. He likes to eat delicious food, such as sea snails, fishes, crabs, and scallops. He has a good habit---he always eats each of those at dinner time. Be the first one to help Octo collect all of the different kinds of seafood, but be careful! Sneaky Octo Grabbo might grab your food, and a big shark shows up now and then!

—description from the publisher

name: Animal Silhouette
description:
Vicious cunning wolf is one step closer to this beautiful and peaceful forest. Clever brave Wang emergency search and rescue team star collection, they will do our utmost to find all the forest trapped small animals, and they take home. This is a cooperative game, all the players need to work together to win this game together. We help each other, do not let these cute little animals fall into the clutches of the wolf's oh.
just now! Starting immediately!
game rules:


dice: Throws with two dice, if dodecahedron dice a "wolf paw" pattern, the wolf before further.
Placed clues: According to two dice and letters, clues to locate the position of the plate.
Mobile search and rescue dogs, and get clues: Mobile search and rescue dogs based on the idea dice points, if the search and rescue dogs to move the plate to get clues clues plate.
Spell intact animals and animal rescue correspondence: If you turn, you or a player with another clue plates can spell an animal, each player draws a card silhouette, flip the hourglass, to find the target animal.
Search and rescue success / failure: Search and rescue success can be put together after the animals into the territory of the corresponding position, if it fails before the big bad wolf further.
game over: When the players are leveling successful 10 small animals can win, if the wolf into the forest the game failed.


—user summary

name: Fantastic Pinyin
description:
Language learning in the child stage, the contents will learn Pinyin is also in the early education process needs to overcome the problem. Absorb knowledge from the game is very suitable for a child learning, learn the alphabet as well. "Wonderful to pinyin" spelling combine the imagination and, in a playful way with children unrestrained imagination into the world, let the children play school, learn and play, teaching and learning.
When the game starts, shuffle cards, face up to initials. First three cards open on the top, then turn a card face up on the bottom of the pattern.

Children need to see the picture on the card and say imagine a combination of words, a word must be included in any of the three initials initials turn card.

Although the rules of the game that is simple, but playing it was super fun.

why? As we go into the desperate really do not know what they will say words, words often pop out does not make sense, or is very far-fetched to link the word relationship. This test more imaginative games, play with it more funny. If there is a clown among the players, they really will not stop laughing.

But when we play to distinguish between "ch"with"c"The difference between this kind of initials. Like" bed ", and is" ch "contact can not and" c "linked together, oh. We like this for a long time never learned the alphabet adults, it is easy to confuse, parents teach the course have to be careful slightly

name: Bushido: Amaruq
description:
Amaruq quickly learned to master the fierce elements of the mountains she works and serves as inspiration for aspiring hunters. Nobody is foolish enough to want to fight in hand to hand combat with the monsters Amaruq calls prey and she is adept at taking them out long before they can become a threat. In worst case scenarios when the javelins have failed there are few amongst the hunters you would rather have at your side.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Dudiko
description:
A proud sister of the House of the Long Shadow, Dudiko is an exemplar of the virtues of her house. She is able to hold her own in melee however she is more inclined to retreat in a cloud of smoke, leaving her opponents vulnerable and wary of where she will attack from next. Her smoke bombs can be useful for all in her company and she was not too proud to learn their use from those in the House of the North Star.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kimiko Hoshi
description:
Kimiko is one of the Hoshi family's Ice Witches. A Minor House, pledged to the Minimoto, the Hoshi live on the frozen peaks of the Iron Mountains and take almost no part in the politics or games at Court other houses delight in. They are closer to the spirits of the mountain and many of their daughters inherit powers over cold and ice. Kimiko ensures that the warriors of the Minimoto are not completely outmanoeuvred during combat.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and two full colour profile cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Onyomi
description:
Onyomi is considered monstrous even amongst the Oni of the Savage Wave. Onisho in her presence fight harder than ever before, proving they are worthy of being considered an Oni or perhaps merely trying to keep their kills for themselves. Onyomi is spurred on by the blood letting of the Onisho and will be driven to charging into melee alongside them more often than not finishing what an Onisho has started.

Blister contains one model, one 50mm base and one full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Crabs of the Eastern Sea
description:
The crabs of the Eastern Sea are proving to be an invaluable ally to the Jung. They swarm across the battlefeild at times merely offering themselves up as a nuisance or distraction. Often this is enough. At other times the swarms will part revealing the larger more dangerous species such as the Fiddler crabs or the Horseshoe crabs. Each has its own purpose and the most accomplished Jung leaders are able to use them to turn defeat into victory.

Blister contains three models, three 30mm bases and one full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Olympia Zehnkampf
description:
The race track around the game board has 10 stations, one for each of the 10 sports of the competition. The results are determined by a die with different rules for the various sports. For each sport the players are awarded points. The player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dooda
description:
Dooda is a card game created for enthusiasts and advocates of the psychoactive drug cannabis (weed, marijuana, hash, etc.). It contains colorful characters, funny illustrations, and with the ultimate goal of getting you "stoned" or "high" (becoming under the influence). This is accomplished by collecting the 5 cards that are needed to win.

Game Objective: Get Stoned...

This objective is achieved by the acquisition of the following 5 cards; one of each of the following: Cannabis, Rolling paper, Joint, Lighter and Stoned. The first person to "get stoned" is the winner.

name: Champ
description:
Abstract simulation of a tennis, golf, box and chess career. Each player buys sports talents to perform their career. You choose one or more trainings in the beginning by advancing (one of) the pawn(s) you bought by roll of a die. Another pawns on the same track may be thrown out when arriving on the same space. After arriving the finish line, you will be paid. You will need the money for the challenge with virtual opponents. By roll of the special die (G = "gewonnen" = you won, U = "unentschieden" = a tie, V = "verloren" you lost) you win or lose money. If you win you may fight against sports talents of other players or advance the next track by rolling a die. The money you may win or lose will be higher the more tracks you used. Game ends when all matches for the titles of all sports are won. Richest player wins.

—user summary

name: Battle Bodies
description:
Battle Bodies is a board game where players use different body parts to build a team of battle bodies to face off on an alien arena.

Players represent new Nalit Battle Master recruits, out to prove themselves in the Nalit battle arena. The Nalit is an alien race, travelling through space and time, collecting samples of different life forms from various planets, and pitting them against each other in the Nalit battle arena. Their current focus is the human race, and this is bad news for the human samples collected for the next round of battles.

Each Nalit Battle Master is required to build the best army possible to face the army of the other battle masters in the arena. The winner is the last remaining Battle Master that can deliver a full battle body to the battle field.

—description from the designer

name: Trivial Pursuit: French Pocket Edition
description:
User Summary

The French version of this game differs from the Pocket Player set both in the contents of the box and in the mechanism of the game.

While sounding like the rest of the versions for Trivial Pursuit: Pocket Player Set – TP's People, the French edition's cards are formatted in regular size (while miniature for the Pocket Player Set) and there are 200 cards (the Pocket Player Set has 240). In this French version, the question is selected by the roll of a special die, while in the Pocket Player Set uses a spinner.

Both are Trivial Pursuit, both are a pocket version of the game, but the two items are actually two separate pocketified Trivial Pursuit games.

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Ito Clan Starter set
description:
The discovery of an ancient temple dedicated to the Snake God, Orochi, has set the Ito on a course of rebellion against the ruling Takashi Clan and their allies. At home on the jungle island of Izu, they practice honeyed words, laced with poisonous flattery, while plotting the downfall of their enemies. Imbued with the serpentine skills of speed, venom and cunning, the Ito Clan are a coiled snake around the throats of their enemies, squeezing ever tighter. Renowned for their duplicity and untrustworthiness, it would be unwise to turn your back on the Ito Clan as you’ll never know when they may strike, but strike they will.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Minimoto Clan Starter Set
description:
Once allied to the Takashi Clan during the Dragon Wars, the Minimoto now have their very own ambitions. There is a strange wind that winds its way through the Iron Mountains and their home Jyoto, and whether it blows fair or foul remains to be seen, but the Minimoto Clan are nothing if not patient. Never one to seek the fineries and fripperies of court life, they are more than satisfied to spend their days' blacksmithing, fighting, and singing the Songs of the Weaponsmiths. The rulers of the Iron Mountains may be slow to anger, but they are even more reluctant to forgive.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Prefecture of Ryu Starter Set
description:
The Takashi Clan have won the right to rule the Isles of Jwar. Despite the defeat of their sworn enemy in the Dragon Wars, they find themselves being summoned to arms yet again, as the Isles are plagued by danger from all sides. The end of the war has not brought peace, as they had imagined. Demons of old, sinister cults and open rebellion from rival clans have pushed the Takashi back into the fray. They welcome it; they are born to it. With katana and kaiken, spear and shot, they lead the charge against the enemies of the Isles of Jwar.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Savage Wave Starter Set
description:
Those that have faced it call it the ‘Savage Wave’, a wave that destroys virtually everything in its path. Hordes of Bakemono from beneath the Isles of Jwar being driven ever on by the command of towering Oni whose strength is unquestionable. So too is their fury, ferocity, and strategy in battle. There is an element of extreme cunning in their ways, not brutish or bestial, but careful, considered, and otherworldly. The origin of the Savage Wave is a mystery, for how can creatures of myth and legend stalk the Isles of Jwar?

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Temple of Ro-Kan Starter Set
description:
Masters and monks from an ancient temple high up in the Ro-Kan Mountains go out into the Jwar Isles to bring light to the darkness and assistance to those who need it most. The Temple of Ro-Kan trains their acolytes to right all wrongs, and to stamp out evil wherever they may find it. Some monks have mastered the elements and bring this martial skill to bear when locked in mortal combat with their foes, while others summon powerful Kami to aid in the struggle against those that would tip the balance and destroy the ancient order of things.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: To Distant Stars
description:
This is a small press published game focusing on space combat and expansion in a remote star system.

Players are sector governors of a region known as Alpha 931 which is 15 light years in diameter. Turns are three months long.

The game is reasonably complex and the systems are essentially those of a wargame, 1980's vintage. The rule book and charts are 16 pages long.

However, the system is intriguing and has many ideas that would not look out of place in a modern game.

The game revels in obscurity. There are no graphics, no designer is credited and there is not even an indication of where the publisher is based.

Production is basic and monochrome.

—user summary
categories: Economic, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Network and Route Building

name: kiSabadulos: Pirate treasure
description:
DIY KIDS sold by HOMESCAPE is a series of escape room style educative puzzle games specifically for kindergarten and pre-school age children.

The fourth in the series is: "Pirate treasure" where enchanted map shows the route the group has to follow; at each island a quest awaits, and the sailors can only leave if successfully completed the secret ritual.

Children in groups of 1-4 (aided by an adult game master) solve a total of 9 varied puzzles to advance the story and achieve the final goal. The quest is expected to be completed in 60 minutes, and the team scores points for extra time left as well as puzzles solved without hints. The game comes with a game master guide to set up and play through the adventure.

—user summary
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Educational, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Heroes of Tersia
description:
Heroes of Tersia is a lightweight game in a fantasy setting that can be played either cooperatively (1-5 players) or competitively leave (2-5 players). It uses cards, dice, and damage counters with no game board. Some RPG elements are involved - equipping items for upgrades, dice-based combat, actions, etc.

To win, players must either defeat the boss Shayd or equip the 3 pieces of the Dragon Armor. Shayd can be engaged at any time, but players need some great equipment to stand a chance. And the pieces of the Dragon Armor can be found in the Treasure players loot from Monsters.

Players take turns and on each player's turn, they can Equip new treasure and Recharge their Action cards. They then can move to a new area or remain where they are, and finally they will attack a Monster. If the Monster is still alive, it will retaliate against the player.

Combat is decided with simple dice rolls with Attack and Defense augmented by equipment or actions. When a Monster is defeated, players who are in combat with the Monster roll dice (augmented with the Loot stat) to see how much Treasure they receive.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Set Collection

name: Electronic Arcade Basketball
description:
Each player takes 3 basketballs and places them in their court and starts the 60-second timer. Players place a ball on their shooter and flips it down to shoot the ball toward the basket on their side of the court. The game registers 2 points for every successful basket for the first 45 seconds, and 3 points for successful shots made in the remaining 15 seconds. The player with the most points wins.

Product Description:

Launch your thumbs into an intense B-ball competition!

Using the two spring-loaded catapults, finger-flicking B-ball pros get to go head to head to see who's the quickest flicker of them all.

Load the launchers with the mini basketballs and then press the "reset" button to start up the minute-long timer – Immediately the race is on!

Flick, launch, load, flick, launch - A fun sound confirms every shot you make while an electronic scoreboard keeps track of your score.

Ten, twelve, fourteen, sixteen, eighteen - Wow! You're on a roll! - But look out. Your opponent's catching up quick! - Better kick it into a higher gear.

During the last fifteen seconds, warning sounds intensify the excitement and each score becomes three points instead of two - Victory is in sight!

Whether you're starting up an extreme competition, playing a quick game of one on one, or just testing your skills against the timer, the Electronic Arcade Basketball game is quick to ignite hours of finger-sports action.

name: おーくしょんパーティ (Auction Party)
description:
おーくしょんパーティ (Auction Party) is a Japanese game.

A king of a fantasy country told the four favoured knights "Complete three quests in the next three months, and the one who earns more gold will marry the princess, and will be the next king!"The four knights hired experienced adventurers and left for the quest right away.

Auction Party! is mainly divided into two game parts (phases); the Auction phase and the Adventure phase.
In the auction phase, you bid on the characters in play and compete for them.
In the adventure phase, you will complete missions with the collected characters, using their status and skills.
Overcome the target value of each mission with the total value of the characters' status, and the die roll!

Use the special abilities of your hired heroes to survive the dungeon, beat the monsters, loot the treasure, and win the most gold over three rounds.
publisher's summary
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Taiyō Dynasties: The War of the Falling Petal
description:
"Taiyo, the life energy that passes through all living beings. Flowing through the body, it allows the daily tasks of a farmer to be completed swiftly, and the strikes of a warrior to be strong and just. The Sohei are said to be able to use their Taiyo to levitate above the trees. Meanwhile, we sages of the Great Temple can move an object through the fabric of the world, breaking the teachings of time and being.The Great Masters use their power to help the people, and seek enlightenment.

But I fear others will use it to oppress, and kill.”

- Sage Yamasakura of the Great Temple.

A Skirmish miniatures game for 2 to 4 players, Taiyō Dynasties takes place in an alternate history Feudal Japan where humans never existed and beastmen took their place. As a third great war looms over the nation of Hanani, Taiyō, the magical life force that flows through all things, has been harnessed by the clans and warriors of the land. As tensions grow between the Wafuto Imperial Army and the oppressed Atsuda clans, warlords and vagrant ronin alike seek to unlock the mysterious powers of Taiyō, and turn the tides of battle in their favour.

This box includes everything you need to play a two person game; Taiyō Dynasties is a skirmish-scale wargame, and uses very few models - keeping everything quick and easy, from the painting to the playing.

Rules and resources for the game are presented on cards, all included in the box, and decisive actions are decided through simple six-sided dice rolls. Coins are used to add resource management mechanics to the game, and lend the game a degree of tactical depth that can keep even the most competitive wargamers coming back for more.

Players can choose their warbands from the unique clans and factions of Hanani, and with their forces they will wage war for land, riches and honour. With the clash of katanas, the whistling of arrows and the incantations of ancient magic, ancestral enemies settle age-old grudges and new rivalries are born among new recruits in glorious moments.

The land of Hanani is torn apart by the War of the Falling Petal, and all must choose a side; Ally yourself with the Wafuto Imperial Army and crush your enemy with superior steel, or take up arms with the Atusda Vanguard and defend the holy sites of your ancestors with guerrilla tactics. Take the vows of the Akira yakuza, and cut deals and establish yourself within the crime syndicates operating right under the shogunate's nose. Meanwhile, the Reputan Trade Federation is open to those of a mercenary leaning, who would seek riches and treasures on the high seas, indifferent to the ideologies driving the War.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Death of Liberty
description:
Death of Liberty is a RISK! style board game played by two teams. (2-10 players)
Each team takes turns recruiting and deploying army units onto the map, invading empty and/or enemy territories, and using strategy to control as much land as they can. However, that is not the main goal of the game.

The resistance is lead by the former US President
The New Dominion is lead by Caesar

Both teams need to occupy map areas to force the enemy leader out of hiding.
Once a leader has been discovered, their player piece is now on the map, and the opposing team is given a new goal; Take over the country where the leader is located to win the game.

The game consists of 3 phases. After initial setup, there is the deployment phase; During this phase, each team will pick up new army units and place them into areas of the map they already control.

Next is the Movement/fortification phase; during this phase, Caesar mobilizes his orbital weapons, moving them around on the map to create his opening for an attack. Also, each team will fortify their defensive positions on the map.

The last phase is the attack phase; During this phase each team will make their attacks on the map, either moving into an unoccupied zone with or without opposition from the opposing team, or invade enemy territory in an attempt to take it over.

At the end of each of the attack phases, both leaders will check to see if they have been discovered. If they have, then they are placed on the map and can now be attacked during the attack phase.

The team that captures the country where the enemy leader is located on the board wins the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: エンペリズム (Emperism)
description:
エンペリズム (Emperism) is a Japanese card game for two fast players.

Two empires have been fighting for a long time. You will be the one who is involved in the struggle. Move the soldiers to defeat the emperor of the enemy country, while protecting the emperor of your country from attack.

Once you have decided on the player's country (blue or red), set up your initial hand with the emperor of the country + 3 soldier cards of the same color. The player chooses one of four actions alternately and repeats this until one of the emperor cards is discarded. If you discard the emperor card from the opponent's hand, you win!

The emperor involved in the victory condition is strong in defense, and usually can not be defeated in the middle. But the emperor will be weakened if the number of cards in the hand is less than three. So in this game it is important to keep replenishing your hand moderately, by drawing from a common deck where enemy and ally cards are mixed.

A player cannot take an enemy's card into their hand, so it must be discarded if drawn. Otherwise, you can freely add your own country or affiliation card to your hand or put it into play. Also, cards placed on the battlefield can be drawn like a deck, and if it is not the enemy's country, it is added to the hand.

A player will play tactically and try to bluff their opponent, and reduce the enemy's hand, forcing their emperor into defeat.
publisher's summary
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval

name: トライナックル エンゲージ (TriKnuckle Engage)
description:
トライナックル エンゲージ (TriKnuckle Engage) is a 2 player combat card game.

There is a win in this hand! A fighting card game in which Kakigaki and Janken are hot!

There are four characters to choose from! Make good use of the six skills (Gucho Kipa × 2)!

Take all your opponent's strength chips and win if you knock out!
publisher's summary

name: Lafayette-Opoly
description:
HOW DO YOU MAKE A GAME ABOUT THE GREAT CITY OF LAFAYETTE, COLORADO?

While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Lafayette we could into this box. It’s full of outdoor adventures, family attractions, rich traditions and of course... Old Town Lafayette - a little something for every Lafayetter! Looking for a fun way to experience the corner of Coal Country?

HERE’S A QUICK IDEA OF HOW TO PLAY! Buy your favorite Lafayette properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! GET YOUR GAME ON!

So choose your token and advance to GO LAFAYETTE! You may soon be the Mayor…or out of the game for eating too much fried chicken from The Post Brewing Co.! THIS IS LAFAYETTE.... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Monster Masher
description:
The game where monsters devour each other till only one is left.
—description from the box

Roll and move board game from the 1980s in which players first build three of their own monsters from bright pink dough, giving each a plastic head in one of four colours.

Players then move around the board attempting to capture the other player's monsters and, when they do, mashing them into their own - assimilating them into a larger and larger monster.

The player who catches and mashes all other monsters wins the game.
—user summary

name: Mix Tape: The Card Game
description:
In Mix Tape: the Card Game, you are trying to make the best Mix Tape for one of your friends, and so are all the other players. What does your friend prefer? Short songs? Loud songs? Boy bands? And what do they really hate? Disco? Romantic songs? Marching Bands? Can you find the right songs to record?

Do you spend your turn recording a song on your tape? Or do you spend your turn finding more music. Maybe you spend your turn trying to influence your friend so that they develop new preferences. Or do you investigate to find out what hidden preferences a friend has.

For every LIKED preference you can match, you gain Victory Points, and for every DISLIKED preference you match, you lose Victory Points.

The sooner you finish, the sooner you start gaining bonus VP. So time is also of the essence.

Also, which friend will you give it too? There are two friends to choose and you can only give the Mix Tape to one of them.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Global War 1936-1945: Special Operations Forces
description:
After the ‘War to end all wars’, there came another war. And it was not as static as the first. Before and during World War 2 many nations and individuals invented or exploited new tactics and ideas, that even culminated in a range of specialist forces within the specialist forces. Marines and airborne infantry were known concepts, and often from within these groups of soldiers new tactical formations emerged to perform what we now call Special Operations.
HBG is proud to present the Special Operations Forces © Expansion. Special Operations Forces were small sized units not suitable for capturing land zones. Instead their small size and unique training made them specialists in raiding operations and sabotage. They were versatile in ways of damaging enemy supply lines, facilities, fighting partisans and even occasional assassinations of high profile enemy personalities as well as spearheading large scale amphibious attacks. This type of warfare often meant certain death if caught.
This expansion enables you to take control of your nation’s special forces, often entering at the historical date of formation, and maneuver them behind enemy lines to wreak havoc or pave the way for your troops on the front. But remember, the risky nature of the operations can have them eliminated before they can fullfill their mission. It is time; “Nunc aut nunquam!”

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
