mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Global War 1936-1945: German Operations
description:
Welcome to German Operations– the Global War 1936-1945 expansion that brings historical context and focused German War Plans into your Global War game!

These plans represent a unification of military plans with national resources and in some cases, diplomatic engagement. They will be available for implementation each round and provide benefits exceeding their expense because of the combined priority efforts by military, diplomatic, and economic elements within the German Command.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Council of the Creepies
description:
Step into a "Creepified" world of Verona with Council of the Creepies, a new take on the classic card game "Council of Verona." Experience a colorful new cast of characters fighting for control of the Colosseum with brand new alliances, abilities, and agendas.

—description from the designer

name: Let's venture!
description:
Let’s venture! is a fantastic thematic collaborative game that seeks to encourage coexistence in the school context. The students form a team and undertake an adventure to find the way to the castle, where a great treasure awaits.
This game is free and comes in printable format (print and play) to be easily assembled by the students. It is suggested to the teachers in the first time that the game is used with a course, to carry out a game already printed, as an example to the students to be able to assemble quickly.

There has always been a rumor that a treasure has been hidden in the castle, and that many times people have tried to rescue it, but very few have achieved it. We have gathered our team in the camp and we should look for the best strategy to get to the castle. Can you imagine the things we could discover? What are our abilities as adventurers to get the key?
In order to reach the castle and open its magical portal, we must meet the challenges that allow us to overcome them.
The retouch that this adventure presents us is that all the team can get the treasure, for that we should get gold coins, wisdom books, diamonds, magic potions and above all enjoy, get us to know each other better and work as a team to carry out this adventure.
Can we overcome all the challenges together and get there? Let’s venture!

Let’s venture! is a fantastic thematic collaborative game that seeks to encourage coexistence in the school context. The
students form a team and undertake an adventure to find the way to the castle, where a great treasure awaits.
mechanics: Acting, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Line Drawing, Set Collection

name: Rampaging Jotunn: Winter War
description:
Ten years after the Hill Jotunn Ymir awoke, a truce was drawn amongst the Skalds of the surviving settlements, this was the year of the harshest winter in memory. Unrelenting blizzards battered the island and all was of ice. During the most savage storm, war drums were heard in the distance as three armies emerged from the near white-out of the heavy snowfall. Each army intent on conquering the unnamed island. In the distance a new shadow rises over the horizon, the dreaded Frost Jotunn Bergelmir stalks forth intent on claiming the island for his own.

Return to the unnamed island with this exciting 4 player expansion, complete with new land types, new land boards that further expand the borders of the unnamed island. There are 2 new armies, new rules for 2, 3 and 4 players, armor, weapons, new cards, new powers, and new components that expand the Rampaging Jotunn Saga... and did we mention the 2nd Jotunn?

-description from designer
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination

name: Stratégiké: Un jeu d'histoires et de stratégies avec figurines
description:
Stratégiké is a miniatures wargame for the ancient and medieval periods. Troops are classed into a number of generic troop-types and classed according to relative effectiveness.

The rules appear to have been strongly inspired by DBA and DBM.

The advanced rules add, inter alia, some fantasy troop-types like fliers and giants.

name: A Major Victory!
description:
A Major Victory are an abstract set of tabletop wargame rules (but not too abstract) specifically formulated for playing miniatures battles of the medieval period in Europe.

—description from the rulebook

Troops are classed as light/medium/heavy foot or mounted, or artillery, and further subdivided by weapon type (bows, handguns, pikes, etc.). Movement is conducted on a coarse grid, dividing the table into fifteen or so zones. Combat is resolved by rolling dice.

—user summary

name: Where is Koocanusa?
description:
By evenly combining luck, strategy and knowledge, p;layers of all ages and abilities can compete to gain 'regions' on the map and WIN THE GAME!

The object of the game is to achieve a chain of five or more 'connecting' (bordering) states territories or provinces on the map. You will need to challenge, defend, take the odd gamble and even STEAL - so beware!

On your go, you can win (or lose) any one of the 61 'regions' on the map simply by rolling two or three of the six-sided dice or by answering just one question from the card pack.

—description from the box

name: Titans of Quantitas
description:
Test your wits in an original tile-laying contest of digital deduction!

Titans of Quantitas is a quickfire cosmic duel in which players score points by creating a multiple of their secret titan number.

Players place tiles alternately to determine the colour of each segment displaying a two digit number. When a number from 0-99 has been formed the titan cards are revealed to determine the winner!

—description from the designer

name: The Mandela Effect Card Game
description:
Discover which player among the group is from an the other timeline by revealing their false memories. A carefully assembled set of 260 questions designed just for this purpose are at your finger tips. But, they might keep you from using your chosen question!

To discover who is from the other timeline, players compare memories as they play The Mandela Effect Card Game to see who remembers correctly and who is convinced that their memories are correct. No player knows who will be discovered to be from the alternate timeline until the conclusion of the game.

On a turn, Player One and Player Two will determine which of the five categories will be in play during their turn using the associated power symbols. Player One will then draw a card from the deck and read aloud the question for that category - brand names, celebrity names, history movies & TV, or music - to the Player Two (the player on their right). If the Player Two correctly states the current reality, they earn a point.

Correct or not, play then passes to the player on the right and a new turn begins. The first player to 13 points wins. The person with the lowest score is from the other timeline and should be reported to the Deep State immediately!

—description from the publisher

name: Nanadium
description:
Nanadium-it is only 7 grams used in Japan
The material of a dream of producing 10 years worth of electricity.
The synthesis of Nanadium is a top honor for scientists.
Make the synthesis a success faster than anyone and get rid of it! Nobel Prize!

Change the hand with a card draft, and make the number close to 7 with the combination of 2 cards while predicting the other hand! However, if there are players who made the same numbers, they will all be invalid! It is not okay to make 7! It is a card game that you will not only bring your own number close to 7, but you also need to predict the figures of other players, and you will want to play many times in a short amount of time with a heavy read-in balance in a minimum.
publishers: Smart500 Games (SMART500ゲームズ), 楠本舗 (Kusunoki Honpo)

name: The Tom Peters Business School in a Box
description:
This is a simulationist role-playing exercise similar to those used in classrooms.

The players in a scenario take on corporate roles (e.g., CFO, division VP) and are given random personal agendas. After briefing material is read the scenario begins with a timed discussion of the decisions required and what order to make them in. The time then allowed for each decision is determined by drawing a time card. Random events are rolled for before each discussion.

After all decisions are recorded someone goes through something like a paragraph-based game using the decisions, random events, and luck points (which were accumulated earlier). This eventually leads to a result paragraph which tells the participants how they did. A similar but simpler process is used to resolve how each player did on their personal agenda.

Two scenarios are provided:


Executives at Ford in 1968 planning a new small car model.



Executives at an imaginary technology company in 1992 planning a new CD-ROM drive.

name: Sandcastle: The Alternative History Cold War Simulator
description:
Ever wondered what it might have been like guiding a nation through the turbulent and potentially disastrous Cold War?

Choose a country or create your own in this abstract card and dice board game representing nation building, military management, leaders and innovations, events and ideological conflict.

Through the course of six rounds of play, use your nation's assets to gain influence. Events are resolved by rolling your nation's dice and potentially using leaders, innovations and starting nation traits.

Demonstrate that your ideology is superior during Clashes of Ideology.

At the conclusion of six rounds, the nation with the most accumulated influence becomes the dominate superpower and win the game!

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Modern Warfare

name: Alkohol Gedächtnisspiel
description:
It's a memory game around alcohol.
Players must match the pairs with same picture. Who has the most pairs at the end of the game is the winner.
And here is the special additional rule:
Each card has two half-tasks, each with a letter as a symbol. If now 2 cards with the same symbol (not the same picture) are turned over, the half-tasks on the two cards complement each other and the whole task has to be completed.

—user summary

name: Stratégiké: Règles Avancées
description: This supplement extends the Stratégiké rules with rules for a few new troop types, mostly fantasy but including a couple additional historical ones, as well as with troops of "exceptional" quality, which means they're excepted from normal rules in some way. For example, exceptional Chevaliers, representing cataphracts, count as of superior, ordinary, or inferior quality depending on what troop-type they're fighting.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Taboo Room
description:
Taboo Room is a game about jewel thieves trying to escape from a trapped maze. Each room in the maze has letters written on the floor, and to move between rooms you have to say a word that starts with a letter in the room you're in and ends with a letter from the room you're going to. But there's a catch - some words are forbidden, and if you say them you'll take damage.

There are two ways to win: you can be the last thief standing or you can collect three buddies. Each buddy has a category, like "food" or "sports", and you can collect them by using a word in their category. They also have effects when collected, like healing damage or allowing different kinds of movement.

—user summary

name: Hatsukoi Kao Karuta
description:
Your first love is near and dear to your heart... but can you find them in the crowd?

初恋かおカルタ (Hatsukoi Kao Karuta, "First Love's Face Karuta"), based on traditional Japanese karuta, is played with an app to guide you. The app will show a boy or girl's face, and whoever finds the matching card on the table first gets to collect it as a point.

The boys and girls all look a lot a like, but each has details that set them apart. Can you find your first love's face?

—user summary

name: Shingengo Reiwa Karuta
description:
Can you be the first to grab the new era name?

In this variation on traditional Japanese karuta, you use an app to show a made-up era name. When the name goes up you then try to be the first to slap the cards with the same kanji on them.

At the end of the game, the app will show four random real historical era names, and whoever can assemble the most of those with the cards they collected is the winner.

—user summary

name: BIX
description: BIX is a two-player card/board game where players play cards to move at least one of their pieces into their opponents golden square. Their are three types of cards; special slot, movement, and effect. Movement cards move pieces directly, while effect cards have effects that range from destroying pieces to drawing cards. Special Slot cards have a surprise effect that can be activated only in certain conditions.

name: Olympic Baseball and Softball
description:
Olympic Baseball and Softball allows you to replay any of the modern Olympic Baseball and Softball tournaments as you play to see who gets the Gold! Each team is rated for Hit ability and Run percentage. You sum up the Hit For (HF) of the attacking team and Hit Against of the defending team, divide the result by two (rounding down) and convert the result to a letter. Roll two six sided die on the Hits Table and cross the result of the roll with the letter you have found before. The number obtained is the number of hits scored by the attacking team during the game. Now check the conversion percentage of the team to see how many hits become runs: roll a percentage die (two ten sided dice of different colors, one of them for the tens digits, the other for the single digits) for each hit and if the roll is equal or below the percentage factor, it become a run, otherwise not.

Repeat the procedure for the opposing team and you'll have the final result for the game. In case of a tie, use the Killer Instinct rule.

name: ノアロン (Noalon)
description:
Noalon is a hand management game for two players in which there are only two types of cards.

The game contains an equal number of red and black cards. Each player has a hand of twelve cards and tries to work towards a winning hand. Hands are formed based on the sequence of red and black cards in your hand, so you can't freely rearrange the order of your cards. The other catch is that you draw cards two at a time, insert them next to each other, and always discard two adjacent cards.

Scoring follows this rule: a set is a sequence of N cards starting from one edge of your held cards, followed by the same number N cards of the other color. You may only use one set to calculate your score. If the leftover cards not in the set would form a set on their own then the point value of your hand is half the number of leftovers; otherwise it's the full number of leftover cards.

Points are to be avoided. You can go out if you have four or fewer points in your hand. When someone goes out, players compare hands and the player with more points is the loser, and takes points equal to the difference in points with a bonus for a perfect hand (0 points) or undercut (where the person who went out had the worse hand). The first player to collect nine points loses the game.

-- user summary

name: Aurora Partsopoly
description:
A Monopoly variant made and given out by Aurora parts of Lebanon, Indiana. Aurora distributes tractor-trailer parts nationwide, and they created this game as a promotional tool. The game plays as Monopoly, but the properties are all Aurora parts, the railroads become Aurora's distribution centers, etc. Very nicely produced for this kind of item and unique.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Rock Paper Scissors
description:
A chess-like game on a 6x6 board with each player having three pieces of each of rock, paper, and scissors - the pieces showing the respective RPS throw. Rock can take scissors, which can take paper, which can take rock. On your turn you will either move a piece three squares in any orthogonal combination except going back and forth, or drop one of your three extra pieces on any square. You win by taking four points worth of pieces. Scissors are worth two points each, the other pieces are worth one point each.

—user summary

name: Verzwickte 12
description:
Each player gets 12 numbered tokens and puts them randomly face down on the spaces of his color. Only spaces 7 and 12 are left free. Now all tokens are turned over and the game Begins.

Each turn the players move 1 of their tokens 1 space in any direction and try to get each token on the space with the corresponding number. The first player to reach that goal wins the game.

The players may use the black spaces, but not the colored spaces of their opponents.

—user summary

name: Rage-o-Meter
description:
Published by Hot Leaf House
Game Designed by Suz Li & Vii Yu
Game Art by Suz Li & Vii Yu

Story synopsis:
"GinGee Gang Gang! Let's hang! GinGee's RUN! MAN! RUN! Concert is today!"

Will these six friends be able to make it to their hangout while overcoming events that test their character? Or will they ultimately rage and cancel their plans? Can friendship be stronger than rage?

Rage-o-Meter Description:
Rage-o-Meter is a 3 to 6 players cooperative card game about anger management and the strength of friendship where the players win or lose together.

Objective:
Players are offered to choose from the six GinGee Gang Gang friends, each with their own quirks and ticks. The main objective is to make it to the bottom of the Event deck with everyone mostly intact. (The GinGee Gang Gang friends are here to have a good time at this concert after all)

Gameplay (In Brief):
After determining who amongst the players is the "Angry Friend", it is their responsibility to keep track of time/rounds and the number of explosions. Once Meeting Time is decided amongst the group, and the Travel Time is set to be an hour prior (Travel Time is flexible depending on play group). Players are then assigned one of six GinGee Gang Gang friends to play as and collects the necessary items for their hand (ex: Character Board, Character ID card and stand, 3 Snack Tokens unless the player plays as Brie, they get 4 Snack tokens, and 3 Disruption Cards).

The goal of the game is to reach the bottom of the Event Deck without Travel Time catching to Meeting Time, and/or hitting 10 cumulative explosions.

Players have 3 actions where they:

Draw an event then react accordingly (ex: Lose/Gain # of Rage, Gain a Snack Token, Add 5 minutes to Travel Time, etc.)
Draw a Chat card, roll a dice, then apply effects to the group or individuals specified (ex: Lose/Gain # of Rage)
A choice between eating 1 Snack (which helps diminish Rage) or Do Nothing


Teamwork, planning, looking out for one another, and a little bit of luck will help reaching the bottom of the Event deck with everyone mostly intact. Players should try their best to prevent themselves and each other from raging and exploding!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Population Boom! or Doom?: Sects of the Old World
description:
Players play as a faction of the Old World in a not-historically accurate Mediterranean. Each player takes turns gaining population (score) or recruitment value which increases the amount of population a player will gain at a later time as well.

Players draw cards from the top of a deck or play a card that has been discarded with three draw and discard piles to choose from (Recruitment, Espionage, or Diplomacy) At certain intervals a Boom or Doom will be drawn and a player rolls dice dictating which territories are impacted with a benefit or drawback for players located on those territories.

Additionally, events are played as well, with a maximum of two events in play that change some aspects of game play.

Once each player has taken five turns in the Age(round), the Age ends. The game is played over three Ages.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Cartomancer
description: Two players simulate a magicians battle using the 78 cards of the tarot. Player summon a small army of arcana to battle opposing cards, while replenishing their cards fields from a shared pool of sephirot. Two players simulate a magicians battle using the 78 cards of the tarot. Player summon a small army of arcana to battle opposing cards, while replenishing their cards fields from a shared pool of sephirot.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Promote Pluto
description:
Promote Pluto is a cooperative & competitive deck building game. Your goal: To make Pluto a planet again. Each player competes for Prestige by discovering and claiming objects in space while building their deck with items such as rovers, space telescopes, landers, and orbiters. Claim Pluto's moons, Halley's Comet, asteroids, and even planets to earn Prestige with the scientific community.

The player with the most Prestige becomes head of the International Space Agency, promotes Pluto, and wins the game!

(That is, if you all don’t lose first!)

—description from the designer

name: Agave
description:
A 45-60 euro style game about making Mezcal (artisan variant of Tequila)
You and another four Haciendas compite to fulfill Mescal formulas for the different companies in the game.
By rolling and manipulate the dice using money or the special abilities in your crew, you will put in work the fine machinery inside your hacienda untill all the exclusive contracts are gone.

But there is a catch, if you use single dies, everyone harvest, if you use pair or three of four of the kind, only you will harvest.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Antiquity of Mars: Chronicles of a Dying Planet
description:
1,000,000,000 years ago…
Mars was a flourishing planet teaming with life and vast seas. As the magnetic field over Mars was weakened, radiation began to dry up the seas and solar winds caused the atmosphere to deplete. As the atmosphere depleted, the planet’s ability to maintain heat decreased as well. As the millennia passed and the natural resources began to run low, the dwindling civilizations of Mars were forced to follow the rapidly shrinking seas.
There is just one natural water source left, and not enough of it for everyone. In an increasingly harsh environment, the few remaining races of Mars struggle for survival.

Overview
Players will each represent a leader of one of the six remaining races of ancient Mars. Their goal is to claim the only remaining fertile land as their own and preserve it for as long as possible. At the start of the game players can take one action in each of three categories (political, civil, and military). As the game progresses, players will expand their influence, allowing additional actions of each type. Players will use their actions to gather resources, build atmosphere factories to slow the depletion of oxygen, and train armies to fend off the other races. Each race is equipped with unique abilities allowing for various approaches to victory.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Tick Tock Time
description:
A card game of clocks and time.

A game played with 48 clock cards in 15-minute intervals, and 12 TIME cards. The player who uses all their cards first wins.

A shedding game based on clocks.

name: Trend Color
description:
Manipulate fashion trends in Trend Color to come out on top!

In the game, you secretly start with two colors (out of eight), and you want those colors to end up trending or (alternatively) be rare and hard to find so that you can score the most points with them. At the start of the game, you'll set up a trend board with 1-8 different color tokens, with spaces for those colors being paired in lines. If you end up with five tokens on the board, for example, two of those colors will be paired, while the other three will be next to blank spaces; those three colors might be paired with something over the five rounds of the game.

At the start of a round, you fill up the shop card display so that it contains five cards; each card has room for 2-5 color tokens. On a turn, you draw a color token from the bag, then place it on one of the available shop cards. If you fill the final space, you claim the card, place 1-3 of these tokens on the trend board (placing an unrepresented color in a new row and matching other tokens that already have their color present), keeping the remaining tokens as your earnings, then exiting the round. If you're the first player out in a round, you score bonus points.

If you place the fifth token of a color on the trend board, you decide whether to remove all tokens of that color or keep them where they are. If you remove them, a player can add that color to the trend board again in the future, possibly in a different row.

Once all players have a shop card, the round ends, then you refill the shop card area (leaving the lone card there in place with any tokens on it) and begin a new round. After the fifth round, the game ends and players score points: Tokens of the two colors that appear in the longest line on the trend board are worth 3 points each; tokens of the two colors in the second-longest line are worth 2 points each, in the third-longest line 1 point each, and in the shortest line 0 points each. If a color isn't present on the trend board, those tokens are worth 2 points each. Tokens of the same color as your two secret color cards are worth twice as many points as they would be otherwise. Add points for your token earnings to any bonus points you received. Whoever has the highest score has dominated the trends and wins!

name: Christmas Tree: The Decorating – Wild Ornament Card
description: This card has a wild symbol for the ornament, and is all blue on one side and all red on the other.

name: PegLeg: The Boardgame
description:
PegLeg: The Boardgame is a defense game where you are trying to survive all the crab waves without any reaching the top of the beach. To fend them off you fire your cannon with it ricocheting around to hopefully wipe out the attackers. You do this by drawing shot chips out of a bag. These you can play in any order, controlling your bounces. Once you are out of chips, you then start drawing a chip at a time from the bag, making your bounces unpredictable. Each turn you get to choose an upgrade to improve your chances. A larger hand size to control your shot? Better shot chips? or Pegs to give your cannonballs powerful effects? Each choice shapes your strategy.

—description from the designer

name: Speed Beating
description:
One day, Kuraki Mura returned home as usual, but fainted instantly after struck by a beam of light. Since then, he has paid much attention to the features of people, such as the length of hair, glasses, earrings, moles, and beards, and he's had reflex actions of beating someone on the head or dodging someone's attack.

In each round Speed Beating, one card is flipped over, and there are two features on each card. If you have the red feature, grab the hammer as soon as possible to attack! If you have the blue one, grab the pan to defend yourself! If the player with the red feature beats the players with the blue one on the head successfully, they receive 1 point. The first player who collects five points wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Extra Credit Magic Knights
description:
Extra Credit Magic Knights is a co-operative, medium-weight game in which each player takes on the role of a Magical Knight tasked with defending the city. Drawing inspiration from Mahou Shoujo and other anime, you get to take on the role of a teenager forced to balance school, living your normal life, and saving the world from destruction at the hands of the Dark Knights and their monstrous allies.

Each game you generate a character from an Ability and a Source of your power. You can then even coordinate with others to get a costume that synergizes to give you that extra edge in combat. Each of you needs to balance your Grades, Skill, and Fun, with bonuses for getting them high and terrible ramifications of them getting too low. You're going to need teamwork and friendship to have a chance!

Each week you start your plan of what you'll be doing, only for Events to arise partway through planning, potentially interrupting your plans. Manage your resources, plan for the unexpected, and prepare yourself to do battle against the dreaded enemies.

The Monsters, Events, Magical Girl Abilities and Sources, and the Dark Knights are randomized every time you play, allowing for countless possibilities!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Insuropoly
description: Reimplementation of Monopoly, featuring board game spots like Buffett Boulevard and Structured Settlements Street. Insuropoly was created to recognize employees of Berkshire Hathaway Homestate Companies and the National Indemnity Company and was used as gifts for employees. It was not sold in stores.

name: Retro Karts
description:
Boost and blast your way into first place in this throwback to your favourite retro kart racing game.

How will you win the race?

Will you cuningly boost your way into fist pace or will you recklessly blast your opponents out of your way?

In Retro Karts, players must choose their cards quickly in a pick and pass card draft. The cards you choose determines who is fastest and who plays first. But first place isn't always the best as it means your the biggest target for other players.

After the card draft players will roll any power up dice they've managed to collect (slower players tend to get more power ups). You then choose how you want to use these dice: boost or blast...just try not to crash as if you roll too many crashes you will be out of luck!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Find the Bug! Project
description:
You play an IT project manager responsible for a project team. You recruit and train project members, assign them to development and test tasks, and deliver against time, cost and quality budgets. The game can be used to teach project management but also works without its theme as an economic engine game.

Your tasks earn you victory points. The more you comply with the specific project budgets and priorities, the higher the multiplier. When a number of projects equal to the number of players have been delivered, the player with the most victory points wins.

The game board consists of a tableau of project cards and a tableau of steering group cards. The players take turns to perform one of the following tasks:


Recruit: Take one project member card.
Train: Flip one project member card to its senior face.
Assign: Assign a project member to a project.
The project member gets an ”achievement” depending on the contribution to the project (time, cost or quality).
The project gets a ”budget post” (time or cost).

Report status: Return all assigned project members. Then place a ”seat" between two steering group cards.


Once all seats around a steering group card are full, the player may call for a go/nogo meeting at a project. If approved, the project is scored and the player with achievements in it earn victory points depending on three factors:


The quality of the project (the number of bug free tasks).
The budget compliance (actuals vs budgets for time, cost and quality).
The steering group priorities (multipliers for time, cost and quality).


The challenge of Find the Bug! - Project is to build a team that is best suited for the tasks while also manipulate the steering group priorities to earn the most victory points.

The unique mechanism of Find the Bug! - Project is the tight interaction between all players. They all operate on the same projects and steering groups where one player’s achievement may ruin another player’s budget, and where even the right achievement may be ignored by the wrong steering group.

—description from the designer

name: Dyce
description:
You play a whisky trader, who buys, blends and sells whisky. You do this by setting up shops in the Scottish city of Dyce and attracting buying and selling whisky barons there. You win by having earned the most pounds at the end of the game.

The whisky is represented by colored cubes. Pure whiskies (blue, red and yellow) can be bought for 1-3 pounds, mixed into blended whiskies (green, orange, purple, and black) and sold for 4-6 pounds. The whisky is sold and bought by whisky barons. Each whisky baron has a random line of dies, telling their preferred colors and prices.

The city of Dyce contains 5x5 spaces. Take turns to place up to two items in any empty spaces.


An empty shop for the cost of 1 pound.
A colored cube, telling what you want to buy/sell in your shop.
A white cube for the cost of 1 pound, making your shop more attractive to the whisky barons.


 
When all players have passed, each whisky baron moves 1 space closer to the shop that buys or sells a preferred whisky (or, in case of a tie, the shop with the most white cubes). When a whisky baron reaches a shop, the owner buys or sells according to the current die value and the whisky baron draws and rolls a new die.

The game ends after six rounds, in which at least 1 blended whisky was sold.

The die lines simulates a random yet predictable market for the players to engage in. This adds both a time element and a spatial element to the game. Only the player who knows what, where and when to trade will blend the finest whisky of the Highlands.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building

name: Warring States
description:
The fate of Ancient China is at stake as several dynasties struggle for supremacy. As a leader of a dynasty, you must position your forces at the right time at the right state to claim it for yourself.

The Ancient China consists of 12 states, each of them surrounded by six grid points where armies may be placed. Some grid points border several states, hence making their armies more powerful. You claim a state if you have the most armies at the end of a round. You win if you claim 3/4/5 states (5/4/3 players).

Each round you compete for a state You do so by playing cards representing either two tactics (light) or one tactics (dark). Each card also represents one strategy. One light card may be played each turn together with none or one dark card. Each card played must match either a tactics or a strategy of your previously played light card.

When you pass you take the battle field of all tactics and strategies where you have a majority. Tactical battle field cards let you place new armies while strategic cards let you manipulate already placed armies. Also, an early pass gives you an early pick of new cards from a drawing row. However, it makes the remaining battle field cards easier to get for the other players.
 
When the round ends, you claim the state if you have the most armies around it. Also, all previous states are reassessed to see if the majority has changed. (Remember that an army may reach more states.) One of the battle field cards allows you to decide the next state to battle for to take advantage of well positioned armies.

The mechanism of playing the right cards and placing the armies right creates a double majority game where you must manage both cards and board to get the upper hand. Also, the fact that armies may reach more states may turn tactical losses at one state to a strategic victory as other states are claimed instead.

—description from the designer

name: Donguri Yama: Sixes and Eagle
description: Donguri Yama: Sixes and Eagle is an expansion for Donguri Yama that consists of seven cards numbered 6 and an eagle that can be any number. Shuffle these cards into the deck for a new pyramid-building challenge!

name: Actium Naval Rules
description:
Published as an article in issue #307 of Slingshot magazine, this is a fast-play set of miniatures rules for Roman and Hellenistic naval warfare.

Ships have numerical ratings for Crew (representing both numbers and skill), Hull (representing both size and quality), and Speed, plus yes/no options for whether they're capable of particularly tight turns and/or incendiary attacks. All further differences between ships are abstracted away, although the included scenario adds some back in with a special rule for non-combat grain transports.

name: Fetch Quest: Heroes of Pugmire Booster
description:
Fetch Quest is a cooperative deck-building game for 3-6 players of ages 12 and up. Playing time is approximately 60-90 minutes.

Heroes of Pugmire gives you ten new pioneers to use in your Fetch Quest games. Voltaire Vizsla and Oliver Quentin Beagle IV are both ready to take on the quest. Or, use one of the seven provided cat characters to give you games a feline twist!

—description from the publisher

Note: The detail of the description is accurate (two dog and seven cat cards) but the booster only contains nine playable cards. The tenth is a non-playable cover.

name: King of Karts
description:
It’s a race to the finish! As you and your friend's race, use items, dodge obstacles, and avoid crashing, in order to be the first to cross that checkered finish line and get the golden cup!

Players roll racing dice in order to move along the racetrack. Players also have a hand of maneuver cards that form the racing deck that will aid them in the race.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Racing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Chess
description:
Super Chess is a card-based expansion of traditional chess.
It puts a twist on the way traditional chess is played by introducing 36 unique cards. When activated, these cards spice up the game in a variety of unpredictable ways.
Cards can remove pieces (removal cards), revive pieces (revival cards), alter the positions of pieces (spatial manipulation cards), or give the pieces new abilities (ability cards).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Joyride
description: A pick-up-and-deliver game where players plan their routes through a city ferrying passengers for money. They avoid getting boxed in their routes and can use the special properties of their vehicles in order to get help them claim the spot of best performing driver.
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic Spells for ever-using
description:
The Magic Spells for ever-using Trading Card Game is a game where each player use a customized deck of certain number of cards. You make your own deck full of various items,scrolls,spells,barrier and spell-caster from the 4 regions.

The main goal of the game is to overpower your opponent. In order to do this you must fight in peaceful and static duel.

In each turn you draw a card. Then you prepare your resources and barrier yourself up, to defend from enemy spells. After this, you attack.

If your opponent health will get 0 or below you win.

name: Sorrow at Winterhaven
description:
Sorrow at Winterhaven is a tabletop boardgame for 1-4 players ages 12 and up. Players will choose 1 of 4 heroes to play, with the object being the first to find and defeat the Wendigo who is hidden in one of the twenty encounter spaces on the mountain.

The game takes place in a fantasy setting of a town called Winterhaven, nestled at the base of the mighty Mount Gitchie. Players will compete against other players, or solo, to be the first to kill the Wendigo before anyone else or the journey deck exhausts....encountering monsters, traps, and puzzles (dice challenges) along the way.

—description from the designer

name: Wutaishan
description:
Wutaishan is a 2-player abstract strategy game played on a three-dimensional board comprised of 61 spaces. The game board represents Mount Wutai.

Each player controls 12 pieces (3 monks and 9 acolytes), which begin the game in 3 groups of 4 (1 monk and 3 acolytes) at the bottom of Mount Wutai.

There are 3 win conditions:


Move a monk you control to the top of Mount Wutai.
Eliminate all 3 monks controlled by the opponent.
Connect each piece you control in a single group.

name: Rugby Options Market 1993
description:
Rugby Options Market 1993 was published by Societe Generale, a French bank, as a promotional item. It provides an original and interesting gaming angle on sports and is complementary to spread bet mechanisms.

The game is a simulation and betting system for the 1993 England vs France rugby union match, but is applicable to any rugby game or indeed any match based sport with similar scoring, such as basketball, soccer and cricket.

The game requires one player to run the market (bets, value, final scaore and options) and at least one to play, but theoretically the game can handle tens of players.

Players take a view on the likely final score, the rate of scoring, the difference between the scores and individual player perforamnce.

Rules are extensive and detailed, explaining the nature of bidding, betting and valuation of positions held by the players. A spreadsheet is recommended.

The game consists of a 36 page rulebook, a board showing player positions and an introduction to options.

Considering that the source of the design is from outside the boardgame world, there are many familiar mechanisms.

No designer is credited.

—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simulation, Stock Holding

name: SIGNAL
description:
The Signal experimental wargame is a three-player, turn-based strategy game designed to study decision-making concerning the use of conventional and nuclear weapons. The research objective is to explore how weapons capabilities shape player behavior and the resulting impacts on strategic stability and the potential for escalation in a crisis. The board game serves as both a source of experimental data and a testing ground for the ruleset and game dynamics that were subsequently built into the SIGNAL online platform.

In SIGNAL, players choose courses of action that a hypothetical nation might follow, using economic, military, and diplomatic means. Players may choose to cooperate with or compete against the other players in the virtual world to grow their infrastructure and gain resources while avoiding loss of home territory to conventional militarized invasions or nuclear war. The game proceeds in rounds, with players maneuvering their forces within a map-based environment.

Players work simultaneously, often negotiating agreements such as trade deals or military alliances, and “signal” to others by placing tokens on hexes (units of land or water). The signaling token is accompanied by the staging of cards (face down) that reflect actions like building cities, sending troops to neutral territories, or engaging in military operations, including the use of conventional or nuclear arms. There is a price associated with signaling; players pay for each card placed, regardless of whether the capability is exercised to reflect the “costly signaling” or “credible commitments” in the existing theoretical literature on deterrence. Players may then exercise their staged actions, but only at locations where signaling tokens were previously placed.

During this action phase, players take a series of turns, starting with a randomly chosen player to ensure that any given player does not have a constant first-mover advantage. After five rounds, players are ranked on a relative scale based on their infrastructure, resources, and territorial integrity to determine the winner—with a player’s cumulative performance captured on a leaderboard.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Renegades Adventures
description:
Rinnegati Adventures is a dungeon crawler of the old school that does not hide the immense importance of the progenitor Heroquest and the prodigal son Warhammer Quest.

Impersonate heroes (10 archetypes) that will challenge Dungeons made with modular tiles, facing monsters of various kinds to grab as many treasures as possible, enhance yourself and move towards increasingly difficult challenges.

The box will contain in addition to the tiles: hundreds of treasure cards, equipment, events, monster cards, artifact, 6-sided dice, tokens, maps and a Wizard's screen.

There will be adventures that will make up a campaign and a series of secondary quests unrelated to the main story for the "farming" of the characters .... not counting the possibility of creating endless stories on your behalf!

Now we come to the heart of RA: the box contain only 10 Hero's Miniatures, because the game is designed for all those (like us) who at home have boxes full of miniatures covered with dust. The miniatures of your old games will come back to life for a last and dangerous adventure with RA!

Who at home has no miniatures of orcs and goblins ... or skeleton? They will be the protagonists of RA, you can adapt your miniatures as you like without any limitation.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: The Funtastic World Of Hanna-Barbera Game
description:
Rediscover some of the most funtastic cartoon characters of the last 35 years! From Ruff and Reddy to Jonny Quest, they're all part of an innovative game that's specially designed for family play. The game features over 100 Hanna-Barbera Characters!

This game contains 16 oversized-exciting snapshots from memorable cartoons. Study a scene and then answer questions from one of the View Cue Cards.

Players earn pieces of their character's picture with each question answered correctly and the first to get all 6 pieces will win the game.

Parents and kids compete on equal terms.

name: OpozO: Battle Thrones – Game Master
description:
OpozO Battle Thrones is a SPECIAL EDITION Play System.

We introduce Opozo Line of Sight Play Tiles which are perfect for some in-game ambush play! Don’t reveal your tile positions until you need to. Ideal for concealing Play Tiles that can shoot missiles from range so if they get discovered by opponent skirmishers let your missiles fly!

On one side a Play Tile image, on the other an OpozO Line of Sight Tile design. On the game board you can choose to set up your Play Tiles image side down, hiding the play tile underneath. When you want to reveal the tile turn the tile over and use it. Opponent tiles can only be revealed if they fall into the move range of your tiles.

Will you dare to get close enough to discover what enemy awaits? What will be your fate?

—description from the publisher

name: OpozO: Battle Warlords – Game Player
description:
The starter Play System in the OpozO Battle Series, OpozO Battle Warlords is a great way to experience and explore the configure and play benefits you can expect from all OpozO Modular Play System.

Play games with 1-Play Tile Type or any combination of the 5 Play Tile Types in any number configuration without having to set up in the same way or as your opponent.

Set up with a Warlord, a Warina and a Stronghold objective board tile in your game to play with 3 different ways to win for a new strategy board game play dynamic !

Use Hill board tiles with secret paths to thwart you opponents’ attacks.

Ideal for beginners wanting to sharpen their skills before taking on bigger game board construction and challenges!

—description from the publisher

name: OpozO: Battle Warlords – Game Master
description:
OpozO Battle Warlords Game Master is the complete Battle Warlords 10 Play Tile Set ideal for those players seeker a bigger challenge. Use your Play Tiles in any combination to the create Battles you want to fight on the game boards you make.

Battle Warlords introduces a range of game board obstacles so you can play your Battle contests over difficult terrains.

Choose to play with Hills, Forest, Mountains and Water in different set ups. Use your Arrows to protect your Strongholds against Raiders.

—description from the publisher

name: OpozO: Great Sports of Great Britain
description:
Great Sports of Great Britain – brings you two of the worlds most iconic games originating on the playing fields of English Schools now played and followed by billions of us worldwide. Play Tiles are given characteristics that reflect the individual attributes of the player positions in the real games to ensure OpozO Play is just like the games you know.

OpozO Soccer 6 – explore a wide range of different ways to play games using various tiles in different combinations to deliver 3, 4, 5 or 6-a-side games. Mange your team the way you want. Use passing skills, dribbling, pull-backs and shots in combination plays to outwit your opponents in great tactical contests. Change the size of your goal posts to make for simpler or more complex games. Score a goal or send the Goalie to the benches to win – always a choice! Look out soon for OpozO Soccer Expansion so you can engage in 11-a-side games too.

OpozO Rugby 7 - Dead ball drops outs, goals and tries, jinking runs, sin bins and more. This game is all about tactics and strengths as you use combination passing moves to navigate your way to victory without ever needing to get your boots dirty and where singing your favourite songs is always an option!

—description from the publisher

name: OpozO: Great Sports of North America
description:
Great Sports of North America – brings you two of the world’s most iconic games originating in the USA and Canada now played and followed by billions of us worldwide. Play Tiles are given characteristics that reflect the individual attributes of the player positions in the real games to ensure OpozO Play is just like the games you know.

OpozO B-Ball – Air-Balls, Alley OOPs, Dunking, Jump Block, Bounce Pass, Hoops Shots, Elimination Fouls and more so you can play the game with the moves that make basketball such a great game in a strategy board game like no other! All your favourite moves in a variety of combinations to deliver a tactical challenge you will want to play time and again. Manage your team and make the plays the way you want to win.

OpozO Ice Hockey – brings you all the thrills and spills you love in your Ice Hockey game. Leg Dekes, D-Pass, Slam Shots, Howitzers, Shielding the Puck and more in combination moves requiring skill and strength. Send you opponents to the Sin Bin or to oblivion as you choose the plays and how to win. No referees in this game just hard-hitting bone crunching tactical fun where no one ever gets hurt!

Game boards are based upon 7 x 6 squares for Ice Hockey, and 7 x 5 squares for B-Ball to reflect the courts and rink size and play dynamics you know.

—description from the publisher

name: OpozO: Connect Mini
description:
Opozo Connect Mini are 2-Player Strategy Jigsaw puzzle games where you compete-to-complete puzzle shapes first. Connect Mini offers 6 unique small shape games (shapes divided into 4-parts) as standard that can be played in various ways starting on small 4 x 4 game boards. And if you want a more complex game look out for 6-part and 8-part OpozO Connect game shapes.

—description from the publisher

name: OpozO: Play Mini
description:
OpozO Play Mini allows you to play OpozO Push, OpozO Displace and Opozo Bump games on small game board formats of 5 x 4 squares or similar delivering quick to set up and play challenges you can take anywhere. And if you want a bigger game just add another OpozO Play Mini to your OpozO Tiles collection.

—description from the publisher

name: Suburban Poultry Egg Laying Competition
description:
Simple roll-and-move game designed to show early 20th century everyday life in outer suburban Australia. The game has 365 spaces where players traverse across semi rural land dotted with Victorian era housing and chicken coops.

Published by the National Games Company which is credited to have been the first large-scale Australian manufacturer of locally-designed board games.

Recorded in the National Archives of Australia, where copyright registration and exhibit is dated 1915. This particular example is also featured in the book, Australian Toys by Luke Jones (2019)

—user summary

name: San Clemente-Opoly
description:
From publisher's website:

HOW DO YOU MAKE A GAME ABOUT THE GREAT CITY OF SAN CLEMENTE, CA? While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the San Clemente we could into this box. It’s full of family fun, outdoor activities, California history and of course…surf paradise - a little something for every San Clementian! Looking for a fun way to experience San Clemente, CA?

HERE’S A QUICK IDEA OF HOW TO PLAY! Buy your favorite San Clemente properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! GET YOUR GAME ON!

So choose your token and advance to GO SAN CLEMENTE! You may soon be the Mayor…or out of the game for eating too many street tacos at Hapa J’s! THIS IS SAN CLEMENTE.... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Warpath: Operation Heracles – Two Player Battle Set
description:
An invasion force of Forge Father warriors, led by Forge Lord Ingulf Krestürsson, has taken the planet by storm. Fuelled by rumours of an ancient, mythical artefact from their past, the Forge Fathers will stop at nothing to reclaim it. However, the Corporation has its own plans for this storm-wracked world and dispatches Enforcement Protocol Group Heracles, commanded by the mysterious Forward Observer, to retake Triton at all costs. As the planet threatens to tear itself apart beneath their feet, two of the most powerful armies in the galaxy draw their battle lines and prepare to fight to the bitter end to stamp their claim on Triton's riches!

This set contains everything you need to get started with Warpath, including:

Dual Format Warpath/Firefight Rulebook
Operation Heracles Quick Start Guide
8 Command Dice
12 Plastic Activation Counters
12 Plastic Suppression Counters
4 Plastic Shield Counters
2 Plastic Tag Counters
10 Plastic Objective Counters
5 Multi-Part Hard Plastic Enforcers with Weapon Options
5 Multi-Part Hard Plastic Pathfinders with Weapon Options and D.O.G. Drone
5 Multi-Part Hard Plastic Peacekeepers with Weapon Options
1 Multi-Part Plastic Peacekeeper Captain
10 Multi-Part Hard Plastic Steel Warriors with Weapon Options
6 Multi-Part Hard Plastic Forge Guard with Weapon Options and Huscarl
1 Multi-Part Plastic Jotunn Weapons Platform

name: War Stakes
description:
Australian World War 2 roll and move game where the object is to be the first player to get 2 counters around a game board and return home to Australia via New Zealand. Players follow a path of both land and sea set through various Naval and European battle scenes which provide either advantages or penalties upon landing on them. The center of the board is a picture of King George VI. A players first counter must reach the King before his second counter can enter the game.
The graphics are interesting for their depictions of Mussolini and Hitler. There are also images of early Allied aircraft and warships such as the HMS Repulse. The game is dated 1940 (Italy entered the War in June that year and the HMS Repulse was sunk by December 1941). Publisher Unknown.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Wargame, World War II

name: Octopus Bread Shooting
description:
This action game comes in plastic packaging with the look of a instant ramen cup.

For setup just open the cup and remove the octopus bread balls, the octopus catapult, the board and the cards from the cup. Place the board underneath the cup and shuffle the cards.

Now in turn order each player draws a card with either a 1 or a 2 on it, which decides the spot on the board from where the player has to shoot the octopus bread into the cup. The number of the card is at the same time the point value. Whoever got to 5 points first is the winner of the game.

—user summary

name: hasch-hasch
description:
Each player has to get his 6 pawns from one corner of the game board to the opposite one. Movement is determined by a die. The goal of the game is to catch as many opposing pawns as possible. Pawns can't be caught on the spaces with a red border.

The game ends, when one player has got all his remaining pawns to the opposite corner and points are awarded as follows:

own pawn in the opposite corner: 2 points
captive pawns: 3 points
own pawn in the opposite neutral (dark) area: 1 point


The player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Stock Market
description:
Stock Market– stock exchange board game

- a business world strategy game

- large, rollable gaming mat, easy to care
- new way to play: no dice needed (option)
If they believe, they’ve see everything in the field of financial strategy games, here comes absolutely revolutionary way to play. Realistic, easy to play, but not too simple. Stock Exchange business is not that easy in real life also. No need for paper or other memo materials. Playing could be just as intensive and stress loaded as real life stock broker life, while waiting for the profits to come and still everything could collapse in a moment.
The game suits best for the advanced players over 10 years old. It’s a demanding product for those, who likes to dive into parallel universe of game

The Idea…
Stock Market is a reality game following the rules of stock exchange world, where assets increase is mostimportant. In this game the Players are both: brokers and investors. The Bank sells tokens used forinvesting. As in real stock market, the idea is to buy low and sell high. The rates change every turn, eachPlayers can make one or multiplied exchanges on own turn. Dice can be used to play, but usually StockMarket is played with finger marks, that determine the rate vectors. The duration of one game can bedefined by players, e.g. 40 or 60 min. The person to make most of their capital within the agreed timebrackets is the winner.ATTENTION: Dramatic turns in the body of the game can cause stress symptoms when taken too seriously.It was our goal to make this game as real as possible following stock exchange ups and lows dramas.Anyway, this is a virtual reality only. Relax and enjoy!

How to Play
To begin:Roll open Lite Lion Games rollable Stock market gaming mat. Place violet rate detectors to the mid-space, marked “0”. At least two players are recommended to be on the opposite side of eachother/other side of the table to make the finger marks drawing easier. The Players choose own colourfrom the four colours available. Each Player gets 5 pcs tokens of the corresponding colour, each ofnominal value of LL$400 of investment, and LL$2320 cash. The cash money is issued as following: 1 pcsLL$1000, 6 pcs LL$100, 9 pcs LL$50, 9 pcs LL$20 and 9 pcs LL$10. The investment tokens can beexchanged to cash in the Bank as equal to LL$400 each.The beginner can be chosen in any suitable way, as coin draw and etc. In according to the sequence ofturns, each Player has equal amount of turns per game.

The Turn

The Rate:For each turn two Players draw the number. The number is counted together on fingers of two Playersat once: The Player, whose turn in on and any other Player as agreed. The hand is hidden behind theback or under the table and when released, the amount 0-5 can be shown on fingers (as pictured). Thegross number on both Players’ hands valued 1-10 is the number of the share to move. It can go up or

down. The violet indicator is moved one step up to down to show the quote of the particular share.The position of the palm is important: if both Players’ palm is facing down, the rate decreases, otherwisethe rate increases. If both Players shows zero, the rate of each share 1-10 decreases one level. If bothPlayers show same even number, the vector of each even number share (2,4,6,8,10) is moved one step.If both Players show same odd number, the vector of each odd number share (1,3,5,7,9) is moved onestep.ATTENTION: Step and Level enjoy different relevancy. Step is one space on the rate indicator vector,when Level is a grade on the vertical vector.

Changing the Rates with Dice:The Player of the upcoming turn throws one of dice first. Numbers 3, 4, 5 and 6 increase the Rate by onestep. Numbers 1 and 2 decrease the Rate by one step. Then the Players throw two dice. The grossnumber is the number of the Share, which goes up or down. The violet Rate Indicator is moved one stepforward or back. If dice return gross number 12, all the Shares 2-11 decrease one level. If both dicereturn with same even number, the vector of each even number Share (2,4,6,8,10) is moved one step. .If both dice return with same odd number, the vector of each odd number Share (1,3,5,7,9) is movedone step.ATTENTION: Step and Level enjoy different relevancy. Step is one space on the rate indicator vector,when Level is a grade on the vertical vector. When played with dice,Shares are marked with numbers 2-11, so Share #1 equals with number11 on dice. Dice gross number 12 is equal to zero on fingers. Otherwisethe instructions are same.

Quotation changes:Quotation changes after each Trade (buy/sell) event except the firstinvestment round. As the Asset is invested, the Quotation Indicator ismoved a step forward. As the Asset is released (the Shares are sold out),the quotation indicator moves a step back. The changes take place afterthe trade event is completed. The quotation always moves one stepdespite the value of the trade event. The Quotation Indicator moves asillustrated considering steps 1-7. The horizontal step does not changethe rate. When moving downwards, the Indicator moves same, but inthe opposite direction. When Rate Level changes, the Indicator goes over green or red line.

Exchange:As Exchange Rate changes, the Player completes the Trade. Each Turn allows to make multiple Trades(Buy/Sell Events). The Player invests one or more Units into the chosen Enterprise. One non-recurringinvestment nominal value is $400.
Investment Purchase Rate:
If the Rate Indicator is in zero space (“0”), the Investment is in its nominal value of $400.
If the RateIndicator is e.g. +20, the Investor has to pay $400+$20=$420…..
If the Rate is e.g. -60, the Investment is $60 below the nominal value, so they can get a $60 refund from the Bank or buy the shares for $400-$60=$340.

The Investment token is placed to the same space with the Rate Indicator.Investment Sales Rate ProfitIf the Investment Token is in e.g. in space “0” (zero) and Rate Indicator is in space “+40”, the Investmentis evaluated $400+$40. So, the Investor gets $40 profit. NOTE: When selling shares out, the investedsum is not refunded to the Bank but stays in the possession of the Investor (the Player). The Investorgets interest from the Bank $40 for each invested unit. (?) Lost
If the Investment token is in space “-20” and the Rate is “-60”, the Player’s Investment is $40 below purchase price, so when selling, the Investor has to pay $40 to the Bank for each Invested Unit. So, the Player gains a loss of $40. The Investment token returns to its nominal value of $400 after this action.Exchange commissionThe Exchange charges a commission for each assignment. Each Investment Unit placed into Shares isdue to the brokerage of $10.

Rate Development
Top Rate
Reaching its top value, the Rate development stops. Getting a raise claim, while enjoying the top rateposition, the Rate collapse three levels down, e.g. from level +120 to level +60.
Bottom Rate
Reaching its bottom value, the Rate development gets out of control. Getting a reduce claim, whileenjoying the bottom rate position, the Share turns valueless and all the Investment have to be returnedto the Bank without reimbursement. This action forces the Rate back to zero level.

Trades Between Investors
The Players are allowed to trade Shares/Investments between each other. The trades occur accordingthe Rate levels. Reciprocal trading is not due to commissions, neither it influences the Rate. The buyerplaces their Investment token instead of the Seller´s ones, and the Seller’s tokens are returned to theBank. The Bank does not pay for the tokens as they are paid by the Buyer. The price can be also agreedin-between the parties, as in some cases singular Investor for particular Share is an advantage.

The Winner
The game is over when the agreed time period is full. As the Investments are liquidated, the Player who gains the biggest capital is the winner. The game is also over, if every Share’s Rate is in its top value. Thiscondition also enforces Investments’ liquidation.DurationDuration of one game round is subject to the number of Players.

—description from the publisher

name: Finger Fish
description:
Help the Fish to swim to the home Coral Reef safely

just a traditional diced board game, but played without a dice
large, rollable gaming mat, suitable to play on the table or ground
waterproof, easy-care and durable gaming mat
new way to play, no necessary to throw a dice
family-friendly, travel friendly
begin to play within 30 seconds!


The shoal of fish is travelling home. Get them safely to their Home Coral Reef. There are a lot of dangerous places on the route and the small fish may have to begin their journey from the Start again.
This game offers lots of fun for any age players, possibilities to develop new skills in mathematics and tactics, yet is enough simple for any member of family. Youngest players can be helped and conducted a bit to keep on the route. Our age suggestion is 3 + because of smaller parts included.
The package includes:
- Gaming mat, anti-slip bottomed polyester fabric
- 4 x 4 pcs Fish tokens (4 sets in different colors)

The Idea…
Finger Fish board game is played just as a traditional board game, but without dice. Help the Fish to swim to the home Coral Reef safely. The route goes around the playing area and through the mid waterway to Home Coral Reef. Each Player has four Fish, which can move simultaneously or one by one depending on the strategy chosen by the Player.
The first Player to get all four Fish home is the winner.

How to Play
To Begin…
Roll open Lite Lion Games family friendly rollable Finger Fish -gaming mat. The Players choose own from four available colors. Each Player gets four Fish of the chosen color and places them to the Start. The beginner can be chosen randomly, with a coin draw and etc. In according, the other players have one extra turn in the end of the game, if the beginner finishes the first. So, the game can end as a drawn match.
The Turns…
The Players move the pawns according to the numbers on the gaming area.
For each turn a random number should be drawn in between numbers 0-4. The best way is to use fingers. The number of the space to move to is indicated by amount counted on fingers of both players once shown. (The hand can be hidden behind the back or under the table and when released, the amount can be counted on fingers as shown). The gross number is the spot to go to. If both Players show same number, the pawn can be moved one more space ahead. If both Players show zero, the pawn can be moved to any space of own choice between 1-8 which is the first on the route.

One Fish in the Space
If the indicated Space is busy, … If there is own color Fish in the Space, the Players has to move any other own pawn. If it is not possible, no action occurs.

The Dolphin Space
There are helpful Dolphins, which protect Fish on the route. If a Fish is in Dolphin space, other Player’s Fish cannot enter the same space. So, the inning Player has to move some other Fish. If it is not possible, no action occurs.

Arriving to the Home Coral Reef
When arriving to the Finish lane, the Fish can get to the Home Coral Reef only with numbers 2, 5 and 7.

The Winner
The game is over when all the Fish are safe at the Home Coral Reef. The winner is the Player, who gets all their Fish to the Home Coral Reef first. The game can also finish as a drawn match, if the first Player to arrive to finish is the one who has begun the game, and the other Player finishes at the following turn.

—description from the publisher

name: Sailing Race by Lite Lion
description:
A new age board game

Played with or without dice
Large, rollable gaming mat suitable to play on the table, floor or beach sand
Fast forward way to play, no step by step snail moves
Suitable for travel, at the beach, fast to begin and not necessary to beware few drops of water


Sailboats sail downwind or move upwind, depending on wind side. Tough completion is causing bumps time to time.
But the Finish is so close!

The game suits any age. The youngest ones can be helped a bit to follow the route. Children learn some maths and logistics along the route. Fun parlour game for whole family from 4 year old.
The package includes:
- Gaming mat, made of anti-slip polyester fabric
- 4 pcs sailboat pawns, one Player can have two fleets
- Manual

The Idea…
Sailing Race is a realistic game, where the realities of competitive sailing are combined with fun of a board game. While playing, the participants learn, that a sailing boat does not always have an opportunity to move straight forward, but have to take into consideration tailwinds and headwinds, reefs and whirls to make its way to the Finish.
Player are all captains in the game, but everybody had to subdue to the winds the dice draw. The wind direction changes sometimes very rapidly, quicker that real life afford. But it is the game for fast. Dice can be used in the game but the draw can also be enforced with the Players´ hand marks.
Game duration is 10-30 min depending on the number of Players. The first one to reach the Finish line is the winner.
(picture)
How to navigate with dice:
The Player throw dice to get the number to move to.

Boats on collision course:
If the spot if occupied with other’s Player’s boat/fleet, the newcomer has to change the course. If the intersection area is busy and there is no bypass, the newcomer has to slow down and wait for new turn to move ahead. But the first to come to the intersection area should take on moving ahead rapidly: more than two turn on the same place will lead to disqualification (the boat has to start from the beginning again).

How to Begin
Roll open Lite Lion Games family friendly rollable Sailing Race - gaming mat. The Players choose a boat from four available color. If there are only two players, each player can have a fleet of two boats. In this case approximate duration of one game prolongs.
Each Player places own boat to the Start. The beginner can be chosen randomly, with a coin draw and etc. In according, the other players have one extra turn in the end of the game, if the beginner finishes the first. So, the game can end as a drawn match.
When playing with hand marks, Players are advised to be the opposite side of the table, so the moves are less clear and predictable for the opponent.

The Turns…
How to navigate with dice:
The Player throw dice to get the number to move to.

How to Navigate by fingers:
The Players move ahead according to the numbers on the gaming mat. For each turn a random number should be drawn in between numbers 0-3. The best way is to use fingers. The number is determined by amount counted on fingers of both players once shown. (The hand can be hidden behind the back or under the table and when released, the amount can be counted on fingers as shown). The gross number is the spot to navigate to. The boat can go straight ahead or diagonally toward Finish. Backward movement is not allowed. The course can be changed only at the cross of course lines: on the solid line the boat can move only straight ahead, but on intersection it is possible to navigate to the most favorable course of the possibilities open.

The Prize Spot – Finish
The Prize Spot or Finish can be reach only with drawing 1, 3 or 6. Other numbers do not allow to move to the Spot. Just as waiting for the right wind to navigate to the home harbor.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Educational, Nautical, Number, Racing, Sports

name: All Honour is Lost: Scenarios & Regulations for Wargaming Skirmishes of the First Carlist War 1833-1840
description: An 82 page Spiral bound book with a brief history of the Carlist war. A guide to wargaming the war with 21 battle scenarios. Analysis of military organizations, equipment, and foreign contingents, which included the French Foreign Legion. Introduction and Designer Notes by Michael Perry. Battle scenarios are briefly sketched, with order of battle and map graphic.

name: Alpha Quadrant
description:
A fast-paced, strategic tile-laying game of interstellar discovery and settlement.

As a newly commissioned interstellar merchant captain you are competing to scout out new worlds and markets, navigate the best travel lines, wisely gather resources, shrewdly hire crew members with unique abilities, and strategically establish bases. Race your small spacefaring trade vessel across the galaxy cleverly plan your course of the choices routes to reach the most valuable worlds while earning travel fees along vital navigation routes. Once a player has built all their bases the game ends and winner will be the one outmaneuver their rivals with more bases on sets of planets and in the longest interconnected route.

Overview of Play:
Moving through or ending a turn on a planet provides one resource cube of the matching color. Each base built on a planet is worth victory points totaled at the end of the game. Different planet colors have different values and some permit special actions. Bonus points are earned for having bases on matching planet colors as well as on sets of all three colors. Additionally, special crew members granting players unique actions can be purchased by spending resource cubes at the starting home-world tile.

When the final planet tile has been placed and that player has taken their final turn actions, the game immediately ends and scoring takes place. The winner will be the player who accumulated the most points from building sets of planetary bases. The longest connected route along interstellar navigation lines also scores a bonus and bases on rarer planet colors are worth more than common ones. The player who triggers the end of the game by placing their final base also earns 1 additional bonus point for doing so. When a player is down to just a single base, as a courtesy they should announce it to the other players.

Players move their trade vessels between stars and planets along navigation routes carefully collecting resources along the way to spend on building planetary bases.
Both ending a turn with your ship on a planet, or just passing through the planet on your travels, provides one resource cube of the matching color —either grey, red, or blue.
Each base built on a planet is worth commerce points totaled at the end of the game. But beware, building where other players already have a base costs extra and just passing through a planet with another player’s base provides them travel fees!

Points are earned immediately when a base is built on a planet. Each additional base the player might later build one the planet also scores points. But a player cannot build two of their bases directly on top of one another. They can only build another base at the same planet when it will go on top of another player’s base.
Special planets —purple, yellow, orange— offer unique actions such as exchanging resources or earning extra resource cubes. On certain planets crew members can also be hired that offer special actions to improve movement, exploration, trade, or builds.

Components:
Space Tiles - 1 start tile, 15 stellar tiles, 3 blue planets, 3 red planets, 3 gray planets, 2 yellow planets, 1 purple planet, 1 orange planet, 1 green planet, 1 nebula, 1 supernova, 1 wormhole.
5 player trade ships in five colors - blue, red, green, purple, yellow.
25 Resources Cubes in three colors - grey, red, blue.
Base Markers - 8 base markers in the five player colors.
5 scoring markers - (identical to the player base markers)
1 Score Board
20 Crew Member cards
1 Rulebook

name: TANTRA
description:
TANTRA - The sensational all Australian card game.

TANTRA has evolved from the classic Rummy family, and players of Rummy, Canasta and Samba will enjoy its fast moving style of play. Each exciting round requires players to build playing cards into the exact arrangement which appears on the Display Card controlling that round. With this Display Card, can you be first to form and lay down an arrangement like this?

Each new round is controlled by a different Display Card, drawn from the unique 44 card TANTRA pack, guaranteeing many hours of great entertainment.

This TANTRA set is ready to play, containing the TANTRA Display Card pack, a special Wild Card pack, two packs of playing cards and rules of play.

—description from the publisher

name: Terrible History
description:
Terrible History is a hilarious party card game for adults with a dark sense of humor. The game offers a new spin from similar games, where you and your friends get to the real answers the history books don’t tell us. The game is simple – one person reads a dark card asking a question about history. The other players all play the funniest card from their hand and the reader then selects their favorite.

—description from the publisher

name: A Splendid Victory!
description:
A Splendid Victory! are a traditional style, reasonably quick and easy set of wargame rules designed for warfare in the English Civil War period and thereabouts.

—description from publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: MINI-NAP 2
description:
MINI-NAP 2 are a set of table-top wargame rules specifically designed for playing a reasonably quick corps sized Napoleonic wargame using the 6 mm scale.

They grew out of my desire for a set of rules that would allow two players to play a traditional style, historically based corps sized game (of around 35 to 50 units on each side) but one that would allow such a reasonably large game as this to be played and finished within about four hours (which they do).

—description from the publisher

name: Big Chief Game Board
description:
Features a double sided game board which is used for 12 different games.
