The 12 games: Steeple Chase, Greyhound Race, From Farm to Market, Cash Money, Tractor Race, Silk Hat, Put and Take, Lucky Stars, Airliner, Indian Trail, Skating Race, and News Reporter

name: Buried Treasure: Contracts Expansion
description:
Scattered throughout the new world are powerful people looking for someone to do a little work for them in exchange for some extra treasure. Players can choose contracts, complete them, and turn them in for the specified reward. Be careful though, if a contract remains incomplete, the employer will come calling and take what’s their’s.

Contacts expand the gameplay of Buried treasure, giving players another source of income. These contracts give players a firmer sense of direction while playing the game. Players pick choose between 3 contracts at the dock or between 2 contracts at a shop and must choose at least 1 to keep. The player has until the end of the game to complete their contracts or they must pay what they were going to be paid. This new expansion can stop someone from winning if they haven't completed their contracts, effectively reversing the end of the game.

-description from designer

name: Ultra Modern Army Lists & Organisation: Volume 2
description:
This edition focuses on the Middle East, Africa, Far East, Latin America, and Intervention Forces.

Also includes notes on guerrilla and opposition forces which together with intervention forces from Volume 1 and the additional forces in this volume allows players to develope interestig campaigns from Nicaragua to Thailand.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Oh, R'lyeh?
description:
You’re Not a Cultist.
You’re Not an Investigator.
You’re an Elder Being, collecting Cultists for 'When the Stars are Right.'

Oh, R’lyeh? is a fast-paced card game where you don’t want to be the first to go out. Get revenge on other players and force them to discard. Press your luck during rituals. Once a player runs out of cards, the hand is over! Leftover cards increase your Cultist collection. Once all the Cultists are collected, the Being with the most Cultists Wins!

—description from the designer

name: ウィルスとロボの7日間 (Wirusu to Robo no Nanokakan)
description:
ウィルスとロボの7日間 (Wirusu to Robo no Nanokakan) means '7 days of Viruses and Robos', although Bots would be closer to English use than Robos.

7 days of Viruses and Robos is a cooperative game. Players control their robots to fight against hackers.

Twenty-five server cards are placed in 5x5 grid on the table. Four corners are starting location for robots where they can recharge battery and clear CPU load. Other server cards are face-down.

During your turn, your robot must move to another server. Once moved, it must move straight until it hits an obstacle (wall or another robot). The destination server is revealed if face-down. Then the server effect is applied. Depending on the server effect, your robot could be given a disinfectant, be infected, or be shut down immediately. Then the robot may create a wall between servers and/or disinfect a robot.

If your robot is infected, its CPU load increases every round. It is shut down when its CPU load is full or its battery is empty. It takes one round to recover from shutdown.

Robots win the game when they reveal Hackers' Hideout and disinfect it within seven rounds.
user summary

ぽんこつなロボがウィルスをばら撒くハッカーのアジトを撲滅することが目的の基本的には協力ゲームです。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Aetherium: House Ikaru Expansion Set
description:
House Ikaru is a global corporate behemoth. Its influence can be felt nearly everywhere in the material world and Aetherium alike. House Ikaru pioneered the AI programming that pushed deep into the Aetherium's wildest frontiers. Built on feudal principles of dynasty and conquest, the House is immortal. And now, few could possibly realize the extent of its true ambition.

Expansion Sets are a tremendous way to build an entire game-ready Collective straight away. Each Expansion Set contains 1 Avatar, 2 Functions, and 2 Subroutines – a complete and unique Collective with unique synergies ready to go.

This box contains 8 models including: Entropy (Avatar), Tengri (Function), Type – 16 (Omni 50mm base), Ketsoraki (Subroutine 2), Nimbu Drones (Subroutine 3), 5 Data Cards, 5 PAD Cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Aetherium: House Ikaru Core Book
description:
House Ikaru is a global corporate behemoth. Its influence can be felt nearly everywhere in the material world and Aetherium alike. House Ikaru pioneered the AI programming that pushed deep into the Aetherium's wildest frontiers. Built on feudal principles of dynasty and conquest, the House is immortal. And now, few could possibly realize the extent of its true ambition.

48-page full color rulebook includes the mysterious origins of House Ikaru, 3 new Operations, description and rules for all 13 programs in the faction, as well as all faction specific rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Aetherium: RezX Core Collective
description:
The RezX live on the Aetherial frontiers, once the colonial research and development arm of the mighty RexCon.

After RexCon was decimated in the First Great Trade War, RezX survived only through the quirky luck of position beyond the reach of nearly every other Aetherite. Now RezX sits on a precipice. With no more corporate tether, should RezX push further into the quantum noise or return to the Aetherial mainland and reclaim its once-proud position?

Core Collectives are the fundamental building blocks for an immediate, game-ready Collective. Each Core Collective contains 1 Avatar, 2 Functions, and 2 Subroutines – a complete Collective with unique synergies ready to go.

This box contains 13 models: Irelia Kingsley (Avatar), Dive Master (Function), Aethertect (Function), Sirens (Subroutine 5), Kraken (Subroutine 4), and the appropriate PAD and Data cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

description:

After RexCon was decimated in the First Great Trade War, RezX survived only through the quirky luck of position beyond the reach of nearly every other Aetherite. Now RezX sits on a precipice. Expansion Sets are a tremendous way to build an entire game-ready Collective straight away. Each Expansion Set contains 1 Avatar, 2 Functions, and 2 Subroutines – a complete and unique Collective with unique synergies ready to go.

This box contains 11 models: Jafar Nemo (Avatar), Klasseko (Function), Leviathan (Omni 50mm base), Grayscarves (Subroutine 5), Blackbonnets (Subroutine 5), and the appropriate PAD and Data cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction

description:
The RezX live on the Aetherial frontiers, once the colonial research and development arm of the mighty RexCon.

After RexCon was decimated in the First Great Trade War, RezX survived only through the quirky luck of position beyond the reach of nearly every other Aetherite. Now RezX sits on a precipice. With no more corporate tether, should RezX push further into the quantum noise or return to the Aetherial mainland and reclaim its once-proud position?

Auxiliary Boxes contain 1 Avatar, 1 Function, and 1 Subroutine and are designed to supplement your favorite Collective with new and extraordinary strategic options. Each Box Set includes both PAD and Data cards for all programs.

This box contains 7 models: Nigel Quartermaine (Avatar), Dzen Hotaru (Function), Aether Watchers (Subroutine 4), and the appropriate PAD and Data cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Aetherium: Rhommox Core Collective
description:
The arrival of the Rhommox into civilized Aetherial space shocked the system to its very core. These horrifying monsters were unlike anything that had ever been encountered, save perhaps the strange creatures that accompanied the RezX Aetherships. Unlike RezX’s new companions though, the Rhommox did not show affinity towards the human consciousness. Instead, they were always immediately hostile towards anything or anyone unknown and they showed no desire or ability to communicate with humankind.

Core Collectives are the fundamental building blocks for an immediate, game-ready Collective. Each Core Collective contains 1 Avatar, 2 Functions, and 2 Subroutines – a complete Collective with unique synergies ready to go.

This box contains 14 models: Mite Lord (Avatar- Omni 50mm base), Mites (3), Maldrone (Function), Incendiary (Omni 50mm base), Trojans (Subroutine 3), Replicators (Subroutine 5), and the appropriate PAD and Data cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

description:

These horrifying monsters were unlike anything that had ever been encountered, save perhaps the strange creatures that accompanied the RezX Aetherships. Unlike RezX’s new companions though, the Rhommox did not show affinity towards the human consciousness. Instead, they were always immediately hostile towards anything or anyone unknown and they showed no desire or ability to communicate with humankind.

Expansion Sets are a tremendous way to build an entire game-ready Collective straight away. Each Expansion Set contains 1 Avatar, 2 Functions, and 2 Subroutines – a complete and unique Collective with unique synergies ready to go.

This box contains 9 models: Strain (Avatar-Omni 50mm base), Sentient Overmind (Function), Moloch (Omni 50mm base), Volatiles (Subroutine 3), Dataceps (Subroutine 5), and the appropriate PAD and Data cards.

—description from the publisher

This box contains 7 models: Swarm Matron (Avatar-Omni 50mm base), Hullude (Omni 50mm base), Reductors (Subroutine 5), and the appropriate PAD and Data cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Rideshare Wars
description:
In Rideshare Wars, you are the operator of a rideshare corporation and you are competing for riders across six cities (represented by rider cards that you use to build your “market presence” tableau). There are two ways to win:

1. Collect Milestone Cards: A player wins immediately if they have earned the following number of milestone cards:

2 players - 6 milestone cards
3 players - 5 milestone cards
4 players - 4 milestone cards

You gain 1 milestone card if:

> You are the first player to have riders in all 3 zones of a city (Each city has three zones in it –Uptown zone, Midtown zone and Downtown zone)

> At end of your turn, you have at least one rider in:

Most Uptown zones (minimum 3 zones required)
Most Midtown zones (minimum 3 zones required)
Most Downtown zones (minimum 3 zones required)
Most Cities (minimum of 3 cities required)


2. Highest score: If no player wins by milestone cards, the game is played over 15 rounds (divided into 3 Phases of 5 rounds each)

Your score is calculated from the value of riders in your tableau, but only for cities you control. You control a city if you most rider cards in that city compared to other players.
Milestone cards you earned score 3 points each.
Then subtract 4 points for each loan card


—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Can You Save This Dude?
description:
In Can You Save This Dude, you are a medical scientist on a mission to save the life of a patient infected by a deadly virus. The patient could die if body temperature, pulse, or blood pressure (“BP”) to spike to lethal levels, or if the virus spreads throughout the whole body.

You have at your disposal 3 types of drugs for treating the patient:

Blue drug (represented by blue dice) which directly fights the virus (represented by red dice). But as a side effect, it causes the patient’s body temperature to rise
Green drug (represented by green dice) for managing temperature increase side effect caused by the blue drug.
White drugs (represented by white dice), being basic drugs for stabilizing blood pressure and pulse. Can also be combined into a Mega Drug which can instantly cure patient


There are 2 ways to win the game:
a) Eliminate the virus from the body (by pushing red dice off the bottom of the virus track using blue dice), OR
b)Successfully create a Mega Drug with six white dice in it and instantly cure the patient.

The patient dies and you lose the game when either:

Virus spreads and red dice reaches the “dead face” emoticon on the virus track OR
Temperature, BP or pulse marker rises and reaches the “dead face” emoticon and you are unable to resuscitate the patient


—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Jingo The Outer Space Jigsaw Bingo Game
description:
Another Jigsaw Bingo Game of the same publisher of Jingo.

Each player receives a cardboard "board" with a 5x5 grid that has variously shaped pieces punched out of it. The pieces are dumped into the middle of the table and all plays simultaneously try to be the first to fit five pieces in a row to win the round.

Winner of the round scores 10 points plus 2 points for each additional piece in their board beyond 5. All other players receive 1 point for each piece in their board. Game play continues unitl one player scores 50 points (or 100 for a longer game).

name: BRL 1192: Operation Torch and Beyond
description:
Are you ready to be one of the Rats of Tobruk? A DESERT FOX? We will provide you with the equipment. You bring your heart for this corner of history.

BRL 1192 Operation Torch and Beyond is the 7th expansion to BRL 1192: Tobruk Deprogrammed and includes new layouts, art and proper counters for the overhead infantry.

Game description of BRL 1192 from the publisher:

In the early 1970's an innovator and ordnance expert named Harold "Hal" Hock got his hands on a document unseen outside of military circles: BRL 1192 (Ballistics Research Lab, Document No. 1192). The data within became the core of the ground-breaking design, Tobruk: Tank Battles in North Africa 1942.

Years later, an MIT-grad and devotee saw the potential of reverse-engineering the 'programmed instruction' rules; the result is something that brings back the approach to tank vs. tank warfare, and keeps the approach true, creating a truly unique system of recreating the war in North Africa and beyond.

BRL 1192: Tobruk Deprogrammed is an enhanced edition of the original Tobruk; the heart of the game remains the same, but now it can be enjoyed with a deprogrammed 24-page rulebook, revised play aids, a comprehensive selection of counters representing the men, weapons and machinery of WWII North Africa, plus a collection of geomorphic maps and new terrain overlays.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: The Potion's Magic Scroll
description:
The best alchemists around the globe have reunited to brew the perfect potion!

Add the Magic Scroll' expansion to your copy of The Potion to play the new co-operative mode. Try to match the recipes on the dice in order to get rid of your ingredients. If you fail doing so, you will ruin the potion and have to start again!

Players cannot speak. They must use their deduction skills to choose the right ingredients to match what the potion requires to be brewed. Each time a player fails matching the recipe, they put their ingredient beside the bottle. Each time they succeed, they place it inside the bottle.

Win the game by having one alchemist within the group left with only one type of ingredient in hand. However, the more ingredients you put in the bottle, the better the potion you will create...
categories: Deduction, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Party Game

name: Knights of the Diamond Table
description:
Knights of the Diamond Table
Area control for 2-5 players. Place your Knights and move your Lord to control the villages.
Knights of the Diamond Table is a quick and simple area control game with hard choices and near perfect information. The game features isometric village artwork on diamond shaped tiles.

Full rules:

Play
Each turn you must perform two actions:

1: Place knights

Take between 1 and 3 Knights from your supply and place them onto one single tile on the board. You may not place new Knights - on a tile with an opponent’s Lord. - on a tile where you already hold the majority

2: Move your Lord

In the first round, simply place the Lord onto the same tile where you placed your Knights. In the following rounds you must move your Lord to another tile. The Lord must bring along between 1 and 3 Knights when moving. The Lord can not leave a tile empty, but you can move all your Knights out if an opponent has Kights on the tile. You must never move to a tile with another Lord, and always to a tile where you end up having the majority of Knights. The Lord counts as one Knight.

Game end
The game ends when all players have placed all their Knights onto the board.

Scoring
There are three ways to score points

For each tile where you hold the majority, you score 1-4 points based on the value of the tile.

For your largest area of connected tiles, you score an additional 2 points per tile.

Check your Mission card: If you have majority on the tile with the displayed building, you score an additional 4 points.

-description from designer

name: Sneaky Cards: Mission Rencontrez Goodie Card
description:
The goodie Card: "Mission: Rencontrez" simply play like any other cards.

Pass this card to someone who ends a game in a tie with you. That person gets an extra half point.

Card found in Plato Magazine 117

name: Hello. Exchange
description:
The object of game of Hello, Exchange is to ‘get through’ from the home phone by travelling through the central exchange to the telephone square without becoming disconnected or becoming engaged.

Published by the National Games Company which is credited to have been the first large-scale Australian manufacturer of locally-designed board games.

Recorded in the National Archives of Australia, where copyright registration and exhibit is dated 1923.

—user summary

name: The Green Conquest
description:
The Green Conquest is a 2 to 4-players strategy game in which players lead clans made up of vehicle drivers. The goal of the game is simple. You have to be the last player to have vehicles on the board to win.
In The Green Conquest, you'll be able to build a clan and combine the different special abilities of your vehicles to perform devastating attacks. The mechanics of the game is thus made so that an infinity of combinations is feasible. Each player will have a different way of understanding the game which will make each game unique and tactical. There is no miracle combination that can annihilate any opposing clan, and your ability to adapt and your tactical skills will be put to the test to win the fight.

—description from the designer

name: In the Grandest Manner: Napoleonic Wargames
description:
Rules for wargaming with huge armies, on large tables, over many hours, for a truly grandiose affect.


Developed for 10mm but readily adaptable to any figure scale or basing
A Command & Control system centred on the Division, reflecting the abilities of the various Napoleonic Generals
A new Morale system which allows much more variety and combinations of training and élan
A new interpretation of classic infantry and cavalry formations and capabilities
A new firing system utilising an ability as well as class system
A new Mêlée system
Reserves receive their deserved importance on the battlefield
Rule questions answered via the web along with advice on practical subjects such as terrain construction
The first part of a project with a planned series of Companion books with battles, full OBs and tabletop maps


—description from publisher

name: まやかし山 (Mt. Mayakashi)
description:
まやかし山 (Mayakashi Yama) (Mt. Mayakashi) is a Japanese card game. Foxes and racoons try to outwit each other on the mountain. The start player is the last to have seen a fox or a racoon. The game is a mix of bluff, hand management, and some take that, until one player is eliminated.

The game comes with English and Japanese rules, and both on the cards. The publisher chooses not to identify the game designers or artists, listing them only as Bodlanca.

Animals living on Mt. Mayakashi use magic and are masters of disguise. Late at night, they transform their appearance and begin outfoxing each other. The winner of this game is highly acclaimed as the best magician on the mountain.

Each player has an index card and a health card with their health shown in coloured bars from 10 to 1. As the game progresses, players lose or gain Health Points (HP) and when a player's HP falls to zero or lower, the game ends. The player with the highest HP is the winner.

The deck has a mix of attack cards, defence cards, ability cards, and cards with no effect. The deck is shuffled and players are dealt a hand of five (hand limit is seven).

The active player plays a card face-down and declares the card's name. The player may choose to lie or be truthful. If no player calls out "Doubt", the card's effect takes place (presumably it is shown).

If however a player did call out "Doubt", the card is shown now. If the player was truthful, the caller recieves 1 point of damage. If the player was false, they recieve a point of damage instead. The card effect is resolved, and then player draws a card to their hand.

If they now have more than seven cards, they discard down, and the turn moves clockwise.

The card effects are simple and evident, attack does damage, defence blocks or defers it, and the abilities are to draw two cards, or heal one point, or view another player's hand, or no effect at all.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Wintergrim
description:
Wintergrim is a turn-based strategic card game made for 1 player per card deck. The first edition includes two theme based card decks of 50 cards each, named: Spirits of Summer & Wolves of Winter. It also includes 8 green d6 dices and rule cards.

The first who arrived from the sea, called it Asheim. They discovered a land with ancient cultures, unpredictable weather and forest-dwelling humans allied with strange creatures and spirits. At first everyone was cautious... Years later, sparked by the death of an asheim jarl in a sudden windstorm, the coast dwelling warriors of Asheim make their revenging assaults over the frozen hills of Wintergrim, east through Stormshade on the spirits of Vanheim, a realm of strangely lush forests in an otherwise wintry mountain area. The time has come to seek control over the mountain dwelling creatures that seem to warm and cool the winds to the will of the spirits.

Find new areas and paths, build structures, hire workers, warriors and leaders, and use tactics and weather to your advantage. Manage economics and food supply, and capture enemy units while you defeat your opponent to gain access to more powerful units and/or other benefits like mixing your used cards into your deck. Your units can move in/out of structures, between your own areas, or to/from enemy areas by first moving to a Path. Dices contributes with the unpredictability of how long weather stays in play, how your units attack/defend in close/ranged combat, and they are used to keep track of damage to units/structures.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Worker Placement

name: 名刺じゃんけん−出会いにカンシャ! (Meishi Janken-Deai ni Kansha!)
description:
名刺じゃんけん−出会いにカンシャ! (Meishi Janken-deai ni kansha) means 'Business Card Janken - thanks for meeting!'. Deai ni kansha! is a shady phrase, which would translate to "Let's be thankful for us getting to know each other!", suggesting the satirical nature of the game. Janken is the Japanese name for Rock Scissors Paper, and is quite popular in Japan as a way of deciding things. For example, a group of several players will use it quickly to choose the start player. In this game, it means more like a way of proving your claim.

In Japan, business culture is very strict, and each salaryman has their own business card. It becomes more than a contact, it becomes a symbol, the soul of the businessman. There is a polite way to give and receive a business card. It's claimed a person might get fired for bending a card they've been handed. So the designers intentionally mock the sacred nature of business cards with this frivolous game.

The game is played with a deck of fake but highly realistic business cards (two are real). (So realistic, I walked off with one by mistake at the Tokyo Game Market, thinking it was the publisher's card). With company logos styled like Yapoo!, NYSO, Fugitsu, Noodle, the cards have names, addresses, QR codes, the lot.

Meishi Janken - Deai ni Kansha! is a game to group together more people (by their business cards) by announcing what they have in common. The game takes place at an inter-industry exchange meeting. The players each start with a hand of 4 to 6 business cards, depending on the number of players, and try to group them with other cards as potential business partners according to what the owners of the business cards might have in common. In playing the game, cards are placed face-up, and players identify common features between cards. The colours, the logos, the names of people, the addresses, any information that matches can count.

Each time you add a card to a group, state what feature the new card (that is, the person) shares with the group in addition to the features already shared among the group (so as to "deepen the ties"), and that group will belong to you. Otherwise, replace a card in your hand by discarding it in the party area and drawing a card from the deck. You can also choose to add the cards in the party area to any group. The game ends when the deck runs out and the players have used up their cards. At the end of the game, the player who has grouped the most cards wins as the "networking master".

The game is intended for humour and satire, but the publishers remind you to be respectful of people's private information, since you can use real business cards too.
publishers: Hanshakaijin Circle (反社会人サークル)

name: The Werewolf of Rivers End
description:
The Werewolf of Rivers End is a light-weight hidden-movement game where one player takes on the role of an injured Werewolf and other players take on the role of the townsfolk, who are intent on hunting down the Werewolf that has been harassing their village for years.

The townsfolk players control the set-up of the game, placing the areas the Werewolf player can search for supplies throughout the map area.

The Werewolf must keep themselves hidden as much as possible as they search and forage for supplies to help survive the night. Tough their survival, the Werewolf leaves bloodied bandages, scared residents and frightened creatures as they search structures and landmarks in the hope of finding food or potions to help them in their quest for survival.

From there, the townsfolk take on one of seven different roles all with different abilities and weapons. Their job is to track down and kill the Werewolf through their abilities that include traps, sabotage, setting fire to areas and many more. Each Villager has their own set of abilities and no-two are alike.

—description from the publisher

name: Månvalla travbana
description:
The original horse racing produced prior the Månvalla med V5 in 1970s followed by Travspel med V65 in 1980s.

Starting with 4000 Swedish crowns, you have to:

prepare some cards for each horse in the race and
bet as well for the horses not knowning what the other players prepared.


Then the race is starting revealing the cards and the bids are taken shared among the winners (via a calculation sheet).
The process is repeated several times.

—user summary

name: Bitchy Witches
description:
It's witching hour! Become the new Supreme Witch in this fun and fast-paced card game. Prepare your spells, summon spirits... Let the battle begins!

Goal of the game
To win you must earn 7 arcane points twice, both from spirits and familiars from your Arcane Inheritance, and neutral creatures in your domain.

If you manage to earn 7+ points out of your arcane inheritance and neutral creatures, you win one round. Now, remove the cards adding up to you 7 arcane game points from play and flip your witch card. The rest of the cards from your domain are sent to Limbo. Earn another 7 points out of your Arcane inheritance in your domain to win the game.

Game rounds
In each turn, you can play one spell card and then draw cards until you have 3 in your hand. You can also skip your turn without casting a spell.

There is 4 spells: Summon, Portal, Dispel and Transmutation. With that spells you will summon and move spirts, familiars and neutral creatures from the Limbo and your domain.

-description from designer

name: Der große Preis vom Nürburgring
description:
The players start on space 1 and have to get their race cars to space 100. Movement is determined by a die. colored spaces benefit or hinder the players. The first player to reach space 100 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Aetherium: Axiom Expansion Set
description:
The Axiom is a singular civilizing entity that lords over the loosely assembled remnants of Old Europe and North African territories. From the ashes of the First Great Trade War, the Axiom movement has been the salvation for nearly 1.5 billion souls in a dour and brutal future. Citizens of the Axiom worship with religious zeal the notion of order and secular progress. No matter that progress is an illusion, propped up by a large sterile governmental bureaucracy with its stringent controls and massive unwieldy propaganda machines.

Expansion Sets are a tremendous way to build an entire game-ready Collective straight away. Each Expansion Set contains 1 Avatar, 2 Functions, and 2 Subroutines – a complete and unique Collective with unique synergies ready to go.

This box contains 9 models: Commandant Spyder (Avatar), Longshot (Function), Pacifier (Omni 50mm base), Slavhacs (Subroutine 3), Venari (Subroutine 3), and the appropriate PAD and Data cards. These figures come unassembled and unpainted.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Aetherium: Axiom Auxiliary Set
description:
The Axiom is a singular civilizing entity that lords over the loosely assembled remnants of Old Europe and North African territories. From the ashes of the First Great Trade War, the Axiom movement has been the salvation for nearly 1.5 billion souls in a dour and brutal future. Citizens of the Axiom worship with religious zeal the notion of order and secular progress. No matter that progress is an illusion, propped up by a large sterile governmental bureaucracy with its stringent controls and massive unwieldy propaganda machines.

Auxiliary Boxes contain 1 Avatar, 1 Function, and 1 Subroutine and are designed to supplement your favorite Collective with new and extraordinary strategic options. Each Box Set includes both PAD and Data cards for all programs.

This box contains 5 models: Pontifect Neuholm (Avatar), Agent (Function), Triumvirate (Subroutine 3), and the appropriate PAD and Data cards. These figures come unassembled and unpainted.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Aetherium: Nanomei Expansion Set
description:
The Nanomei are an extraordinarily disparate, loosely-formed, and decentralized Collective –though even that vague description might be at once too generous and too constrictive. Nevertheless, the Collective Nanomei movement takes a singular image as its guiding principle: The Mask.

Expansion Sets are a tremendous way to build an entire game-ready Collective straight away. Each Expansion Set contains 1 Avatar, 2 Functions, and 2 Subroutines – a complete and unique Collective with unique synergies ready to go.

This box contains 13 models: The Puppeteer (Avatar), Hactivist (Function), Goliath (Omni 50mm base), Rabble (Subroutine 5), Pyro Manatics (Subroutine 5), and the appropriate PAD and Data cards. These figures come unassembled and unpainted.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Aetherium: Nanomei Auxiliary Set
description:
The Nanomei are an extraordinarily disparate, loosely-formed, and decentralized Collective –though even that vague description might be at once too generous and too constrictive. Nevertheless, the Collective Nanomei movement takes a singular image as its guiding principle: The Mask.

Auxiliary Boxes contain 1 Avatar, 1 Function, and 1 Subroutine and are designed to supplement your favorite Collective with new and extraordinary strategic options. Each Box Set includes both PAD and Data cards for all programs.

This box contains 7 models: The White Rabbit (Avatar), Cyber (Function), Defector Militia (Subroutine 5), and the appropriate PAD and Data cards. These figures come unassembled and unpainted.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Ma-Yo
description:
The players have to move 3 pawns from start to finish. Movement is determined by a number die (1-6) and a special die (+/-). If a "+" is rolled, a pawn may enter the track or advance according to the number die. On the roll of a "-" a pawn has to be moved backwards. If a "1" is rolled, the player gets to roll again. When a pawn gets on a space, occupied by an opponents pawn, the later is thrown out and has to start again.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Aetherium: Rhommox Core Book
description:
The arrival of the Rhommox into civilized Aetherial space shocked the system to its very core. These horrifying monsters were unlike anything that had ever been encountered, save perhaps the strange creatures that accompanied the RezX Aetherships. Unlike RezX’s new companions though, the Rhommox did not show affinity towards the human consciousness. Instead, they were always immediately hostile towards anything or anyone unknown and they showed no desire or ability to communicate with humankind.

48-page full color rulebook includes the haunted origins of the Rhommox faction, 3 new Operations, description and rules for all 13 programs in the faction, as well as all faction specific rules.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: PitchEasy
description:
PitchEasy is a game where you and your friends make easy creative pitches for genuine ideas. Using 30 real physical products and 90 real key phrases, there are over 80 million ideas that you could discover.

Each round starts with a FundIt card that sets out the pitching criteria for everyone. This sets out (1) how long each pitch should be, (2) the order of the cards that needs to be introduced, (3) if you are pitching on your own or as a team, and (4) the game mode - Study mode means you're allowed to look at your cards and Blind mode means that you aren't allowed looking at your cards until you start pitching.

Each player is dealt 3 Key Phrase cards and 1 Physical Product card. You then combine these cards according to the FundIt card's pitching criteria to create a new business idea.

After everyone pitches, each player votes for their favourite pitch/product idea by giving their Physical Product card to that player. The player with the most Physical Product cards ends the round and takes the FundIt card.

PitchEasy has 3 available versions:

Filtered (SFW) - May contain adult humour.
Unfiltered (NSFW) - Contains sexual innuendos and adult humour.
Filthy (Definitely NSFW) - Contains a lot of sexual innuendos, adult humour and political incorrectness.


Find your 1 in a million idea today.
categories: Educational, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Aetherium: House Ikaru Auxiliary Set
description:
House Ikaru is a global corporate behemoth. Its influence can be felt nearly everywhere in the material world and Aetherium alike. House Ikaru pioneered the AI programming that pushed deep into the Aetherium's wildest frontiers. Built on feudal principles of dynasty and conquest, the House is immortal. And now, few could possibly realize the extent of its true ambition.

Auxiliary Boxes contain 1 Avatar, 1 Function, and 1 Subroutine and are designed to supplement your favorite Collective with new and extraordinary strategic options. Each Box Set includes both PAD and Data cards for all programs.

This set contains 5 models including: Takona (Avatar), Crawler Bot (Function), Shinigami (Subroutine 3), 3 Data Cards, 3 PAD Cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Dust 1947: Spetsnaz Army Box
description:
The elite forces of the SSU Spetsnaz are seasoned veterans infamous throughout the World of Dust for their courage, tactical skills, and heavy firepower. Fielding these fierce soldiers along with their modern equipment in battle makes the Spetsnaz one of the deadliest force on the planet, one that everyone rightfully fears.

This Army Box is a great way to expand your Spetsnaz force and is awesome with Battlegroup Roza, the Spetsnaz Starter Set (SU002) and the Spetsnaz Headquarters (SU435). All these combined will give you a great army!
In this box you'll find:
- one Spetsnaz Saboteur Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Spetsnaz Kill Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Spetsnaz Sniper Squad (2 miniatures)
- one Spetsnaz Invader Helicopter (1 aircraft)
Even if these are Spetsnaz Units, they can be added to any SSU force, making it even deadlier!

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each Unit, for the Spetsnaz Faction of the SSU Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, these come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Allied Rangers Army Box
description:
The Allied Army is the largest military force on the planet, by all numbers: soldiers, tanks, walkers, planes, ships. But it's also the one that has to defend its values on the most fronts, fighting all over a World that wants Allied wealth and resources and that is jealous of its freedom. Within the Allied Army, the Rangers are special forces -elite soldiers that carry on the most difficult tasks.

This Army Box is a great way to expand your Allied Army and is awesome when paired with the Heavy Ranger Starter Set (AL008) and the Heavy Ranger Headquarters (AL141). In this box you'll find:
- one Heavy Ranger Attack Squad (3 miniatures)
- one Heavy Ranger Tank-Hunter Squad (3 miniatures)
- one Ranger Heavy Mortar Squad (4 miniatures)
- one Bulldog Walker (1 walker)
Even if these are Allied Bloc Units, they can be added to any Allied Faction, making it even deadlier!

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each Unit, for the Allied Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, these come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: USMC Army Box
description:
When all the Allied Nations joined forces to become the Allies, all their armed forces mixed into the largest military structure on the planet. Except the United States Marine Corps, who said 'no thanks, we'll remain the USMC' but welcomed everyone into its ranks. Wherever the Allies fight, the Marines are here, always on the toughest spot.

This Army Box is a great way to expand your United States Marine Corps force and is awesome when paired with the USMC Starter Set. In this box you'll find:
- one USMC Anti-Tank Squad (5 miniatures)
- one USMC War Dogs Recon Squad (5 miniatures)
- one USMC Heavy Engineer Squad (3 miniatures)
- one Barking Dog (Light) Walker (1 walker)
Even if these are USMC Units, they can be added to any Allied force, making it even deadlier!

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each Unit, for the USMC Faction. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, these come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: NDAK Army Box
description:
The elite forces of the Neue Deutsches Afrikakorps (NDAK) are seasoned veterans infamous throughout the World of Dust for their courage, tactical skills, and heavy firepower. Fielding these fierce soldiers and modern equipment in battle makes the NDAK one of the deadliest force on the planet, one that everyone rightfully fears.

This Army Box is a great way to expand your Neue Deutsches Afrikakorps force and is awesome with the NDAK Starter Set (AX002) and the NDAK Headquarters (AX335). All these combined will give you a great army!
In this box you'll find:
- one Grenadier Tank-Hunter Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Grenadier Recon Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Grenadier Heavy Mortar Squad (4 miniatures)
- one Loki Tropical Anti-Aircraft Walker (1 walker)
Even if these are NDAK Units, they can be added to any Axis force, making it even deadlier!

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each Unit, for the NDAK Faction of the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, these come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: BlutKreuz Army Box
description:
The dreaded forces of the BlutKreuz Korps are infamous throughout the World of Dust for their cunning, brutality, and unchecked use of weird experiments and cutting edge technology. Fielding zombies and laser weapons in battle makes the BlutKreuz Korps (or Blood Cross Corps) one of the deadliest force on the planet, one that everyone fears.

This Army Box is a great way to expand your BlutKreuz Korps force and is awesome when paired with the BlutKreuz Korps Starter Set. In this box you'll find:
- one Zombie Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Zombie Suicide Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Heavy Grenadier Tank Hunter Squad (3 miniatures)
- one Wotan II Laser Walker (1 walker)
Even if these are BlutKreuz Korps Units, they can be added to any Axis force, making it even deadlier!

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each Unit, for the BlutKreuz Korps Faction. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, these come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Desert Scorpions Headquarters
description:
The Desert Scorpions of the Long Range Desert Group (LRDG) are a formidable elite unit of the Allied Army, made from soldiers from every country of this grand Nation. Their hit and run tactics, supported by great vehicles and weapons, make them the deadliest opponents anyone can face, especially in the depths of the desert.

The Desert Scorpions Headquarters includes the following Units:
- Gregory & Izzy
- Marek
- Bull's Eye
- Desert Scorpions Command Squad

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, each for the Desert Scorpions Faction. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, they come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on them, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: NDAK Headquarters
description:
The Neue Deutsches Afrikakorps (NDAK) is probably the most seasoned fighting force in desert terrain on the planet. Thanks to a superb command structure, it can achieve the impossible on a regular basis. Currently fighting all over Africa, the NDAK plans to conquer the whole continent for the glory of the Axis.

The NDAK Headquarters includes the following Units:
- The Desert Fox
- Tina & Hyäne
- Panzermeister
- Grenadier Command Squad
Please note that Panzermeister comes with three different head sets.

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, each for the NDAK Faction. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, they come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on them, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Spetsnaz Headquarters
description:
The SSU' Spetsnaz special forces have infiltrated deep in Mesopotamia. The newly formed chaos of Operations Babylon, Kondor and Hellgate will be a new hunting ground for these ruthless men...
This reference includes:
- Iron Joe, the ruthless General in charge of all Spetsnaz forces in the region
- Vasiliy, the daring Lieutenant, honored with carrying the Red Banner of the Spetsnaz
- Ivan the Butcher, a legend among the force, who has returned to active duty to smash the enemies of the SSU
- and the Spetsnaz Command Squad, a special unit of five field officers whose skills are invaluable. They are equipped with automatic rifles, a machine gun and a flamethrower, and their sole presence on the battlefield can change the entire course of battle.

This item comes with five Dust 1947 Unit Cards, for the Spetsnaz Faction. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, they come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on them, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: USMC Barking Dog/Mickey
description:
Maybe the most recognizable walker on the planet today, the Mickey has given birth to a huge range of machines build on its rugged chassis. In the Pacific or the Middle-East, the Allies use a tropical version of the same chassis, whose main feature is an open top turret. The deadliest arsenal of the Mickey stays the same.
Filling a gap in the Allied armored arsenal between the Mickey (Light) and the Pounder, the Barking Dog (Light) is an excellent anti-tank walker and can serve as a close support vehicle. Its six recoilless guns fire in sequence, aimed at the same point thanks to a very advanced targeting system. The Marines’ Light Barking Dog is similar to the prototype tested by the Army, but has an open-topped turret for better vision and cross-country performance. It is probably the most popular walker in the Marine Corps’ arsenal.
This reference allows you to field one of these two walkers.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Smugglers
description:
Smugglers is a humorous retro-style board game set in the late 1980's, where players smuggle goods in old cars between Norway and Sweden. During the game players choose missions with low, medium or high risk/reward, and move on a network of roads using dice. Players can buy helpful items such as a punch card for access to a safer and shorter route, nitro for additional speed, and a trailer for moving more cargo pr. run. Speed is key to outrun the police, and to reclaim stolen cargo/money from hijackers. There's also items for bribing both police and customs personnel, a possibility otherwise determined by dice. The more beaten up a car is the more it increases the chance of getting noticed at the border, so outer damage should be fixed when possible at a repair shop. Damage to the vehicle or cargo, finding extra money, and many other good or bad situations are determined by dice, as well as cards with thematic and often comical descriptions. After 4 rounds consisting of 30 turns each, the smuggler with the largest fortune on a secret bank account is the winner!

The game's retro-style isn't only due to its late 80's setting, but also because both game-play and components (one-colored cards and tokens) are in line with a release from a simpler era in board games. Such homages are often seen in electronic games, so instead - here's one in board games.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dear Leader: Presidentiapocalypse 2017
description:
Find out what our future President will do when their golf courses are threatened by a cannibal incursion, the milk delivery is hijacked on the way to the Bullet Farm, and oh man oh man, your daughter is so, so hot. The hottest. Because what's more fun than a dismayingly dark future in which everything we love is threatened by uncertainty? It’s a Dear Leader hack set in a (what was imagined at the time to be unthinkable) near future of the U.S.A.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game, Political

name: So You Think You Know Cats
description:
So You Think You Know Cats is an educational family game. There are cards, divided into 3 categories, with a total of 900 questions and answers. Players roll dice to see which category (either Breed, General, or Rare/Exotic) question they must answer and how many points the question is worth. The player may keep going until an incorrect answer is given then play passes to the next player going clockwise. The first player to 250 points wins the first place ribbon. To make the game more challenging, the point total may be increased or the questions may be asked without giving the multiple choice answers when they are present.

—user summary

name: Zheng He Goes to the West Coast
description:
Starting from a city state in Mesopotamia, you expand your empire to every corner of the Old World, and finally set sail to invade the Americas. The entire history of the human race is replayed within an hour.
You roll dice and fill the numbers in the blanks on your world map. Choose your dice cleverly, as the rest are used by the other players.

—description from the designer

name: Rifles, Railroads and Rebellions: Fast Play Wargame for the American Civil War and Later 19th Century Conflicts
description:
Rifles, Railroads and Rebellions is based upon C’est la Guerre: Fast Play Wargame for the Age of Muskets. This system was designed to provide a fast yet satisfying game play, not necessarily a “realistic” simulation of battle recreation. Bases or ‘Units’ in the game do not represent a certain number of men or artillery pieces but are abstract representations of force.

Rifles, Railroads and Rebellions uses

- a simple command structure to manage battlefield movement without dealing with morale or having the players issue orders,

- a troop grading system so that better trained more effective troops can have an advantage over poorly trained less effective troops, and

- a method to account for casualties and losses without an overly complicated accounting system.

Rifles, Railroads and Rebellions is an abstraction. A Unit in the game does not necessarily equal a particular organizational unit, formation in the field, or a specific number of soldiers. Each base is a representation of force, and as such issues such as the size of one battalion, regiment, brigade, or squadron should be set aside. The player should concern himself with tactics such as troop placement, command access, gun placement and terrain features. The goal is to recreate the “feel” of the period, not necessarily every detail of it.

-description from publisher
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: ピザオク (Pizza Auction!)
description:
ピザオク (Pizaoku) Pizza Auction! is a bidding game with a theme of eating pizza.

In a round, players secretly choose a pizza card, place it face-down and declare which type of pizza they are baking (they may tell a lie). Then they simultaneously place their bid on a pizza card they want.

If only one player has placed on a pizza, that player takes it. If there is more than one player on a pizza, the auction continues until all but one player passes. If no one bids on a pizza, the player who baked that pizza takes it.

You are eliminated if you are forced to take total of 9 or more quarters of pizza.
You win the game if you have accumulated 4 quarters of the same type without being eliminated.

プレイヤーはお腹をすかせたピザ好きの食いしん坊たちです。

このゲームは3つのステップを繰り返します。
1)ピザを焼く
2)ピザオークション
3)ピザを食べる

同じ種類のピザを、1ホール食べたプレイヤー、もしくはポテトを3個分食べたプレイヤーの勝利です。
publisher's summary
publishers: Camellia Quintet (かめりあクィンテット)

name: Cultist/Occultist
description:
Cultist/Occultist has you taking on the role of either trying to save the world from utter destruction, or trying to usher into it your dark god from beyond time and space. This is a social deduction game where there's more to do than just figure out who is on the other team, you also need to strategize to stop them!

Each turn of the game will have the players collectively trying to start or prevent a ritual from taking place. The leader of the ritual will determine which one to attempt This is done by contributing different components to the ritual that will either aid or hinder its attempted effect. Be careful though! Too many failed ritual attempts can have another bad effect.

Each ritual slightly alters the fabric of reality, and can change how the game itself plays. Some rituals will make future rituals easier to pass, while others will give certain players new abilities and things that they can do. Between this and different Great Old Ones, no two play-throughs will be the same.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Uncaged: Brazilian Jiu Jitsu Starter Deck
description:
Tap, Nap or Snap. The Choice is Yours.

After rising to dominance following the first UNCAGED tournament, Brazilian Jiu Jitsu master Rei has gone missing. With another tournament on the horizon, who will take his place representing the gentle art? Enter 3 of his pupils, all seeking to prove their mastery!

The Uncaged: Brazilian Jiu Jitsu Starter deck can be played stand alone out of the box, or combined with other UNCAGED decks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Uncaged: Kung Fu Starter Deck
description:
Flow like water.

Three Kung Fu experts have arrived at the Uncaged tournament to represent their ancient martial art! Behold Eagle, Monkey and Mantis! A deadly dance of fists cementing Kung Fu's rightful place on the world stage!

The Uncaged: Kung Fu Starter deck can be played stand along out of the box, or combined with other Uncaged decks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Uncaged: Training Gym. Deck Building Essentials
description:
It's time to step up your game.

Get back in the gym and hone your fighter's skills with this booster set of punches, kicks, submissions and takedowns. Be ready to inflict some serious damage standing or on the ground. But remember, the only fighting style that matters is yours!

This is not a standalone product. Use your Training Gym to customize or build your own Uncaged: World Fighters deck.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Super Tic Tac Toe
description:
Two player game played with different colored pegs on 4x4 grid of holes.

"Each player uses different color pegs. The object of the game is to get your pegs of the same color in a square in all four corners, four in a row up and down, across, or diagonally at the same time try to block your opponent from scoring a Super TTT first... Just like ordinary Tic Tac Toe but a lot more fun."

From the simplicity of the game it would seem to mean a square of pegs in a 2x2 grid location. An interesting variation might include any geometric square.

name: Trains & Cargo
description:
Collect cargo, load it onto your train, then send off the train to score points based on the market values of the cargo at the time. Lower the values of your opponent's cargo while keeping what is on your own train high, upgrade your locomotive to pull longer trains, steal and sabotage, and choose a route to send your train along to score bonus points.

Trains & Cargo is a strategic, casual board game for 2-4 or 6 players, individually or in teams. There are two types of locomotives, eight types of cargo (coal, timber, corn, cars, steel, food, cattle and passengers) and three Route Boards that you can claim to score bonus points.

Each turn you may choose to either play cards from your hand, upgrade your locomotive, or to send off your train to score points for the cargo it holds. There are three types of cards and you may play up to one of each type on any given turn: Cargo Cards to collect cargo from a central bank, Market Cards to increase or decrease the values of specified cargo, and Effect Cards with various text-based abilities.

Things to consider when playing Trains & Cargo include what cards to combine for maximum effect, how long to wait until you send off your train, if you should wait for a specific route to become available or choose a different path, and more. The game is entirely free of play money which means that getting a head start early on does not mean a certain win - you are limited by the cards in your hand, not the money in your bank.

—description from the designer

The Railroads of Bornholm is a member of the 18xxx series of games. 1899+1 is set on the Danish island Bornholm. Here the railways came late (in 1900) so that explains the name of the game. You can call it 18Born if you don't like the pun.

Two, three, or four players represent investors in railroad companies, spending their initial capital to purchase shares in railway companies. The companies, each controlled by the largest shareholder, build track and run trains to earn revenue. These can be paid out as dividends to shareholders to retained to fund further track and trains. A key feature of 1899+1, as with all other games in the series, is that the interest of the President and the interest of the shareholders are not identical, so minority shareholders need to be careful with their investments. Being a President is not without its difficulties, either; bailing out an insolvent company is the sole responsibility of its President.

1899+1, while short by standards of other members of the series, is a fairly long game. Experienced players can expect to take up to three hours to complete a game.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Producers & Consumers
description:
An exciting way to learn about producers and consumers! Producers and Consumers is an educational game designed to teach the basic economic concepts of production, consumption, bartering and specialization to students in grades 1-3.

Each player draws a card depicting a profession and gets several resource tokens related to their job. On the back of their card is their goal--the resources they must collect to win. Players must then trade to try to collect all the resources they need. The first player to collect all the necessary resources wins.

The game can be played at three levels. At level one, resources are plentiful and all players should be able to complete their cards with simple one-to-one trades. At level two, some resources are scarcer and some players have a smaller supply, so one-to-one trades may not be sufficient to complete cards. At level three, there are not enough resources for all players to complete their cards, so competition for some resources may be fierce!

name: Funnybones
description:
5 small plastic pieces which are tossed from the hand to play several different games. The boxed game includes a rules sheet and a small drawstring bag to hold everything.

The plastic pieces are shaped like "knucklebones" (astragalus) and are in 5 different bright colors.

There are 25 games or challenges in the rules. The games would involve things like tossing the 5 pieces from palm and catching them in palm. Or tossing them from palm and catching them on the back of the hand.

—user summary

name: Fly Guy's Buzz Words Game
description:
Fly Guy's Buzz Words Game is an educational game allowing early readers to practice sight words.

The game comes in a "trash can" with a 3D Fly Guy character on top. Players are dealt a hand of very small blue cards with common one-syllable words. The same words appear on a deck of red cards.

Players take turns drawing a card from the red deck, reading the word aloud and then trying to make a match with a blue card they hold. It they match, they yell "Swat!" and put the matching cards back in the can by dropping them through Fly Guy's mouth.

If the active player cannot make a match, other players have an opportunity to match the drawn red card in the same way.

The red deck also includes "Lose a Turn" and "Give 1 Card to Any Player" cards. The latter allows the current player to give one of his blue cards to another player before taking his/her turn normally.

The first player to throw all of his or her cards into the garbage buzzes to victory.

name: Pirate Quest
description:
A quick, engaging game of treasure hunting with a twist!

Welcome to Pirate Quest! Be the Pirate Ghost, create the treasure island by laying down cards randomly, and then hide the treasure. Then follow the actions of the other pirates as they try to find the ultimate treasure chest.

Stop them, confuse them, move them around the island, and gather their willpower in order to release your captured soul!

In Pirate Quest one player is the ghost of a long forgotten pirate captain who tries to stop the other pirates finding his ultimate treasure chest. The players will move around the randomized island trying to dig and figure out where the chest is. Every action they take fills the Will power of the ghost. If they cannot find the chest in time, the ghost will be released and everyone will lose. But if one of them finds the chest, he or she will be the winner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Memory, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Vettrip
description:
The objective of the game is to have fun remembering knowledge, intuiting answers and learning new things about health and animals. The game consists of advancing through the digestive system of the snake that translates into the question posed. Advance or backward in the function of the squares bet on hearing the statement of the question.

The estimated time for a game is 1-2 hours. It is suitable for any age, but it is not suitable for children under 10 years of age.

The 400 cards that contain the game allow hours of entertainment without repeating any question.

name: Dust 1947: Steel Guards Headquarters
description:
Steel Guards are some of the most formidable fighters on the planet. Their half-robotic bodies makes them very hard to kill, allowing them to gain incredible combat experience. And among them are a few that are even more formidable: Master Sergeant Guaï-Lo Moloï is one of them. The third human on the planet (and last one alive) to ever be encased in a Steel Guard armor, he has seen action in every part of the World. His armor has been heavily modified to his specifications, making him a fearsome sight on the battlefield.
Officers of the Steel Guards Command Squad direct their comrades on the battlefield and are formidable warriors in their own right. They have seen and been through the worse, many times. There's nothing on the planet they can't handle.
This Headquarters reference includes this Hero and this Command Squad.

This item comes with two Dust 1947 Unit Cards, for the Guards Army Faction. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Pounder/Hot Dog
description:
The Mickey chassis has been the first walker ever available for the Allies Bloc, thanks to the cunning of Joe Brown and the incredible engineering skills of Rosie Donovan. The first models were equipped with regular tanks weapons, that are still incredibly effective on this new chassis: the dreaded Pounder mounts a powerful antitank gun capable of dealing with any armored threat, while the Hotdog's massive flamethrower ravages with flame whole areas of the battlefield.
This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, for the Allied Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: USMC Headquarters
description:
When the Allies Bloc was formed, all armed forces joined the grand Allied Army. Well except the United States Marine Corps who said thanks but no thanks. We're going to keep our name and our traditions and we'll welcome anyone who wants to join but we're going to remain the USMC.
This Headquarters reference includes three Heroes and the USMC Command Squad. The Heroes are Machete Mack, a brilliant Officer; Crazy Jimmy, an incredible walker pilot; and Frank, a deadly fighter.

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, all for the USMC Faction of the Allies Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Heinrich Tropical/Hermann Tropical
description:
Quick and agile, the tropicalized Panzerspähläufer chassis is a staple of the Neue Deutsches Afrikakorps armored forces. It can mount an impressive array of weapons while retaining an incredible speed on the battlefield.
This reference allows you to assemble one of two variants. The Heinrich (Trop) is equipped with powerful antiaircraft guns, also efficient against light armored targets. The Hermann (Trop) is armed with coupled laser guns capable of destroying any tank or walker. Both variants also have a machine-gun to deal with infantry threats.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the NDAK Faction of the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Desert Scorpions Starter Set – Taskforce Shaun
description:
The Desert Scorpions of the Long Range Desert Group have arrived to fight for Freedom and gain a definitive upper hand in this Endless War. Their presence will surely have a great impact on the World's events, as they form one of the most seasoned military formation in the Grand Allied Army. Coming from many countries where citizens just want to be freed or protected from tyranny, the Desert Scorpions are deadly foes.

Taskforce Shaun includes the following units:

Shaun (one Hero)
The Desert Scorpion Assault Squad (5 miniatures)
one Tank Hunter Truck (one vehicle)


Everything you need to start a new glorious Desert Scorpions Army is included in this box! Please note that the Dust 1947 Starter rules, a durable neoprene gaming mat, terrain, dice, etc. are included in this Starter Set.

Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, they come already assembled and primed. They're ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over them, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Desert Scorpions Kill Squad
description:
Reinforcements have arrived for the Desert Scorpions! The Kill Squad is here to provide unique skills and abilities to fight for Freedom and gain a definitive upper hand in this Endless War. Its presence will surely have a great impact on the battlefield, using overwhelmingly Phaser firepower to destroy anything on the battlefield that is not in the air!

This reference comes with its own Dust 1947 unit card. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Murder on the Cosmic Express: Upon Further Examination
description: Upon Further Examination is a small expansion that adds six new weapon cards (3x gun, 3x rope) and three new characters (Hacked Security Bot, Doctor, and Ambassador), allowing the game to be played with up to 9 players.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Blades and Spirits
description:
2019 Summer One Page PnP Contest Entry

(contains references to drinking; if that bothers you the game is probably not for you)

The end game is simple - end up with more fingers left on your hand than your opponent. Battle against one opponent to drink your spirits the fastest by rolling dice and playing cards. Simple, easy-to-learn game play; very transportable to take wherever.

—description from the designer

name: 1D Girl Talk: The Game
description:
Grab your friends and take center stage to prove you're 1D's number one fan!

Answer trivia questions, perform actions or complete dares to add cool 1D souvenirs to your collection.

The first player to complete her collection wins the VIP backstage pass... and the game!

Will you be the first to complete your game card and make it backstage?
categories: Children's Game, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Pro Jockey
description:
Pro Jockey is a game for 2-6 players or "Jockeys" from the age of ten upwards which brings into the home all the action and challenge, the triumphs and the disasters of the increasingly popular sport of National Hunt racing. All the features that combine to create the atmosphere of excitement that surrounds a big race at Aintree or Cheltenham have been provided - good or soft going, handicapping, horses can fall and good jumping and riding earns its rewards. Even after the last fence is jumped, the result is not clear and all the excitement of steeplechasing carries on until the winners and placed horses are past the post.

—description from the rulebook
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dust 1947: Heavy Grenadiers Headquarters
description:
Officially designed schwer SturmGrenadiere KommandoTrupp, the Heavy Grenadier Command Squad leads Heavy Grenadiers forces into battle, directly from the front line. The squad is equipped with three squad sized support weapons, two Maschinengewehr 44 Zwilling (twin-linked MG44Z) and one Fliegerfaust, taking advantage of the incredible strength their armor gives. It also has an array of radios to relay orders around the battlefield. Although part of a Command Squad, these men are very capable of taking the fight to the enemy. These are seasoned soldiers before anything else! With them come the formidable warrior that is Lieutenant Lara Walter. One of the deadliest Hero in the World of Dust, she greatly boosts the offensive capabilities of any Heavy Grenadier Squad.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, for the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Devastator / Punisher II – Super Heavy Walker
description:
The Devastator and the Punisher II are the two heaviest walkers found in the Grand Allied Army... and on the planet! These gigantic towering beasts strike fear into any pilot or soldier who faces them in combat. Their destructive power is unmatched, as well as their survivability on the battlefield. This is the true might of the Allies.
This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the Allied Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Eysenhudt: Gotteslehrer & Hauptmann
description:
Eysenhudt is an historical and atmospheric board game, which absorbs you right into the middle of the German Peasants' War (about the year 1525 – the doorstep between the late Middle Ages and the early Modern Era).

As for now, Eysenhudt is available for free as a PnP (Print & Play) game. Look for all the stuff in the Files section.

As a minor leader of the revolutionary movement (in a rather remote theatre of that war) you conduct all sorts of tactical and strategical operations – all with the aim to steer your troops in the best possible way through the excited and exciting (though perilous) times.
Each round a player chooses one of the six basic Offices: Go, spread the word of the Reformation as a »Prediger« (Preacher) to make the countless »Thorps« (villages) more valuable for the revolution's cause (and to score Victory Points on top of that). As a »Rottmeister« (~ corporal) win over those Thorps – they are your (and your fellow player's) supply bases in food and units. As a »Trossweibel« (Whore's Sergeant) increase the storage volume of your wagon trek to store and transport your Food Barrels and various goods. Gather food as a »Proviantmeister« (Furir) and store the barrels in your wagons. Deploy new units (of various military and diplomatic uses and worth in Victory Points) as a »Werber« (Recruiter). And as a »Beutemeister« (~ purser) you might also want to visit one of the various markets where you can trade your booty into all sorts of useful equipment. These six basic Offices are closely linked together. More variability and depth (historical and tactical) are added by the »Eysenhudt Cards«, which can be chosen instead of an Office. Those cards represent tactical or strategical orders from your captain: Anthonius Eysenhudt.
