If the players get all the garland on the tree at each level, plus the shiny yellow star, they win.

In Trim the Tree players cooperatively play cards to add elves to the tree in order to add garland/tinsel around it. Each level of the tree requires support of like-minded elves, indicated by the color of the card. Finish the garland at all levels before the card deck runs out, or you took too long and the family wakes up and you lose.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Uproot: Arboreal Battleship
description:
A botanical space opera of epic-scale card battles. Command one of seven asymmetric factions as they compete for control over the universe and hunt for the legendary battleship Uproot. These massive tree ships are grown on your home planet and sent off into the galaxy - players must choose between growing massive fleets over several turns or sending off single ships to quickly gain control of neutral planets. The first to capture three planets wins, though as new territories are discovered, so too are new and exciting victory conditions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Chimú
description:
Chimú is a game inspired by the ancient Chimú Culture in Peru. It is a Memory-Game for 2-4 People.

It consists of 24 two-sided stones with one of four symbols on each side.

Goal: Try to find all 12 stones (3 per color) with your symbol on one side and turn them face up. Once all your symbols are lying face up, you win.

—description from the publisher

name: The Music of Erich Zann
description:
Based on the H.P. Lovecraft short story of the same name with gameplay based on The Ravens of Thri Sahashri this is a 2 player game taking around 20 minutes.

Strange tunes filter through the floor from the garret room above as Erich Zann plays his fiddle all night. But Zann knows not the tunes he plays and the Listener hears them only in his sleep. Neither of them know that they open gates to terrible and hungry dimensions. If they can together master the tune before the threshold is breached then Zann can undo what he has done before it is too late.

Players take turns playing asymmetric roles. The Listener places cards into a puzzle tableaux in an attempt to provide Zann with the notes that he needs to complete his tune. If they believe the tunes sufficiently learnt they can break into Zann's garrett room. Too early and the tune will simply find another player, too late and all that is and ever will be are swallowed by the void.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: WordScout Wiz
description:
The super fun Fast Pace Words Card Game for the entire family.​
Use your letter cards to build words and win the game.

Content:
85 Playing Cards [each with 1 letter]
Rules and Game Variations

—description from the publisher

Players are dealt 5 cards each, 10 cards make a face-up stock pile, and the rest of the cards make the face-down draw pile. In a turn a player makes a word, if possible, using cards in their hand and the top of the stock pile; if they can, they keep all the cards of that word in a separate pile; the turn ends by drawing a card whether or not they made a word. The round ends when a player spells a word with the last stock card; the winner of the round is the player with the most cards won. The overall winner is the first player to win 3 rounds.

Rules for 10 different rules variants are included.

—user summary

name: Fali Ti 1 Papir
description:
An educational game about business paperwork.

The goal of the game is to found a company. Players roll dice move their pieces on a path, which contains fields with questions about business and economy. Correct answers allow players to go forward. The winner is the player who first reaches the end of the path.

By playing the game, players learn how to solve paperwork issues and how to run a business.

—user summary

name: Heroes of Hedra
description:
Heroes of Hedra is a quick dice game that uses a standard set of polyhedral dice (RPG dice) to pit players against each other in a free-for-all battle of luck and skill. The base rules are freely available, and the game was conceived to be played before or during a tabletop role playing session, while everyone has their dice out.

Using their dice, which represent six heroes with unique abilities and one mighty dragon, players attempt to defeat their opponents' heroes to control battlefields and score points. Dice have varying levels of power, that, combined with their abilities, encourage strategic play and positioning as well as carefully thought-out risk taking.

All-in-all, Heroes of Hedra is a quick, fun game that can be played many times in a sitting, or as single quick game to pass the time, but has more strategy than one might expect.

—description from the designer

name: Jumble Chef
description:
Cooperative game for little ones. Players collect ingredients to cook dinner for guest. They must do it in time by his arrival to win.
For one game players choose 3 dishes they will cook. There are 20 fields with ingredients in enviroment on one side and ready dish on another side in the game. Players put 3 fields into the box ingredients side up and start a round. There are tasks for each dish how many ingredients they must collect.
Players roll 3 marbles on a field taking turns. Player gets ingredient if marble stops on this ingredients zone.
Guest makes one step each throw. If guest made 21 steps before all 3 dishes are cooked dinner is failed. If dinner is ready players win.
There are dishes with different quantity of ingredients to choose complexity.

—description from the publisher

name: Last Pup Standing
description:
Last Pup Standing is a puppy themed card game for 2-5 players. The goal of the game is to use puppy power to defend your bones and be the Last Pup Standing. There are three kinds of cards. Bone cards are your health in the game, when you run out, you're out of the game. Puppy cards are used to destroy other players' bones. There are also several special cards in the game that you can use to defeat your opponents.

—description from the designer

name: Squirrel Wars!
description:
Squirrel Wars! is a game of quick wits and quicker action!
Battle your friends in a struggle to be the Last Squirrel Standing, or hoard away enough acorns and
find the Golden Acorn (there’s only one!) to win.

Place a Tree Base in each of the marked spaces in the corners of the board.
Place one Tree Standee in each of the large squares on the play area.
Each player takes a health bar and sets it to 10 (once it hits Zero you're dead!)
Shuffle and place the Chance Deck on its marked space to the side of the board.
Place the Acorns within reach of all players.
Each player selects a squirrel type and mini, and places it on a square adjacent to their chosen Tree Base.
Roll 1d6 each, the player with the highest roll goes first, and play passes to the left.

ACORNS:
Acorns are a multi-function resource.
They can be used as ammo if you find a Slingshot, can be used to heal while drinking from the fountain, or in conjunction with the Golden Acorn you can collect 50 acorns to win the game (ONLY works if you also have the Golden Acorn card.).

THE GOLDEN ACORN:
Only one exists in the game, and it is hidden in the Chance Deck, you must hop around to find Chance Squares (golden outline) and test your luck to find it.

ACTION POINTS.
Each player starts their turn with 6 Action Points (AP).
These determine how many spaces you can move, and how many Actions you can take during your turn.

ATTACKING:
Roll the Combat Dice to determine whether you hit successfully, and how hard.
Your opponent can choose to roll defensively, but they must score the same or higher to block your attack.
Once you hit Zero Health - You're out of the game unless someone pulls the Night of the Scampering Dead, or you have enough acorns to burn for a once-only resurrection!

CHANCE CARDS:
If you land on a Gold Square, you must draw from the chance deck.
You must read the card aloud, and follow the directions on the card BEFORE continuing your turn.
E.G ‘You drop and break your acorn!! Lose 1 Acorn’
There are Three main types of cards – Boon, Bane and Surprise! cards.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Stock Holding, Take That

name: Duelin' Dungeons
description:
Dueling dungeon is a game of quick reflexes and pattern recognition.
For 2 players.
Player 1 is the Adventurer, Player 2 is the Monster Master.
Players take turns laying cards from their respective decks, creating a path through the dungeon.
Each piece shows the path, various twists and turns, each player must beat the combination of symbols on the previous card to keep building the dungeon.
If there is a tie, it can be resolved with a powerup from your Tie Breaker deck!
The Adventurer wins by successfully escaping the dungeon!
The Monster Master wins by trapping the Adventurer in his throne room!

Current art is prototype, the final iteration of the game will be a refined version of this artwork.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Moonstone: Shadow Glade Troupe box
description:
This troupe box includes 3 fairy heroes of Dominion fraction.
This miniatures are made in fine quality resin. Every miniature requires assembly.

Butterfingers is a fairy that can evade enemy attacks and push enemies away using magic.
Wasp is a fairy solder that is extremely skillful with the buckler shield and healing by damaging enemies by the darts.
Silvertongue - rogue and trickster. Have some mind-control abilities.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Word Whizz
description: Choose one of 30 word wheels. Players have two minutes to come up with as many words as possible from the combination of letters on the word wheel. Players must use the letter in the center of the word wheel within every word. Each word must be at least three letters long. Each player receives one point for each word, an additional point for a word of six or more letters, and ten points if all nine letters of the word wheel is used in a word.

name: Snowball Fight
description:
Characters square off in a ruthless, last-man-standing free-for-all, of winter fun! The game plays like a tabletop miniatures game, but everything you need is in one deck of cards and it only takes 15 minutes to finish. Run, Throw, and Duck the throws of your friends.

The base deck contains three characters, their respective action decks, double-sided terrain cards and video-game-like pickup cards to spice up the play area. The cards determine available actions, success or failure, and describe the trajectories of movement and projectiles. Manage your hand and deck to set up the strongest throws and eliminate your opponents.

—description from the publisher

name: Building Cities
description:
Building Cities is a game for 1-4 players, a modern city simulation where you can build, manage, expand and maintain your own city!

It offers many challenges, both in single player and multiplayer versions.
You will have 10 turns to build road tiles or buildings, according to the Engineer's Handbook and your Bank Account, and at the end of your turn you will draw and Event Card.
The 200 cards you will find in the game box are divided into Objectives, Events and Challenges.
Objectives will be used only at the beginning of the game (the same goal for every player, E.g. Build 12 Offices, a Legendary Building and the Airport), Events are the cards that you will draw at the end of each round, Challenges, finally, will be cards drawn every 4 rounds after the creation of the second District, a sort of Event Cards but more cruel (E.g. Some criminals stormed up a cargo ship. Remove a ship if you don't have a Task Force card to cancel this Challenge)!
The single-player version it’s a pleasant pastime, moreover, you can become familiar with the game mechanics, road construction (curves, intersections, straights) and with the placement of buildings in the most strategic and useful way (where will we put the Police Station? And the Hospital? And if their range doesn’t satisfy the whole districts?).
In fact, you could find yourself in some unpleasant situations, where, a faulty District might preclude you some possibilities! Or, even worse, making lose you the goals!
In multi player mode, imagine a situation where 3 mayors join forces against one, literally making it out to the sound of Challenge cards, or excluding him from trade routes or even blow a Legendary Building out of his nose during the auction, (perhaps useful for completing a goal)!
It will also be possible to play in teams, 2vs2, and see which of the two teams manages to make 1 of their mayors stand out before the opponents. And... What if someone betrays his coalition? You decide how to play, the rules leaves you carte blanche!
There’s another way called Fair Play Mode, where players decides to play without "throw a monkey wrench in the works". Who, first, completes the goal revealed by the card drawn at the start of the game, eliminating the auction for Legendary Buildings, will win the game.
Building Cities has very high replayability, where every game will be different from the previous one!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Heimweg
description:
The night is dark. Five frightened passengers stare through the foggy windows while the car crawls slowly through the unknown area. It seems these parts of the woods were untouched by civilization for a couple of decades. The headlights just barely light up the winding roads and lead the vehicle deeper into the darkness...

Heimweg – the German word for “the way home” – is a story-driven cooperative dice-game for 1 to 5 players. Each player takes the role of a passenger that holds a dark secret. The players win together when their ride reaches its destination. But beware: the players need to reveal their dark secrets, watch out for car trouble, navigate through the unknown forest and try to keep the engine running.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Brücke Auf Brücke zu
description:
The aim of the game is to get as fast as possible from the city to the island with his pawn and then back to the city with the corresponding pawn from the island. Whoever masters this fastest wins.
To get around, there are different means of transport available besides "running". Police agents, bridges and stops are inserted as obstacles.
The engines are various dices that affect the means of transport or obstacles.

Ziel des Spieles ist es mit seinem Spielstein möglichst günstig/schnell von der Stadt auf die Insel zu kommen und mit dem korrespondierenden Spielstein entsprechend von der Insel wieder zur Stadt. Wer dies am schnellsten bewältigt, gewinnt.
Zur Fortbewegung stehen neben "Laufen" auch unterschiedliche Verkehrsmittel zur Verfügung. Als Schikane sind Schupos, Brücken und Haltestellen eingefügt.
Als Motor dienen diverse Würfel, die die Verkehrsmittel bzw Schikanen beeinflussen.

name: Der kleine Rabe Socke: Suche nach dem verlorenen Schatz
description:
In Der kleine Rabe Socke: Suche nach dem verlorenen Schatz (The Little Raven: Looking for Lost Treasure), players set up the game by scattering the "treasure" tokens around the deck.

During a round, players turn over cards one by one, and as soon as you've seen a treasure a second time, you can grab that item and place it in front of you. If that item is revealed again before the end of the round, though, you're eliminated from play that round! Once the round ends, players score 1-3 points depending on how many treasures they've collected. Whoever has the most points at the end of three rounds wins!

name: Spin: Away Game
description:
Simple space themed game where players spin a top and attempt to knock down small wooden pins. The pins are placed on top of images of sputnik satellites that form an orbiting ring around an image of earth. The Satellites each have a value.

Each player, in turn spins the top in the center of the box, attempting to knock over as many pins as possible to accumulate the highest score. The player with the highest score is the winner.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Space Exploration

name: Ραντάρ
description:
Pantap (Radar in Greek) is a Greek electronic space board game from the 1950s where the board has two playing areas. One half has a Radar control panel and the other half is images of multi-staged rockets.

Two players each have wired playing pieces (electrodes) that the Radar player places in a choice of holes. The Rocket player places his electrode into holes located along a designated rocket. The connections then light either a red, yellow or green lamp. If a red lamp lights up the Radar player has destroyed a stage in a rocket. If yellow or green light up the Rocket player receives points.

The Radar player wins if he can destroy all the rockets by making the right connections. The rocket player wins if he can reach 100 points before his rockets are destroyed.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Space Exploration

name: Kill Die Repeat
description:
You are sucked into a portal and awake in an arena in a different world. But you are not alone. Several other fighters from different universes wait for your arrival. Then chaos ensues.

Try to survive in this fast battle royal game for 3-8 players and be the last man standing. Put on top of that player elimination with a twist and let the fun begin.

If you don't like to fight bare-handed, use your action points and try to move over the arena floor as fast as possible. Grab items to better attack and defend yourself and best of all seek cover behind the few obstacles.

Kill Die Repeat uses an attribute-driven dice fight system. Every character has different attack and defense values as a special action to him. Upgrade him with equipment to boost your values. All characters additionally gain cosmic power every round that can be used to further boost one standard action or for executing a special action.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: DVolleyball
description:
Dvolleyball closely resembles the real volleyball with his numerous possibilities. A player should know volleyball's basics to play DVolleyball.

In this game, volleyball sequence such as serve, pass, sets... are present Players will have to make decisions and will have to face randomness.

name: Let's Face It
description:
Each round, a player spins the spinner to choose an opponent to Face Off against. During the Face Off, a card will be revealed and both players in the Face Off will have five seconds to pose themselves to express what is written on the card.

Players who are not part of the Face Off choose the winner who gets to move their pawn closer to the finish line. Spaces on the board can cause the player to lose a turn, move their pawn forwards or backwards, or cause a Rematch.

The first player to cross the finish line is the winner.

name: Galactic Rage
description:
Galactic Rage is a science fiction board game based on strategy, diplomacy and conquest for 2-5 players.

Each player takes the role of a General controlling the forces of one of a number of unique races inhabiting a universe whose balance is threatened by a ruthless entity known only as The Empress. Each player starts the game with a limited supply of resources and military units in their base and it is up to them as to how they develop their strategy to have a chance of become the dominant force in the universe.

The game has 5 different paths for players: Quests, which result in stronger ground forces, raids can improve your space fleets effectiveness, trade will benefit income, espionage enables you to steal from your opponents and tactics give military advantages on the field of battle. You can become a master of one approach or take a more balanced approach and combine a number of such tactics.

The game is played across 4 different galaxies and 32 unique planets, each one giving different advantages and challenges to each player.

—description from the designer

name: マッドリック (MADRICK)
description:
マッドリック (MADRICK) is an occult-themed 2-player abstract game. Pick a dark god and a set of unique special skills to try and capture the Witcher between two Villagers. A shared deck of action cards allow you to move the Villagers, Witcher, and Goddess in order to earn 'SAN' tokens. Your four unique dark god skills will let you further manipulate the board in order to manoeuvre the characters into a scoring position.

Each turn you will play two action cards from your hand to move the game pieces around the board, taking note of the pieces' special abilities like 'Block', 'Override' and 'Directivity'. Time your actions right in order to pin the Witcher on your side of the board and score a 'SAN' token!

The publishing team chose not to identify indivdual designers or artists.

name: マッドリックーネクロマンス アポカリプス (MADRICK:  Necromancy Apocalypse)
description: マッドリックーネクロマンス アポカリプス (MADRICK– Necromancy Apocalypse) is an expansion for the game マッドリック (MADRICK). It enables a third player to join the struggle.

name: 榎コロ拡張 (Eno Koro Expansion)
description:
榎コロ拡張 (Eno Koro Expansion) is an expansion set to 榎コロ (Eno Koro), breeding Eno, a mushroom-like creature.

I received a reward from the director, as an excellent researcher. This time, a reliable assistant will help you, and new experimental methods have increased!
Let's work hard to breed more 'Eno'!

'Eno' will breed more intensely by using new breeding methods and the power of various assistants.
Who completes the best Eno breeding theory!?

優秀な研究者であるあなたに、所長から御褒美をもらいました。
今度は頼もしい助手が力を貸してくれたり、新しい実験方法が増えました！
より沢山の「エノ」を繁殖させる為にいっぱい研究に励みましょう！
新しい繁殖方法と、様々な助手の力を使う事でより激しく繁殖する「エノ」達。
最高の「エノ繁殖理論」を完成させるのは誰だ！？
publisher's summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Sontaran Squad
description:
Hailing from the planet Sontar, the Sontarans are a clone race of soldiers, literally bred for war, whose greatest pleasure is to see the destruction of other races.

These military-minded villains are all near-identical in appearance. Small in stature, with large heads and stocky bodies, they are dressed head to toe in body armour, making them a formidable foe.

Sontarans absorb pure energy through their probic vents on the back of their necks, but this can also be their achilles heel. A Sontaran can be stunned or killed when their probic vent is penetrated by a sharp object.

Several incarnations of the Doctor have encountered and defeated these galactic troopers, who never stand down and live only for the honour of victory, or at the very least, an honourable death in battle.

This expansion adds Sontaran Squad to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five Sontaran miniatures, four Sontaran faction cards, and six new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Dominators
description:
Having been separated from their fleet, a lone Dominator spaceship arrives on the peaceful planet Dulkis. Navigator Rago and his second-in-command, Probationer Toba, are accompanied by their robotic servants, the Quarks, who round up slave workers from the planet's pacifist inhabitants. Needing to refuel their vessel, the Dominators begin drilling into the surface of the planet, where they plan to fire their rockets into the molten core of Dulkis, then drop an atomic-powered seed pod which would turn the whole planet radioactive.

When the Second Doctor, Jamie and Zoe arrive, they are unable to persuade the Dulcian leaders, who believe violence is never an option, to retaliate. Assisted by the rebellious native, Cully, the Doctor steals the seed pod from the drilling site, smuggling it on-board the departing Dominator ship. As it takes off, the pod explodes, destroying the alien invaders with their own weapon.

This expansion adds Dominators to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes two Dominators miniatures and three Quark miniatures, two Dominator and one Quark faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Kiddyland
description: A simple roll-and-move game designed for children who are unable to read, but are able to tell different colors apart. Gameplay resembles a simplified version of Candyland: Players select a colored movement pawn, then take turns rolling a die with various colors represented on it to see where they move their pawn. The player who reaches the end of the path first wins.

name: Der kleine Rechenkünstler
description:
The players have to get their pawn from space 1 to space 300. Movement is determined by a spinner. The spinner indicates two numbers, wich are added to determine the number of spaces, the pawn has to move forward. If a pawn gets on a space with a picture and an arithmetical task (based on the number of the space), the meeple has to be moved forwards or backwards accordingly. The first player to reach space 300 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Honesty Stone
description:
Honesty Stone is a bluffing game for 2-5 players, a party game to enjoy with family and friends.

Players must be honest without telling a lie - if they are revealed to be a liar by other players by using honesty stone they would be out of the game.

The game is simple and easy - players have three Jewels each, and each turn players guess the color of another player's Jewel. Different color Jewels have different effects, allowing players to reject a guess, exchange stones, or make more powerful guesses. Using an effect gives your opponents clues as to what color stone you have. Assuming you are telling the truth.

The player who keeps the color of their Jewels hidden until the game end wins.

Based on the designer's book, Whispers of Hemmingbird.

name: Monkey King Chess
description:
Monkey King Chess by Peter Gelman is a chess variant with a main board representing Earth and two small boards representing clouds, 44 squares total. In it, the Monkey King fights the Goblin King in a theme with oriental influences.

The Earth board includes a river which influences play. Forces are asymmetrical, representing mythological forces including sea dragons, celestials and mountains.

The object of the game for the Monkey King player is to move his Pilgrim off the opposite side of the board; a winning move would be any Pilgrim move from row 8 off the board. The object of the game for the Goblin King player is to checkmate the Pilgrim. As with Sittuyin (Burmese Chess), a move that causes stalemate is illegal.

A piece requires the ability to fly to move to or from the Clouds. A few types of disk-faces have this ability. The ability to fly does not imply any additional movement ability or limitations. The fliers are: the six Monkey Kings, the two Goblin Generals, the two Lancers of each side, and the one Celestial of each side. Only a flier can fly to or from or across the Cloud squares. No piece may make a capture when they fly to or from a cloud. Furthermore, a disk may only fly to a cloud square from the magic river square associated with it. The disk may land on either of the two squares of that cloud, so long as that square is empty. No piece may make a capture when they fly to or from a cloud, including flight from one cloud to the other. A disk starting movement on a Cloud square must note the color of the square first; it may fly to any empty square on the Earth board of the same color, or the other Clouds square of the same color if it is empty.

Except for the disks that represent the Pilgrim and the Goblin King, all of the disks are two-sided, with a different chess piece showing on either side. If you start a turn with a disk standing on any magic river square, you may flip the disk and simultaneously move it according to that new game piece's abilities. To put it another way, a disk standing on a magic river square has the ability to move as the disk on either side of its two faces. A disk may not flip if it is not on magic river square.

The Goblin King player cannot flip a disk if the Goblin King disk is not on Earth board (thus before initial placement, or after its capture, means the Goblin King player cannot flip disks). The Monkey King player cannot flip disks unless he/she has initially placed the Pilgrim disk on the board.

The two sides' pieces start the game roughly, but not exactly symmetrical. For the most part, even when identical on the front side, Red and Blue disks flip for different transformations.

There are twelve types of disks in the game: Pawn, Sea Serpent, Monkey King, Knight, Lancers, Goblin General, Whirling Monkey Fists, Celestial (a different type on each side), Goblin King, and Buddhist Pilgrim.

The game starts with the boards empty. Starting with the Goblin King player, each player takes turn either introducing a disk on their half of the Earth board, or moving a disk they previously had placed. Players may not introduce disks in this manner on any Cloud square.

The disks have a front and a back. Players may only place disks with the front side showing. The back side of the disks cannot appear unless the piece stands on a magic river square and flips it.

All pieces that can capture move as they capture except the Sea Serpent. The Pilgrim and the Red Celestial cannot capture. Brave Whirling Monkey Fists is an off-board counter, not a normal type of chess piece. Its design intention is to help compensate for the helpless Pilgrim piece.

The classic tale "Journey to the West" inspired the theme and function of this chess variant. Chess game influences include Sittuyin, Moscow King Chess, Shogi, and standard Western chess.

—description from the designer

name: Tin Dragon
description:
You and your fellow Tin Dragon’s seek to accumulate the largest treasure hoard. But only one dragon may claim the title of the Mightiest of the Tin Dragons and rule the skies.

The game is playable with two to four players. Play time is about 20 minutes.

Assault the six Keeps that protect the riches of the nearby kingdoms, defeat their defenses, raid their coffers, duel your foes, and avoid the pesky Knight that seeks to slay a dragon. When the realm has no more riches to offer the dragon with the largest hoard will be crowned the winner.

Tin Dragons are named as such from the silvery blue color of their hide and metallic scales. They possess extremely sharp claws and can let out a roar that only the most stalwart adventurer could resist fleeing from in fear.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Take That

name: Legendary Endeavors CCG Nightmare Set
description:
The first set for Legendary Endeavors CCG. Nightmare set is a survival horror collectible card game. Bringing together human survivors, demons, monsters, creatures, zombies and more.
The game play is fast and done with dice to add the randomness of combat. By creating decks or using one of several methods the Players are tasked with being the last Player with Character Cards alive. Game Play usually takes 20-30 minutes with the Starter Deck. The overlaying goal is to use all cards until only one player is standing.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Tetrad
description:
This book brings together several related exercises in game design. The game of Tetrad itself is the product of an effort to devise a simple game of abstract strategy for four players . . . .

The Tetrad board was designed with several considerations in mind: to provide a layout well suited to a four-way game, to accommodate a wide variety of traditional games, and to be compact enough to fit on the cover of the book. . . .

The TETRAD playing field consists of 120 octagonal spaces arranged in an octagonal pattern. This pattern is printed on both covers. The game is played on one side of the closed book. The playing pieces and dice are stored inside of the book.

The game of TETRAD is designed to be played by exactly four people.

—description from the book

Each player begins the game with six pieces of the same color. These are arranged in a row along one side of the board.

At the center of the board is a group of four spaces. These are each marked with a symbol. The objective of the game is to group four of one's playing pieces at the center. The first player whose color occupies all four of these spaces at the same time, wins the game.

The players take turns casting the dice and moving their pieces. A player begins a turn by casting the two dice. The score of the dice is the total number of steps that the player's pieces may be moved in that turn. One step is the movement of one piece from one space into the next. The pieces can be moved vertically or horizontally, but not diagonally. Moving your piece onto a space that is already occupied replaces your opponents color with your own.

The TETRAD board can be used to play many other games; instructions for various and adapted games are included in the book.

—user summary

name: The D.I.N.K. Game
description:
Goodbye Trivia, hello D.I.N.K. game. The game of the 1990's is here! Introducing new and exciting concepts. Guaranteed to known your socks off! You're given the opportunity to become a real life D.I.N.K. created by strategic moves, lucky dice rolling, and plain ol' good fun. It's exciting and fast paced.
—description from the publisher

Look out Yuppies, the D.I.N.K.S. have arrived! The Baby Boomers second generation is here! Once family-bound, now striving for Double Income No Kids. The combination of two incomes allows D.I.N.K.s to live the upper class lifestyle. . . .

The object of the D.I.N.K. Game is to live and acquire materialistic objects like a real live D.I.N.K. The Double Income will allow this between you and your spouse, by playing in teams and working together. Therefore the winner of the game is the first team to acquire the complete the D.I.N.K. Checklist, accumulating at least 40 points and acquiring $250,000 in the bank.
—description from the rulebook

May also be played in the S.I.N.K. version (SINGLE INCOME NO KIDS). Same rules apply but there is only a single income.
—from a note on the inside of the box

D.I.N.K. = Double Income No Kids

name: Sevenel
description:
… SEVENEL is the future! SEVENEL has all those multiple choice questions everyone prefers. SEVENEL has no dice and we offer each player the opportunity to "Jump-In" on other people's questions. In addition, SEVENEL has more strategy than we can possibly explain. Using 7 different playing surfaces we have eliminated that dizzy feeling as well as "board boredom". Finally, if you do fall asleep, your opponents will be thrilled because they will surely benefit!

These are a few of the advantages the future holds for you with SEVENEL. We want you to experience the challenges we have discovered while playing the most versatile game of our time. And, there is no right or wrong way to play SEVENEL - you create your own version each time you play.

As you see, the history of trivia games promises to be much better as . . .

"night after night
we play into the future!"

—description from the publisher

name: Cannibal Collective
description:
Cannibal Collective is a party game for people who have a strong stomach.

The premise of the game is simple, you have been invited to the 58th Annual Cannibal Collective initiation dinner and as part of the initiation you have to collect the very best bodyparts to comprise your meal.

The first person to collect 1 of each of the 7 body part cards is the winner.

But be warned! There are many other aspects at play! These include The Platypus of Doom, Mystic Lamp Wizards, Assassins, Cloaks of Invisibility, Martians, Zombies, Ninjas, Vampires, Psychics, Leprosy, Magicians, Chainsaws and more.

You collect the body parts by using attack cards and wildcards to steal them from other players, as well as picking them up from the deck. You lose body parts when other players attack you, though you can use defence cards and wildcards to stop other player's attacks.

Wildcards include the Magician card, where a player leaves the room and a card is hidden. They then have to find it and if they can't they lose 3 body parts.

The game takes roughly 20 minutes to play but gets quicker as it progresses as the number of body parts in the deck dwindles.

Each player can play as many cards as they want during their turn and ends their go when they pick up a card.

—description from the designer

name: ドキドキ！自己紹介ゲーム (Doki Doki! Jiko Shokai Game)
description:
ドキドキ！自己紹介ゲーム (Doki Doki! Jiko Shokai Game) is a Japanese game for breaking the ice, designed to encourage social interaction between people meeting up for the first time. The players are required to tell some little story about themselves. But some of the players might be lying. So everyone has to work out who is telling the truth and who is lying. The game has twenty cards, two of which are lying cards. So a very large group can quickly have fun socialising, overcoming anxiety at being new in the group.
user summary

Dramatically introduce yourself, "There are people who know a lot"!

1. Purpose of the game
A scene of self-introduction at an event. About half are regulars or friends. The remark tends to be "Oh, I know everyone ...". This game is a self-introduction game that can help you get rid of those worries, make it easier for new players to enter, and familiarize you more!

2. Game overview
Introduce yourself one by one. At that time, only one or two people will have a 'real' episode, and the other will have a 'lie' episode. Everyone guesses who talked about the episode of 'Looks like a lie but is it true?'

3. Card configuration
There are only two types of cards:
・ 2 "Please tell me the truth" cards
・ 18 "Please tell us about the lie" card

ダラダラしがちな、「結構知ってる人がいる」自己紹介を劇的に！

１．ゲームの目的
イベントでの自己紹介の場面。半分くらいは常連だったりお友達。
発言も「あ、だいたい皆さん知ってますけど…」となりがち。
このゲームは、そんなグダグダを解消し、新規の方も入りやすく、お馴染みさんもより深く知り合えるための自己紹介ゲームです！
２．ゲームの概要
一人ずつ自己紹介をします。
その際、1人、もしくは2人の方のみ「ホントの」エピソードを、残りの方は「ウソの」エピソードを披露してもらいます。
全員が、「ウソっぽいけどホントかな？」という中で、誰がホントのエピソードを話したか当てあいます。
３．カード構成
カードは、以下の2種類のみです。
・「本当のことを言ってください」カード　2枚
・「ウソのことを言ってください」カード　18枚
publisher's summary

name: ワードスナイパーエクストリーム (Word Sniper Extreme)
description: ワードスナイパーエクストリーム (Word Sniper Extreme) is a small expansion deck that works with the base game ワードスナイパー (Word Sniper). The cards work the same as the original game, with themes on one side and letters on the reverse. But the theme is tucked onto a base card (like a pillow on a bed), and so adds a more complex context to the theme. Likewise, the letter side of the cards show several characters, forcing more challenging solutions.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: ダブルフェイス (Double Face)
description:
ダブルフェイス (Double Face) is a Japanese spy game.

One player is a spy, trying to leak secret information.

One player is an undercover investigator, who knows who the spy is and is trying to delete information before it leaks.

The other players are public security agents, trying to uncover the spy and the investigator.

Players have laptop computers with leaked info, deleted info, and dummy folders. The spy wins if enough info is leaked. The investigator wins if they complete four deletes. The public security staff win if they can stop the deletes.

But players can change roles during the game. A security agent may have to become a spy, or the spy might join the agency. In that case, who can you trust to share the information?

During the game, players may draw cards or put cards onto the table, or pass cards between them. If you can work out who is on your side, you can build a set of cards and satsify your win condition.
user summary

≪ストーリー≫
ある密売組織のボスに親子のように育てられた男がいた。
男は親代わりであるボスから、ある命令を言い渡される。
「組織を守る為に公安に潜り込んで情報をリークせよ・・・」
男は公安に入り、エリートの道を歩んだ。
その働きから彼を疑うものは誰もいなかった。
日々、情報をリークしていたがエリートの道を歩むにつれ
重要な情報に辿り着く。
その機密情報は、組織を壊滅させるに充分なものであり
公安にとっても存続を脅かすものであった。
男が機密情報をリークしようとしたその時
予想外の事が起きた・・・。
公安内でエリートが招集されデータ流出対策チームが組まれたのである。
公安からも密売組織に潜入捜査官が潜り込んでいて
スパイの存在が明らかになったのである。
機密情報を巡った戦いが今始まる。
≪概要≫
潜入捜査官は、誰がスパイか分かった状態で始まります。
各プレイヤーには、PCカードが配られ
中には、『ダミーフォルダ』『情報削除（デリート）』『リーク』の
三種類が入っています。
スパイは、情報をリークしたい。
公安は、情報を削除したい。
潜入捜査官は、リークに先回りするか、情報を削除したい。
という情報を巡った争いになります。
分が悪いと思えば、寝返る事も出来る為
急に態度や立ち居振る舞いが変わるとスパイだとばれてしまい
データフォルダを空けるチャンスが回ってきにくくなります。
また、情報をリーク　や　情報削除（デリート）などで一旦決着がついたあとも
告発というフェイズがあり、更なる完全勝利への道もあります。
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Role Playing, Set Collection, Traitor Game

name: H.O.T.: Headlines on Tabloids
description:
At last you can make the news! Bluff your way to the top and win fame and fortune by creating your own sensational mind-boggling Headlines. Play H.O.T., the wildly entertaining game that contains all the thrills of a roller coaster ride. H.O.T. is a hilarious, nail-biting adventure that gives you the chance to scoop incredible and outrageous Headlines of your own.

If you convince the other players that your phony headlines are authentic, then you can fib first to the finish to become a billionaire Tabloid Tycoon. Expose the lurid lifestyles of the rich and famous! Uncover sexy scandalous secrets! Investigate mysteries that defy the logic of science! Play H.O.T., the HEADLINES ON TABLOIDS game and experience an excitement you will never forget!!!

—description from the publisher

name: Zoundz•Like
description:
Bend Your Mind With Words in Disguise

Are you the kind of individual who enjoys solving personalized messages on car license plates? If so, Zoundz•Like will be an exciting and challenging game for you.

Players must solve the word of phrase disguised in the playword in less than 30 seconds.(Zoundz•Like is a lot more fun and easier to solve if you voice the playword out loud.) The first player or team to land exactly on the start/win space wins the game.

A die roll determines the play card number to be solved and the number of board game moves allowed. When a star appears behind a playword, the player must also give the correct spelling. Drive-By is a bonus turn with a 5 second time limit. Twisters are playwords which require mental and/or visual gymnastics to solve the word puzzle.

—description from the rulebook (summarized)

name: Screwed
description:
Screwed . . . the card game where you're in it for yourself!

There are no partners!!!

The object of the game is to obtain the highest score by accurately predicting how many tricks you will take each round. The more you frustrate your opponents by taking their tricks or making them take tricks they do not want, the better your chances of winning will be.

Each round the strategy changes and you can try to bribe, beg, or sweet talk your opponents into helping you make your bid. If you fail, you can get revenge in the next round. Revenge is sweet! Players will find themselves with impetuous feelings of laughter, joy, hat, annoyance, excitement, or antagonism.

The trick to winning this challenging game is a mixture of skill and a lot of luck. No matter what your skill level, everyone has a chance to win this stimulating game.

Good luck . . . you'll need it!

—description from the back of the box

Contains six plastic screws with nuts used for bidding.

name: Fighting Chance
description:
In Fighting Chance choose one of four heroes to try and save the city. But everyone wants to be the best hero in the city, not only do you battle a collection of increasingly powerful rouges, you are trying to be a better hero than the heroes beside you.

Fighting Chance is a cooperative game of every person for themselves.

Fighting Chance is a game of three battle rounds to see who can become the strongest hero and save they City between two phases: training and battle.

Training Round
Players can play two training cards from the training pile. Follow any instructions on the training card. Put the used training cards in the training discard pile. Players must discard their remaining training card. At the beginning of the next training round players may draw three training cards again, but still play only two. If there are not enough cards in the training card draw pile, shuffle the training card discard pile. There is a training card called Diversify Your Portfolio, this card allows players to gain two of any attribute, but it may also be split between to attributes.

Battle Round
Once the heroes are trained let the battle begin.
Flip over the rouge for round 1. Place the energy marker on the rogue board.
In additional rounds flip over round two’s rogue at the beginning of the battle round for round two, and round three’s rogue at the beginning of battle round three.
Note any special abilities that this rogue may have. If a rogue is immune to solo attacks of level X, a player may play a solo attack if their skill exceeds the immunity. For example if a rogue is immune to solo attacks of three or greater of mysticism, but the player has a level four or greater of mysticism, they may still attack at this level.
The most experienced player should go first.
For the first round each player gets dealt seven cards, but has a hand size of three. They players draw three cards in their hand, and draw up to three at the beginning of each turn. If the player discards all their Battle Cards during a round, they are out of the round, but live to fight another day.
For round two each player gets dealt eight cards with a hand size of four.
For round three each player gets dealt ten cards with a hand size of five.
At the end of each round place all unused cards in the discard pile. Shuffle the Battle Cards and deal them for the next round.

They player with the most points at the end of round three wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: 怪盗オーシャンズ (Kaitou Oceans)
description:
怪盗オーシャンズ (Kaitou Oceans) is a Japanese game of phantom thieves robbing a casino (as in Oceans 11). Players go through phases of examining the safe, declaring a robbery, then dividing up the spoils. And one player is secretly a detective, trying to spoil the thieves attempts.

The $Billions is stored in a safe, but only one of four locations actually has the money. Players start by examing the decks to find it (players can lie about what they find). When a player feels sure, they declare the job is on and players play bid cards face-down. If the total bid beats the target, the safe is cracked. Then the players bid again in an auction to divide up the loot (matching bids are cancelling). At the end of the game, the player with the most money wins.

If the detective can make the robberies fail, or recover the loot, the thieves fail.
user summary
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Hidden Roles, Secret Unit Deployment, Traitor Game, Voting

name: Maze
description:
MAZE . . . is a game to entertain people of all ages. It is a two player game which combines strategy with chance.

The object of the game is to get all four of your playing pieces on the center dot (and off the board) before your opponent does.

Players start their men on opposite ends of the board. During the game, each player tries to get past the network of walls which his opponent is building against him. As he removes walls that are blocking him, he repositions them where he feels they will most hinder his opponent. Each tries to reach the center red dot (which is the only way off the board).

With both players heading for the center red exit dot they will often find themselves facing each other with no walls between them. These head to head encounters create exciting situations in which one or more pieces can be sent back to their respective "jail" corners to start over again.

The game is quite simple and lots of fun. The advantage can swing from one player to the other and back again many times throughout the entire game.

MAZE is [a wooden product] produced on home-made machines, silk-screened and assembled by hand. It is not a factory product, and is only offered in limited quantities.

—description from the inside of the box

name: The Drowned Earth: Yuttaraptors
description:
Yuttaraptors are faction neutral, and so can be used with any other factions, or as NPC models in certain scenarios or using the Alternate Rules found in the hard copy of the rulebook.

Yuttaraptors (x2), is a pack of two multi-part metal wargaming miniatures in 35mm scale. The models are lead free, and come supplied with two 40mm base and one profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Storytelling

name: Identity Crisis
description:
How often do you get your family and friends confused with "Famous" or "Infamous" people? Well, when you have an Identity Crisis it happens all the time. It's a creative new game that's never the same, no-matter how many times you play.

Prepare yourself for an evening of laughter, as you and your friends enjoy the company of some very unexpected guests. You'll quickly discover that the strategy is endless and the clues are non-stop. Challenging, fun, and easy to play, Identity Crisis is a game for the whole family.

—description from the back of the box

The winner is the first person to obtain (5) "Score Cards" spelling the name "Id-en-ti-ty Crisis". It is to each person's advantage to roll "Pick a Letter" as often as possible. By doing this you are attempting to write the letters in your Identity's "abbreviated name" before another player figures out who you are. "Score Cards" are won after "Revealing" your opponent's Identity, and/or, after you "Pick" all the letters in your own Identity. Once you complete the spelling of your Identity's name - announce you have done so - replace your "Identity card" with a new one, and select one of the (5) "Score Cards". If you "Reveal" another player's Identity, you may take one of that person's "Score Cards" or one from the "Main Card Holder". If you guess wrong, your opponent may take one of your "Cards" or, one from the "Main Card Holder". Any time there is an incorrect response, the player being challenged benefits.

—description from the rulebook

name: Priorities
description:
The game to play with people you THINK you know--or that you WANT to know BETTER!!!!

Players must correctly predict how other players will answer their questions.

—user summary

name: Celebrity Challenge
description:
The Game About Famous People

CELEBRITY CHALLENGE includes individual game cards for the 60 most famous people born in each calendar month - 720 in all. Movie stars, TV celebrities, musicians, athletes, Presidents, and others . . . YOU KNOW THEM ALL!!

If you can never win at a trivia game, CELEBRITY CHALLENGE is for you. It's not just what you know, but also how you play the game. No one knows who has won until the game is over.

Best of all - everyone is included in the game at all times and each game only takes approximately 45 minutes to play.

—description from the back of the box

The object of CELEBRITY CHALLENGE is for each player to score the highest number of points by placing as many SCORING TOKENS as possible on both the 12 CELEBRITY WALK and the 12 CALENDAR SQUARES. Only one SCORING TOKEN is permitted on any of these 24 squares at any one time. The game is over when all of the 12 squares on the CELEBRITY WALK are occupied with SCORING TOKENS. A SCORING TOKEN is placed on the CELEBRITY WALK squares of the CALENDAR SQUARES by the player who first successfully identifies the name of a celebrity to whose identity clues are given by the GAME CARD READER.

name: Corporate Affairs 301
description:
Simulate manouverings without financial responsibility. Simulate corporate politics.

The activity that teaches you to who to trust. The activity that needs no power or batteries. Keep active the mind of a 104 year old. Teach it to a 4 year old.

Corporate Affairs 301 may be played by 2 or 3 Stkrs (Stockholders). When 2 Stkrs are present, they shall manipulate Blue Company and Green Limited personnel primarily, and Red Corporation secondarily. When 3 Stkrs are present, Red Corp. personnel will be manipulated by the Red Stkr only.

Different coloured stick pins represent various company positions from Presidents to Grunts, each with different movement rules. A Stkr loses when the company loses its last Grunt.

—user summary

name: On the Record
description:
This EXCITING, new game that is based on quotations is a must for all board game lovers. Enjoy many hours of fun being quizzed about quotes from the following six categories: Sports, History, Proverbs, Literature, Entertainment and General.

Because most questions offer multiple choice answers, you will find that this game will be played at a very rapid pace and with over 3,000 questions contained in this game, you may never know all the answers!

You will be entertained by quotes of W. C. Fields, be educated with excerpts from Shakespeare, be given a history lesson from the words of John F. Kennedy or just laugh at the always quotable Yogi Berra.'

—description from the publisher
publishers: Penguin Marketing Incorporated, Prairie Graphics Industries Ltd.

name: Criminal Matters
description:
A comprehensive trivia game of misdeeds, murder, & mystery . . . in fact & fiction.

The object of the game is to win--be putting an "X" in each box of the score card with each correct answer.

Q & A CATEGORIES: Actors & Movies, Arts & Letters, Television & Radio, Crimes & Misdemeanors.

—description from the publisher

name: CodeMaster
description:
Your opponent has secretly filled in his Secret Code Grid. You have done the same. You ask him questions about his Grid, while trying to reveal little about your own. Can you duplicate his Code--before he unravels yours?

It will require strategy and cunning--and a dose of logical reasoning!

Then match wits with your opponent Super-CodeMaster, using any of the eighteen Grids that come with the game. Or play it by yourself, using the Solitaire Booklet also included. Either way, it's exciting, unique and challenging.

By the makers of the puzzle, LogicMaster.

—description from the back of the box

Each player takes a Grid Sheet (a sheet of two empty 25-square grids). On the top grid each writes his secret code. This consists of the letters A through E, each written five times. Write one letter in each square. The same letter may not appear more than one In a row or in a column. Therefore every row and column will contain each of the five letters.

You must discover your opponents secret code by using sums (made from the addition of the row and column numbers containing that letter) and knowing whether the letters in two named spaces are the same or different.

—user summary

name: Vari Trivial
description:
Vari Trivial is a card game of both bidding and bluffing played with the trivia questions from Trivial Pursuit. It replaces the game board, die and rules.

Each player is dealt seven playing cards. These cards are numbered and color-coded to match the question categories rom Trivial Pursuit. A trivia question is read aloud and the players use the playing cards to bid for the right to answer it. The player who gives the answer is allowed to bluff, but can be challenged. A question answered incorrectly can be answered by another player. Plus and minus point cards are used to keep score. The winner is the player with the highest net score at the end of the game.

Game can be ended anytime after seven trivia questions have been answered.

—description from the back of the box
publishers: JJD Games Unlimited, Tri Game Enterprises

name: Rapid Recall
description:
No cards. No dice. No board. Just fun!

Each player picks a category, such as: Ice cream flavors, Holidays, Actos, Tropical Islands . . . Remember what they are.

Once you have that down, each person sits in front of a light and one player pushes down the yellow dome. All of the lights flash twice, until they stop at random on two players. If your light stays on, you better look for the other light, quickly! You have to name something in that players' category (Vanilla, New Years, Cary Grant or Hawaii), before they name something in yours.

See if you have Rapid Recall, and can get the words off the tip of your tongue.

—description from the publisher

name: Crossfire
description:
Between Checkers & Chess There's CROSSFIRE

Crossfire, 1. Lines of fire from two or more positions that cross one another; simultaneous fire along those lines. 2. An attack from two or more sources or directions

OBJECT: To collect as many points as possible while moving game pieces across board.
Points are collected by:
(A) landing on RED spots.
(B) capturing other game pieces and markers by landing on them.
(C) moving your game pieces into your opponents' home base.

—user summary
publishers: C. Wood Enterprises, Inc., FoxLake Games

name: Mar-Job
description:
Welcome to the exciting game of Mar-Job!

Mar-Job is an adaptation of an ancient Oriental game that has been played and enjoyed by people world-wide for many centuries.

The exact origin of the original version is as mystical as the game itself. Chinese legend dates the original version back approximately 2,500 years!

Mar-Job challenged players' decision-making skills as they attempt to create a winning hand by drawing and discarding the unique MAR-JOB cards or 'chees'. Be careful as to which card you throw away. You might discard what another player needs to win the hand!

Mar-Job - a game of Strategy, Activity, Excitement & Fun!

—description from the publisher
publishers: Northern Games Co. Ltd., Trio Innovations Inc.

name: Eagle Eye Agency: Clue Book #2
description:
Second series of 12 cases for Eagle Eye Agency (in alphabetical order):

A Dog Barks in Suburbia; All That Glows Is Not Gold; Black Out; Cat's Meow; Drowsy Detective; Drunken Driver; Goose Chase; He Who Laughs Last; Lights, Camera, Murder; Mirror, Mirror; Nursery Rhyme Thief; Woman With A Secret

—description from the publisher

name: Eagle Eye Agency: Clue Book #3
description:
Third series of 12 cases for Eagle Eye Agency. All 12 cases are numbered, but untitled. Each case is unique, although every one concerns the same theme - missing persons.

The Cases may be played in any order you wish.

—description from the publisher

name: Tax
description:
Tax is a 2-6 player card game using a deck containing four copies each of one through nine.


Deal five cards to each player and a sixth to the starting player. If playing with four, five or six players, deal a sixth card to the first and second players.
Place two cards face-up in the center of the table forming two separate discard piles.
On the side, place two cards face-up forming the communal card display.

Gameplay:
At the start of your turn, you must calculate the sum and the difference of the two cards atop the two discard piles.  At the end of your turn, you must be able to create one of those two values by performing one operation of addition, subtraction, multiplication or division between the two cards atop the discard piles at the end of your turn.

Taking Your Turn:
On your turn, you must make exactly one of four legal plays:

Play a single hand card to the top of one of the discard piles.
Play two hand cards, one to the top of each of the discard piles.
Play one hand card to the top of a discard pile and one communal card to the top of the other discard pile.  Communal cards are not replenished when used.  A player is limited to using one communal card per turn but may use both communal cards over the course of the round.
Fold and exit the round.  You can fold instead of performing one of the other actions.  If unable to perform one of the other actions, you must fold.



If the round has not ended, the next player in clockwise order who is still in the round takes his/her turn.

Round End:
If all other players have folded, the round ends immediately and the remaining player gains one point.

If a player plays his/her last card(s), the round ends immediately, and that player gains two points.

Collect the cards, shuffle, and perform the setup again.  First player rotates clockwise each round.

End condition:
The first player to reach or exceed a predetermined point value wins, for example 15 points.


Variant:
Want more information about your opponents' cards? At the start of a round after receiving their hand of cards, all players must place a single copy of their highest and lowest cards on the table in front of them for all players to see. These two cards are still considered to be hand cards. Players use these two cards just like their regular hand cards and they are folded when the rest of the hand is folded.

—description from the designer

name: 4•Plex
description:
4•Plex is the first multi-purpose game of skill or luck. You can play for the challenge or play for fun. The varying complexity that can be created after the mastery of the Short Play are endless, yet the simplicity of play will appeal to the kid in all of us.

The sequence of play can be summarized as follows:


Divide the board equally among the players
Insert your color-cups into the board (setup)
In turn, each player chooses one of the color-cups for distribution (distribution sequence), going round and around the board until your hand ends in a previously empty cup or until it ends in a cup that forms a set (capturing sets)
As sets of 4 plexis are formed and captured they are removed from the board and will become the property of the captor


Now that sounds simple enough! The problem is, you are not the only one trying to win. Your opponent(s) will plot against your every move. The challenge is to out-smart them and win the established advantage.

OVER 1000 LEVELS OF PLAY!

Within the same basic playing style
A new challenge every time you play
No other game (video or otherwise) offers more diversity
The ultimate in replay value (2 dimensional)
Play 4 fun or play 4 skill
Easy to learn (only requires the ability to count)
Entertainment for the entire family


—description from the back of the box

name: Setz drauf!
description:
The players have to get their 5 caps from their stating line to the starting line of their opponent to win the game. Movement is in a straight line and determined by a die. If a cap gets on a black space it has to start again from the beginning.

Whenever a cap lands on an opponent cap, the later is blocked till the upper cap leaves again.

The game may be playes by 2 or 4 players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Brainwashed: Presidential Poker
description:
Created by Joe Stempek, Brainwashed: Presidential Poker is a highly-strategic, Presidential take on Texas Hold’em Poker. Designed, Playtested, and printed in the USA, unlike the merchandise a special “you know who” peddles...

In Brainwashed: Presidential Poker, players will take turns playing cards, manipulating cards in players hands and gaining information to position themselves to steal each other’s launch codes. Get 7 launch codes and win the game. Find yourself without any way to launch a nuke and you’re a loser. Get out of here!

Play as one of four character’s with unique abilities to further complicate this already convoluted political process, and defeat your opponents to hold the country hostage for one more day. Get Brainwashed today!

—description from the designer

name: Abenteuer im Weltraum: Auf dem Mond!
description:
Auf dem Mond! is a light dice based game of lunar exploration, combined with trivia about space travel.
Game play proceeds by dice rolling: Players roll for movement points to reach the target on a moon track. Some points of the track require the answering of trivia. The player who reaches the target field first wins the game.

—user summary

name: Highlander: moments of historie
description:
The game takes place on a map of Scotland divided into 36 territories, of which 24 are assigned to specific clans. Each region has upper limits on the capacity of characters, livestock and crops.

The game has economic and military features. Each player starts with a single clan region and tries to gain control over additional clans by conquering more regions. The goal is to be the first to occupy a certain number of clans depending on the number of players. Conquests are made by troop movements.

To spread, players can move their pawns to neighbouring regions. Empty regions can be occupied. In occupied regions peaceful coexistence or conflicts can occur, which are then solved by figure majorities.

Conquered areas are farmed and generate income in the form of money and agricultural resource yields.
Each clan has a knight. By participating in tournaments, which are driven by dice rolling, knights can gain weapons and shields that increase their fighting power and are thus useful in conquering, protecting and managing areas.

Gameplay is divided in 3 phases (build-up, protection and endgame) with 4 seasons each.

name: アミーゴ！ (AMIGO!)
description:
アミーゴ！ (AMIGO!) is a Japanese speed word game. Players must determine the start letter of a word, then call out a word that fits the chosen theme.

Each player has two thumbs up cards. After a theme card and a word card card are turned up, players choose how to play their thumb cards. A thumb up is +1, a thumb down is -1. All players reveal their thumbs (you don't have to use both) and work out the correct number of steps.
4 thumbs up and 0 thumbs down equals +4 steps on the word card, giving the start letter.
2 thumbs up and 4 thumbs down equals -2 steps on the word card (starting at the end of the word and going backwards), giving the start letter.

If the total of thumbs is zero, everybody shouts "AMIGO!"

The first player to get a word fitting the theme and start letter gives their answer. If correct, they get the theme card. If wrong, they hand one back as a penalty.

The player with the most theme cards collected by the end is the winner.
user summary
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Goaly
description:
Each player represents a soccerteam. Players try to score goals, but they have to be aware of off-side.
You can give red or yellow cards to your opponents, but the referee is still the boss on the field.

—user summary

name: Wacky Widgets
description:
In Wacky Widgets, the Gnome King needs help building contraptions in the Caves of Neverwhere for the benefits of his gnome clan and to help make products to sell to the other peoples of Westarland.

Wacky Widgets is a game for 1-4 players. There are both competitive and co-operative variants that plays in about 20 minutes per player.

Complete with other players to build the most and the best roller race, lever linkage, water wash, and gear contraptions in the caves. The cave is laid out in a 5x5 grid and has build cards (systems such as gears) laid out in it. The build cards come in 4 system types, four connection types, and have systems on either side. There are four types of schematics for things to build: Doohickeys, Whatsits, Thingamajigs, and Combobulations. Use teams of gnomes to shove, flip, replan, and swap build cards to create systems that will meet the requirements of the schematics. Earn victory points and build your support to get more gnomes to help you in future turns. Keep building until one schematic deck runs out and the then the highest point total at the end of the round is the winner.

For a co-operative challenge, play the Gremlin Invasion variant. The gremlins are invading the Caves of Neverwhere and getting in the way of your building plans. Every turn, a new gremlin is added to the caves and the ones already there stir up more mischief. Contend with over a dozen different gremlins like Masher Trasher, Fiendish Fil, Jammin' Sammy, and Head Dread. All with unique and mischievous powers. If you don't do anything about them they will overrun the caves. Recruit gremlin hunters to chase the gremlins out of the cave, but be careful, chasing gremlins eats up valuable time and resources.

Plays essentially the same as the competitive game, but the goal is for the team to get to 100 points before time runs out.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building

name: Mutant Outpost Massacre
description:
It is the Age of the Goremageddon and GRAXX is in a new wave of absolute carnage, brutality and ultra-violence. Along the highways, in hidden territories and throughout the wastelands, abandoned outposts sit, just waiting to be pillaged for everything that sits within. Thrashers engage these outposts, unsure of what awaits them inside: resources, weaponry, relics or even hordes of endless mutants, just lurking in every corner, waiting to feast on the flesh of those who wander within...

Mutant Outpost Massacre is a solitaire game of outpost-raiding in the post apocalyptic universe of Goremageddon (CPOP's flagship tabletop miniatures game; the third edition debuts soon). Players take the roles of 'thrashers' who raid outposts throughout the planet of GRAXX in the hopes of coming across rare items, resources, weapons and engage enemies in a non-stop massacre.

The game can be played in a single session, however, thrashers can continue their exploits in an ongoing career; the game only truly ends when your thrasher perishes. After a successful raid, thrashers gain experience, which is used to purchase new weapons, items and add skills, making them more powerful as they head into raid after raid after raid. Upon the final encounter of their raid, thrashers will face bosses, who will attempt to thwart their efforts to escape. Future expansions (coming soon) will add new encounters, new outposts, new enemies, new traps, bosses and so much more, making the game something players will want to come back to, time and time again.

We welcome you to the Mutant Outpost Massacre. May you live, die and thrash.

Goremageddon is heavily inspired by over-the-top violence, exploitation, gore, horror, humor and post apocalyptic films on the 1980s, as well as RetroWave and Thrash Metal music. Goremageddon is also CPOP's flagship project, made popular by a cult following and already headed into a third edition, due to release soon.

—description from the publisher
categories: Mature / Adult, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Tuunes: Orchestral Themes
description:
Tuunes is the perfect game to challenge the musician or delight the music lover of any age. Players compete with each other to identify a mystery TUUNE from gradually revealed snippets and snatches of a well-loved melody. Tuunes, the game that puts music back into the parlor, is the ideal choice for an evening of entertainment.

Orchestral Themes is an additional Tuunes set with classic melodies from the masters, including Beethoven, Brahms, Tchaikovsky, etc.

-user summary

name: Guess It: Set 1
description:
Guess It is an easy-to-learn science game that plays like 20 questions"

Lay out up to 48 stunning photo cards--scaly reptiles, colorful minerals and very strange leaves.

Your friends secretly picks one from a matching Mystery Deck.

Can you guess the secret card by asking five "Yes-or-No? questions or less?

The fewer questions you have to ask, the better you score!

Also contains 8 other fun games:

Tic Tac Lotto
Animal, Vegetable, Mineral
Meat-Eater Roulette
Match, Set, and Win
Trample, Smother, Conk
One Minute to 12
My Snake
Chain Gang

name: Songsations
description:
A Game to Sing About

Songsations is a lively and entertaining game, featuring 720 songs, for two or more players or teams.

Spin the needle to determine the decade.

Select a song title from that decade (50's, 60's, 70's or 80's) and sing a clue from the song title. Singing, facial expressions and body movements are all encouraged to help your team guess the song title. You don't have to be a "singer" to enjoy the fin of Songsations.

Points are awarded for each correct answer.

If you like the oldies and contemporary pop hits, you'll love Songsations, the fun, fast-moving party game for all ages.

Songsations brings back the memories while providing hours of entertainment.

Play it for a song!

name: The Music Game: Primary (Level A)
description:
The Music Game: Primary (Level A) is a fun board game for children that promotes a recognition and understanding of the basics of music. The Primary Music Game's easy and exciting approach encourages group participation and provides opportunities for creative musical expression. Charming drawings of animals and cartoon characters introduce the elements of music as a happy experience, which stimulates and develops the child's musical growth. Children learn music through fun activities.

Teachers/parents and children do not need any musical knowledge to play this game.

Used in the classroom or at home. The Primary Music Game makes an excellent teaching aid and can be adapted to any music program. Teachers/parents using this game will also find that children can learn music at their own pace.

OBJECT OF THE GAME:

The winner is the first group or child to reach the Finish position on the far right side of the game board. Players advance their coloured marker clips from left to right along the white and coloured piano keys (not the black ones) by rolling the die, and correctly responding to the Musical Category Cards.

THE MUSICAL CATEGORIES:

1: Musical Notes
2: Musical Keys
3: Musical Rhythm
4: Musical Signs
5: Musical Words
6: Music Makers

—description from the rulebook

name: Story of KIZUNA and "Luciola cruciata": Episode 3 – Fall Thee Not Unto Darkness
description:
キズナと螢の物語　エピソード3：闇堕チタマフコト無カレ (Story of KIZUNA and "Luciola cruciata": Episode 3 – Fall Thee Not Unto Darkness) is an expansion to キズナと螢の物語 (Story of KIZUNA and "Luciola cruciata"). It adds 12 new scenarios, 2 new characters, 7 alternate versions of existing characters, and replacement cards for all characters in the base game (to fix ambiguous effects and update the card format). Some of these new scenarios and characters are of a new attribute: light. Additionally, new rules and tokens are included for boss fight scenarios against new Level 4 ORs, "High Jokers", as well as materials for custom light-attribute scenarios and characters (Episode 2 contains materials for custom scenarios and characters in the remaining attributes).

AD 2018.
The war has not ended.

What suddenly appeared 13 years ago that attacked humanity.
"Those That Were Once Gods", or rather,
"Those Wrested of Godhood"...
OLD REBELLION / OR

For Humans to stand up to the threat,
Luciola Cruciata was established by IJUUIN Group.
Their research found the existence of "Youth that display superior abilities with the light and spirit of young life that can eradicate the OR".
Out of respect, they called those young boys and girls
Glowlies (Those Who Glow = Glow Flies)

Five months prior. The Void Gate Disaster.
Parts of the OR took knowledgable manoeuvres to open "gates" from the world they lived into the human world and plotted mass invasion.
Thwarted by the Glowlies, starting with MASAYOSHI NEGITA, this commotion was settled by sealing the gates with the power of the Shinto Priest of Momotuka Shrine.

Two months prior, Soul Stained Juvenile.
YOSHIMASA SERIZAWA was in slumber for 13 years from the incident in which HINAGIKU IJUUIN was attacked by OR.
Having awakened, and with both great abilities as a Glowly and exceptional Dark abilities, he is taken in by HINAGIKU's team and actively joins the Glowlies.
In the midst of doubts and uncertainties he remembers everything from 13 years ago and throws aside his doubts thanks to the faith of his companions.
Taking in the power of the "Stained Crystal" embedded in his body, he goes through "Arousal" and becomes a unified Glowly.

Some time passes.
People went back to their peaceful everyday lives, but have not forgotten their new fear.

"Humans taken in by the Kegare no Crystal become OR."

MASAYOSHI takes up the sword to carry out his own justice.
Without parents, fighting as a Glowly was his way of life.
YOSHIMASA takes up the blade to repay the kindness to HINAGIKU and the others.
Relieving HINAGIKU of all that troubled her was his way of life.

OR of new strength. OR Level 4: High Joker.
Those were the forms of humans that fell into darkness and changed into OR.
Glowlies confront the Stained KIZUNA that cover the city.

The fight to end all that happened 13 years ago. And, the fight to live...

The conclusion to Part 1 of the Glowlies' story.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: I'm CEO, Bitch
description:
An easy to learn and simple, yet strategic and addictive card game. Players race to discard their hand, in order to rise through the ranks of Bitch, Intern, Middle Management, Vice President and ultimately become “CEO”.
You'll love battling for the CEO position while avoiding becoming the Bitch (the target of hilarious abuse).
Business isn't fair… neither is this game, Bitch.

The game plays like an enhanced version of President/Scum/Asshole and contains:
Numbered cards ranging from 0-10, Star cards from 0-10, Bitch cards, and Executive Order cards that change up game play each hand.

—description from the designer

name: トリプルフェイス (Triple Face)
description:
トリプルフェイス (Triple Face) is a Japanese card game of infiltrating spies and double-crossing agents. Players on the dark (criminal) side must defeat the infiltrating investigators. Players on the security (public) side must defeat two dark members or one dark boss. But if a public agent defeats a public boss, they switch to the dark side. Players have open roles and secret roles and maybe a third face too.

Players have roles which give them special powers (not secret, open play):
Private detectives: You can see someone's main position, but you cannot make a call.
Sniper: You can eliminate an enemy by pointing out their ID number. (Player is removed from the game).
