Youtuber: Information can be diffused. It can be a lie or a real one.
Cafe staff: You can disclose one level of a player's ID number.
Public Security Police: You can defeat an opponent if you can get their ID number.
Kaito (phantom thief): You can select two cards by looking at them.

The game turns on the use of special ID numbers which are produced during the gameplay. The ID numbers are LED displays, with some light and dark sections. The player's card lies on top of their number. During the game, players get to move other players' cards slightly, revealing small sections of the LED display. Gradually they can deduce the secret ID number of the agent and use it against them.
user summary
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Bread Bonanza Bakery
description:
Players take the role of bakers in a bakery all vying for the attention of the head baker. They must compete to add ingredients to as many recipes and bake as much bread as they can.

—description from the introduction

Setup involves two distinct decks of cards ("Ingredients" and "Recipes"). Players begin with a hand of "Ingredients" cards and a reservoir of tokens. Three "Recipe" cards are played in a common area. The game is played in turns, taken sequentially by players, as normal for a card game. Play involves adding matching "Ingredient" cards to available "Recipe" cards in an attempt to complete a "Recipe". Players earn points for playing "Ingredients" cards and completing "Recipe" cards. The game ends when the "Recipe" deck is exhausted - the players with the most points wins.

Bread Bonanza Bakery was created for, and submitted to, Game Chef 2019.

—user summary

name: Fangoso
description:
Players must do good deeds to defeat Fangoso, the corruption sticky monster. If Fangoso kills one of the players, everyone will lose.

Players roll the dice to advance. When they fall into a Fangoso space, they take a card to know how many health points they lose.

When they fall into an Action space, they take a card and roll a D8 dice to find out how many health points Fangoso loses. The highest numbers correspond to the best deeds.

—description from the designer

name: Bent Out of Shape
description:
This is a unique game which mixes elements of Connect Four and Twister.

The game board is a unit that holds 21 tiles (3 rows of 7), but only the centre 9 tiles are visible to the players. New tiles can be added to the game board on either end, and into any of the rows. Each time a new tile is added to the game board a tile is ejected from the other end of the same row.

The tiles display either a body part (nose, forehead, ear, shoulder, elbow, belly button, back, knee or foot) or "Bent Out of Shape."

On a player's turn (or the team's turn if playing in teams), the player rolls the die and takes the corresponding number of tiles from the facedown pile next to the board. The player then inserts the tiles into the game board, from either side and into any row. After they have inserted the new tile, the display of the 9 tiles at the centre of the board will have changed. The player will then attempt to score the body part that is displayed in the very centre of the board.

To score the body part in the centre of the board, the other player(s) will announced the eight body parts surrounding the centre square, two at a time, starting from any corner and moving clockwise around the square of eight body parts. As the other player(s) announces the body parts, the playing player/team must connect the two body parts together by connecting the parts on each other's body or by using their hands. While holding this position, the next two body parts are announced and must be added to the current pose.

If the team is successful at connecting all the body parts at once, they score the body part in the centre square. If the team is unsuccessful at connecting together all of the body parts, or fails to hold the pose throughout the turn, they score nothing. Players/teams are given two chances to complete the pose.

If any of the 9 tiles displayed in the game board displays "Bent out of Shape" instead of a body part, then one member of the team must try to link all of the body parts by himself/herself. Because this task is more difficult, if they succeed they can score any body they wish.

The first team to score all nine different body parts wins.

—user summary

name: KLAPS
description:
A card game with numbered cards, action cards, jokers, and special cards.
On your turn, you will play a card to the open stack or draw a card from the closed stack. There are rules for which cards can go on top of each other, and you win by getting rid of all your cards.

—user summary

name: MacGuffin: The Quidnunc and the Hounds
description:
MacGuffin is a cooperative story improvisation game for 3 to 6 players. It provides a framework to guide you in creating a story with a real plot and character development. It is hysterical at times, tragic at others.

Overview

One person, the Game Master, takes on the role of a busybody, or “Quidnunc”. The Quidnunc craves all the latest news and gossip about a previous escapade involving the protagonists of the story, known as the “Hounds”. The players other than the Quidnunc assume the roles of the Hounds. In this adventure, the Hounds doggedly chase down an object of vital interest, known as the “MacGuffin”. The Quidnunc drives the storytelling process by asking questions, making observations, prodding, and generally creating a nuisance of himself to extract every last detail of the Hounds' quest.

The great director Alfred Hitchcock coined the term “MacGuffin”. A MacGuffin is something that the major characters of a story, both protagonists and antagonists, are chasing. Seemingly, the MacGuffin is what the story is about. However, it is actually irrelevant to the story, which is really all about character interaction and development. The MacGuffin’s only real purpose is to bring the characters together and push them into action and competition with each other.

The movies are replete with MacGuffins. The One Ring is the coveted MacGuffin in Tolkein's “The Lord of the Rings”. Ahab relentlessly pursues his White Whale to everyone's detriment in Melville's “Moby Dick”. In “Raiders of the Lost Ark”, the Nazis hunt the magical Ark of the Covenant as a weapon of ultimate power while Indiana Jones seeks it as an artifact of tremendous historical merit.

In this game, as in the movies, MacGuffins take on many forms. Whatever its nature, the MacGuffin primarily serves as a means to link the major characters, the Hounds and their enemies, in some way. Since the characters all run toward the MacGuffin, they will invariably interact, and plots involving them can be woven into a single coherent tale whose sum is greater than their individual contributions.

Each player has final say over a single major character in the story and shares control of the other characters with his or her fellow players. When conflicts arise between participants, they bid on the right to narrate the result. So, this game only provides a framework for collaborative storytelling; the actual story is created by the players. Even though MacGuffin is a “game”, it is the process of telling a collaborative story that matters. So, unlike most games, the point of a MacGuffin session is not really the declaration of who won or lost, but the creation of an entirely new story.

—description from the introduction

The print-and-play version is available as a free download, comprised of three PDF documents (totaling 88 pages) and one large ZIP archive of numerous print-and-play game components in PNG format.

—user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Role Playing

name: Mit År10: Quizzen om 70'erne
description:
A quiz game with a stack of cards each with six questions about the 1970's.

At the beginning of the game, the players decide how many points to play to.

On a player's turn, he rolls the die and the player to his left asks him the corresponding question. If he answers correctly, he gets the card as a point. If his answer is wrong, the other players may hit the bell to answer the question and get the card and the point if correct.

The game ends when a player has the agreed number of points.

—user summary

name: Mit År10: Quizzen om 80'erne
description:
A quiz game with a stack of cards each with six questions about the 1980's.

At the beginning of the game, the players decide how many points to play to.

On a player's turn, he rolls the die and the player to his left asks him the corresponding question. If he answers correctly, he gets the card as a point. If his answer is wrong, the other players may hit the bell to answer the question and get the card and the point if correct.

The game ends when a player has the agreed number of points.

—user summary

name: Mit År10: Quizzen om 90'erne
description:
A quiz game with a stack of cards each with six questions about the 1990's.

At the beginning of the game, the players decide how many points to play to.

On a player's turn, he rolls the die and the player to his left asks him the corresponding question. If he answers correctly, he gets the card as a point. If his answer is wrong, the other players may hit the bell to answer the question and get the card and the point if correct.

The game ends when a player has the agreed number of points.

—user summary

name: Mont Blanc
description:
A GAME FOR SMART INVESTORS AND BRAVE SKIERS. Mont Blanc recreates the development of a ski resort and its economic management. Players will share not only companies, but also the funds which make possible for them to keep building the most exciting trails for their upcoming customers —each one with their own preferences!

FOUND COMPANIES AND MANAGE THEIR FUNDS. Building trails will likely have a cost which is subtracted from the company’s funds, but this is also where the players will share profit from! Be sure to choose the right time to share and the most convenient company ability afterwards.

BUILD TRAILS ACROSS THE MOUNTAIN. Connect your trail tiles in a way that fulfills the requirements of your skier and itineray cards. Get ahead of other players to gain the best areas and landmarks of the mountain.

INVITE SKIERS TO YOUR TRAILS. Increase your companies’ funds and gain victory points filling your trail tiles with skiers —all way down! Use their abilities to open new routes and reach for more goals.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Den lille ordquiz
description:
A quiz game about homonyms. 150 Danish words that each have two meanings.

For each meaning, three hints are given.
A player that guesses the word after one hint for each meaning gets three points.
A player that guesses the word after two hints for each meaning gets two points.
A player that guesses the word after three hints for each meaning gets one points.

—user summary

name: Fundead: The Gravest Show on Earth
description:
Fundead is a two-player strategic card placement battle that pits circus performers against zombies (there is also a 2v2 variant as well as a solo mode). A player can lay a new card to flip existing cards from their opponents' side to their own, and when the five-by-five battlefield is filled with cards, the side with the stronger army is the winner. Cards can also be locked into place and blocked from the opponent's reach.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Tile Placement

name: CuldZept World
description:
Semi Co-op game, player will be a hero trainee which need a teamwork to eliminate the monster, but the only one who deal killing blow will get the fame point.
The first player who get total of 20 fame points is the winner

name: Book of Mormon Connection
description:
Get connected to the Book of Mormon with Book of Mormon Connection, a fun new game the whole family will love! One player (the guide) chooses two colorful emoji images that best represent one to six quotes from the Book of Mormon. The players read the six displayed quotes. Based on the 2 emoji hints alone, players try to guess the quote the guide is describing. Players score points if the quote they choose matches the one the guide selected. Each player takes a turn being the guide. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins! Also includes One Mind, a bonus variation on the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Excelsior
description:
The game Excelsior consists of 4 separate games:

1. Kreuz und quer (Criss-cross)
The players have to get their 8 numbered pawns from their starting spaces to their destination spaces of the same numbers at the opposite side of the game board.
Movement is determined by 4 special dice. Each die has two large different colored dots and 4 numbered sides
(1-4), each in one of the four colors. Each roll counts for all players, according to the color of the results.
The pawns move forward according to the rolled numbers. The roll of a dot allows for a side-wards move. Instead of moving straight ahead, the pawns have to jump
diagonaly over oppenent pawns to a free space, whenever it is possible. If a pawn lands on a spot, already occupied by an opponent pawn, the later is eliminated from
the game.

2. Im Kreise hin und der (In circles back and forth)
The players use 4 pawns, which the have to move to space 50 of their color. Movement is determined by 4 special dice.
Each roll counts for all players, according to the color of the results. The roll of a number moves a pawn accordingly forward. The roll of a dot moves a pawn
sideways between the red and green tracks or between the blue and yellow tracks. If a pawn reaches space 44 on the neighboring track, it continues at space 1 of it's own
track for another round.

3. Wer ist der Erste? (Who ist the first?)
Each player uses 1 pawn, which he has to move from space 1 to space 36 of it's own color. Movement is determined by 4 special dice. Results of one's own color allows
the pawn to move forward accordingly. Results of another color are deducted from the results of one's own color. The difference determines how much coins the player
gets from the cash box or has to pay into the cash box. The first player to reach space 36 wins the contents of the cash box. On spaces 12, 17, 24 and 34 positive
or negative points are multiplied.

4. Wer ist der Letzte? (Who is the last?)
Each player uses 4 numbered pawns. Movement is determined by 4 special dice. Each roll counts for all players, according to the color of the results. First each player
has to get his pawns onto the spaces 1-4 of his color according to the number of each pawn, so when a green 4 is rolled, the green pawn 4 is put on the green space 4.
Only when all four pawns are on the board, they are allowed to move. A pawn occupying the center space may be thrown out by an opponent's pawn. If a player may move more
than one pawn the numbers must be used in ascending order. For each rolled number has to be uses by another pawn, so when 3 red numbers are rolled, three red pawns have
to be moved, if this is not possible the move is forfeit. If two dots of one are rolled, the player may return one of his pawns to its starting position (spaces 1-4),
as long as non of his pawns has reached space 12. The last player to occupy the center space wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Baby Face Charades
description:
Baby face charades is the hilarious party game that inspires gut-busting laughter while putting your acting skills to the ultimate test. To play this charades-style game, you'll rely on your facial expressions and sound effects to act out clues for your team, all while looking like a big ol' Baby! On your turn, strap The puppet-baby below your chin and become the "big baby." without speaking, use the sticks attached to the baby arms to move the body, acting out clues using only the puppet-baby body, sound effects and your best facial expressions! Get your teammate to guess as many clues as you can to score points. Put your charades skills on display and get ready for big laughs with this super-funny game that's easy to learn and an absolute blast to play!

—description from the publisher

name: Etch A Sketch: What's My Sketch? Game
description:
The old classic becomes a new party favorite as players get 60 seconds to draw pictures that their teammates have to identify. Take a card and draw the object for others to guesS. Be prompted to draw images from over 200 cards in five different categories.

—description from the publisher

name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Godmother Promo Card
description:
Promo Card given by Lone Shark Games when purchasing The Devil at their online store or during their Kickstarter campaign.

The Godmother is a rage gift which has a couple of uses:

If discarded from your hand, it allows one extra die to boost your rage when confronting a gift or threat.
It can also be recycled if a saint within the same nexus or to your left or right loses when confronting a gift and was assisted by another saint. In this instance the assisting saint can confront the gift and if any saint provides you food, an addition bonus die is added to the confrontation.


Skill Keywords include
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Toonattik: The Game – Agents VS Recruits
description:
Shout, Scribble, Scrawl, Shriek and Sculpt your way around the Toonattik to victory!
It's Anna's Agents versus Rickers' Recruits but who'll get to the spy zone or the J-Pod and crack the code to win?
Match the pairs to enter the spy zone or J-Pod and face the ultimate spy challenge!!

—description from the publisher

name: Earthlin's Protectors of the Planet
description:
Earthlin's Protectors of the Planet is a "slam and move" game with an environmental protection message and an unusual mechanic to replace the usual "roll and move."

Players move along a track by slamming a stack of pogs with a slammer and moving the number of spaces shown on any pogs that flip over within a central circle on the board. Pogs may move a player forward or back, and others may grant bonus moves or cause loss of a turn.

The first player to reach the "Clean Earthlin" at the end of the track wins.

—description from the publisher

name: The Drowned Earth: The Bondsmen Fraction Starter Set
description:
There are many different kinds of mercenary, but perhaps the most feared are the bounty hunters who ask no questions: The United League of Bondsmen. 
A Bondsman may tell you he is part of a great tradition of hunting down transgressors and dangerous criminals, but the truth is quite different. Their only qualification is brutality, martial skill and a complete lack of moral qualms. Officially they are bounty hunters and thief takers. In reality more often than not they are slave-catchers, assassins and hired muscle. 
Their motto speaks for itself. For the Bondsman, cash talks, and the question “why?” is a mere formality.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Storytelling

name: The Order of Everything
description:
Knowledge is power in this game of lists! Race to place five things in the correct order before the sand timer runs out!

—description from the back of the box

In The Order of Everything: The Game Where Being Out of Order is Not an Option players are given a list of five things that must be put in order on a card (for example: Place these things in order of approximate water percentage: Earth's Surface, Human Body, Cucumber, Human Brain, Sun).

By the time the sand timer runs out, the player or team must place the items in correct order. The game ends when one person or team completes a pre-agreed number of lists correctly.

name: The Food Web
description:
The winner of this game is the first animal to collect enough food to enable it to reach the beginning of all food webs-the SUN.

Game play consists of players being Prey and Predators animals. Both attempting to reach the center of the board (the sun).

Rolling dice, the prey players move around the board trying to collect their three food cards by landing on the appropriate food spaces.

Predator animals, also move by rolling dice, but they collect their food card by landing on spaces where prey are located. they then draw a predator/prey card to see if the prey was caught. If they were, then the Predator gets to select a card from any food stack on the table and the prey goes back to its starting space. If they are not caught play resumes with both players on that space.

Once the animal has their three food cards,they can head to the sun in the center of the game board to win the game.

—user summary

name: Plietsch.
description:
CLEVER AND TRICKY GAMES FOR HAMBURG

45 cards. 4 games. Easy rules and lots of fun in a small box!
This card game is published by Hamburgs libraries network "Bücherhallen Hamburg".

The 4 games are:
"Sammelsurium": Cooperative tile placement and set collection
"Kuddelmuddel": Build loops the fastest you can...
"Humbug": Bluff and push your luck to get the points!
"Pick & Pack": Tactical card drafting game

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Knuknfutz
description:
One fabulous, fun and fantastic weekend Knuknfutz was founded by feisty female fossils! Believing in fun times with family and friends, we forged on to form a frenetic form of folly. Playing this game is just plain KNUKNFUTZ!!! Let the knuknfutz frivolty begin!

Object of the game: Try to reduce your score by trading out 1 card at a time during your play. Low score wins.

Do you have the strategy or luck to beat your opponent? Test your skills with KNUKNFUTZ!

—description from the designer

name: The Lost Realms Fantasy: Darkness Befallen
description:
The Lost Realms Fantasy: Darkness Befallen (also known as LORE:DARKEN) is a resource management, role playing game, taking place in the world of the Lost Realms, a world of skillful heroes, dark creatures, turmoil and magic. It is a collaborative game, allowing 1 to 4 players to collaborate and save the land from earth-shattering menaces and perils.

The estimated game time is 2-4 hours (depending on the number of players). Usually, the first run of the game takes about double the estimated time, for the players to go through the rules and understand the basics of the game. The suggested age span for players is 13-100 years old.

The player characters make their living in the game by undertaking quests, each of which offer rewards and opportunities, but under a constant threat of injury, depression and loss of incentive. Throughout their quests they gather resources and wealth, improve in Skills and Items, increase their reputation, gain Companions. On the other hand, each of their failures brings enemies and perils they will need to face before the end. Between quests the characters rest, recover and use their resources to better prepare for the following, bigger challenges. Alas, all they do bring them closer to facing the final challenge, also known as The Battle of Fate. The Battle of Fate is made against an unknown enemy, named the Enemy of Fate. Characters who succeed in the Battle of Fate, are named Champions of Fate. All others are forgotten, as bitter failures of history.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Koldun
description:
In a dark forests of Eastern Europe the Slavic tribes worship the old gods.
These gods can be benevolent and kind, but it takes a lot of effort to sway them to your side.
You and your rival magi will try to foresee the future of your people. Will there be a glorious war? Will peace be bestowed upon your tribe? Or will a plague break about?
The craft of the magi is the one full of doubleguessing: your rivals actions should be taken into account.
Make a correct prediction and plenty of goods will be yours. Get enough goods to win the gods to your side.
Fail and you will be left at a mercy of demons that can even defeat the most powerful gods...

—description from the publisher

name: アイドルマッチング (Idol Matching)
description:
アイドルマッチング (Idol Matching) is a Japanese card game. Players are recruiting performers to form a new idol unit.

Players scout idol candidate girls, found in various places, to form new idol units. The cards show a variety of young women with different skills and abilities. The winner is the player who formed the highest level unit among the completed units, with the level of the idle unit determined by the final combination of members.

The game is designed as a management training tool to encourage job-hunting students to understand the role of a recruiter to a business. By experiencing the recruiter perspective, the players can be better equiped to find new jobs themselves.

The game was originally published with a 40 card deck (in a pink box), but this was quickly replaced with an expanded 60 card deck (in a yellow box). Early owners of the game who presented their pink box at a game show were given the extra 20 cards for free.
user summary
categories: Card Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection
publishers: Career30.net (キャリアサーティードットネット)

name: Complicated Board Game the Card Game: Time 2 Play
description:
Complicated Board Game the Card Game: Time 2 Play is a stand alone expansion for Complicated Board Game the Card Game. This simple card game about playing complicated board games with your friends adds more than 50 new cards, Pieces, and introduces Solo Rules to the game.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to clear their Holdings of 5 random Piece cards. On a turn, each player has 2 Turn Points to spend which can be used to play Pieces on the Board or game mechanics from their hand (Rules, Solo Rules, Board States, Events, and Win Conditions). The player who can shape the board and rules most in their favor wins the game.

-description from designer

name: Rondezvous
description:
Space raced themed board game. The object of the game is for a player to move a space capsule around a circular board looking like a Gemini Space Capsule, down his entry path and to a Rondezvous point. The first player to do this is deemed the winner.
Each player has 10 capsules of one colour and can advance one capsule by one space at a turn. Players can jump and capture other players capsules either directly in front or directly left and right (similar to checkers). Players who lose all their capsules are out the game.

Moving down a players entry path the space capsule only has to reach the rendezvous point to win the game.

—user summary

name: AR Team
description:
A cooperative hybrid game with augmented reality. Each player chooses a character and tries to solve missions together with other players. The app shows you additional elements which are not visible on the game board.

Each character has different levels in strength, expertise, agility and intelligence. In this roleplay you interact with the virtual world by analyzing the environment, picking up items and analyzing them.

The players win by solving the current given task. Typically you will get tasks to solve mystery crime riddles. And you can solve them only if all players work together as each character has different strengths.

name: Redshift
description:
Redshift is a dexterity based space battle game which mixes tactical tabletop combat with a light worker placement element.

Each player builds and takes control of a single fleet from 1 or 4 different factions. These fleets battle across the tabletop moving, shooting, and launching ordnance by flicking disks that represent their ships and weapons.

Players will need to complete missions to earn points by visiting the various locations on the board and dropping off their boarding parties. Gathering resources, building new technology, and hatching devious plots. The first player to earn 20 points wins.

Redshift captures all the tactical combat of a tabletop miniature war game using a skill based dexterity system instead of dice and adds emergent game play as players gain objectives overtime through the placement of the boarding teams and ships.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Worker Placement

name: Criss Cross
description:
Scrabble clone that can be dated to about 1950, before the first official Swedish edition of Scrabble. As in Scrabble, gameplay consists of taking turns to place letter tiles forming words on the board to score points, then refilling your hand of tiles. Once there are no more tiles in the stock, the first player to empty their hand ends the game and earns a bonus. Some specifics:


The board is 17x17 and there are 101 letter tiles.
Each player has a hand of 8 tiles.
"Hooking" is allowed.
If the rules are taken literally, a player may only exchange tiles if they cannot play at all, and must then exchance all of their tiles.
Base scoring is 5p per vowel and 10p per consonant. White squares score triple, while numbered squares provide a flat but often substantial bonus. It also says you score double for playing in the coloured quadrant corresponding to your tile holder, but the tile holders provided are not coloured.


—user summary

name: Twilight Express
description:
The Twilight Express is a transcontinental train that carries all sorts of goods, crossing every city on the continent.
Every day at twilight, the train, loaded with expensive goods, departs from the main station, fuming out smoke. Heavily guarded, the Twilight Express is no easy target for robbers and bandits.

However, some people just never let go. And the players will have to make plans, hiring mercenaries and storing coal for their vehicles, to try to rob more expensive items from the train than the others. But when it comes to fighting the guards, they have to unite and thus, share the loot. And sometimes, plans just don’t work as planned and they could miss the train. No worries however as the Twilight Express will leave the station tomorrow and the next day as well!

The winner of the game is the one who, with a clever strategy, robs the most money from the train!

Each player secretly chooses cities where their bandits and coals should be sent. When all plans have been made, the players simultaneously reveal their plans and then send their bandits and coals to the chosen cities. Actions will be carried out only in the cities where player's bandits or coals have been placed in a row from the main station in City # 1.

Depending on the cities chosen by the players, they can rob cargo by repelling security guards, sell collected cargo, or even steal large amounts of gold at the gold mine.

The game ends when all the cargo tiles run out. The player with the highest score after adding the points gained with gold, and the special cards, wins the game.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: Das große Elbespiel: Vom Michel zur Kugelbake
description:
The players have to get their pawn (steamship) from space 1 (Michel) to space 16 (Kugelbake) and back to space 30 (Michel). Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events benefit or hinder the player. The first to reach space 30 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battle Cubes: The Age of Aries
description:
Lead your clan to victory in this fast-paced strategy game. Only one clan is destined to rule the Pangea. Win the game by making smart and strategic moves with your clan army in order to capture opponents' battle and chieftain cubes. Use traps and obstacles to your advantage, but beware of traitors in your ranks which could off balance your supremacy on the board. Become the only ruler of Pangea and force other clans to worship you as the supreme leader of Pangea.

Battle Cubes, the Age of Aries uses several different game mechanics, including dice rolling, worker placement, action selection, battle, and area control. Each clan has different special abilities which makes them unique. The game's length is determined by the number of battle cubes that players select to start the game with.

The unique thing about the game is the battle cube surrender action which shifts the balance of powers on the board. There is also direct player interaction in which players play their defensive actions on opponents' clan boards.

—description from the designer

name: Rinn in Pott!
description:
To start the game, each player puts a token into his pott, places the pot on any space on the game board and puts his remaining tokens on the space of his color.

Movement of the potts is determined by a die. The potts may move in any direction. If a pott gets on a space occupied by another pott, the later has to spill all it's tokens into the arriving pott. The player of th now empty pott has to put a new token from his colored space on the board into the pot.

If a player has no tokens remaining, he is eliminated from the game. The last remaining player wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fat Cat
description:
Push your luck to see who can be friends with the fattest cats.

On your turn, put a gift card into a row (bribes). If there are three matching suits in a row, that cat is busted: remove that row from this round. It would be easy, but at least one card is face down in the row at set up, so the row might be busted without you knowing it.

Grab a row before they're all gone, but only the highest sum at the end of each round keeps their fat cat card (and the victory points they are worth).

Each round has variable fat cats that keep things fresh. To win, collect 800 victory points or three fat cats. But each fat cat you befriend adds a suit to your future rounds, adding headwind to early leaders.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Humor
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck

name: Colossal Cave: The Board Game – ADV550 Expansion
description:
You've braved the hazards of Colossal Cave and achieved the exalted rank of Adventurer Grandmaster. But more fabulous treasures await you in the adventure 550 expansion! Will you be the first to travel to the far side of the Volcano View, map the Ice Caverns, and defeat the Nasty-Looking Ogre?

This expansion for Colossal Cave: The Board Game adds new puzzles, treasures and locations to the base game.

name: Adventures in Valyriah: Chapter One – The Great Forest
description:
Adventures in Valyriah - The Great Forest is an out and back treasure hunt type game. The players set out from the village of Raventown blazing a path into the Great Forest, each searching for 2 items. The first player to successfully bring their 2 items back to Raventown wins. While this might seem a bit boring, there are many things lurking about in the forest that might put some excitement in your travels and thwart your progress.

The game is designed as a family game, with no significant strategic advantages for anyone. As a matter of fact, trying to play strategically might just prove futile. Just when you think you are in a position to win, events may well mess things up. The game is designed for competition, but can also have some cooperative elements if the players should so choose. For videos and more information, please see links below. Thank you for your interest!

—description from the designer

name: 仲木戸⇔新逗子への旅 (Nakakido Shinzushi heno Tabi)
description:
仲木戸⇔新逗子への旅 (Nakakido Shinzushi heno Tabi) is a Japanese train game, designed quickly to celebrate the 3rd anniversary of Gamifi (a group that helps promote JPgames).

The designer wanted to capture the names of two railway stations, Nakakido and Shinzushi, on the private Keikyu line, before they are renamed in March 2020.

In the game, players try and build their own train journeys using the different decks of cards and dice to make a route on the Keikyu network. The four types of cards allow the different train speeds (normal, express, limited express, express special).

The game was made in a simple draw bag, and includes a blank d6 for a special undisclosed function.
user summary
publishers: Career30.net (キャリアサーティードットネット)

name: レッツ・プレイ・イノベーション！！ (Let's Play Innovation!!)
description:
レッツ・プレイ・イノベーション！！ (Let's Play Innovation!!) is a Japanese card game developed by a company specialising in business training. The core idea of the game is that players must go through a number of business failures before reaching success. That is, you cannot win the game without first failing. The process is intended to teach resilience, innovation, and the benefits of trial and error.

During the game, the players operate a business and aim for success. The game has a deck of cards, each providing different events, some progress their goals, some set them back, some provide new opportunities. Players try to develop their enterprise and turn setbacks into innovations, with a take that element in gameplay.

Players draw to their hand and then play from their hand. Some cards have special enhancing effects to already played cards. Most of the cards are split diagonally, with a positive side, and a black negative side. When a player puts the card into their tableau, they can turn it to show the positive benefits, or turn it to show the negative failures. Players must build on their failures before they can win.
user summary
categories: Card Game, Economic, Educational, Industry / Manufacturing
publishers: Encounter Design Co. Ltd (株式会社遭遇設計), Gamifi Japan

name: MatriO
description:
MatriO is a card and board game based on matrix multiplication. The game is played with standard (usually miniature-sized) playing cards and a special board, using specially designed markers to maintain player scores.

The board is laid out with three grids, a 3x4 grid and a 4x3 grid of card-sized trays and a 3x3 grid where players' "dot markers" are placed during the game. One of the card-tray grids is positioned to the left of the 3x3 grid, and the other card-tray grid is positioned above the 3x3 grid. The trays are labeled by card suit, a total of six trays for each suit.

Players are each dealt 13 cards (jokers are left in the deck, and the 4 of clubs and 10 of diamonds are discarded in advance of dealing). Players take turns placing a card in one of the trays on the board. If there are empty trays labeled with a given suit, then cards of that suit may only be played in one of those empty trays, and suited cards may not be played in an empty tray labeled with a different suit. Jokers may be played anywhere at any time.

When a player completes a row-column combination by filling the last empty tray of a row or column, the player places one of their "dot makers" in the cell of the 3x3 grid corresponding to the row and column combination they have just completed. The sum of the products of the correspondingly positioned cards in the row and column become that makers "dot score". This score can change throughout the game as other cards are laid in trays in that row and column.

When all 9 cells in the 3x3 grid are filled by players' dot markers, any player with no dot markers on the board is out of the game and their cards are discarded.

Remaining players continue to place their cards. When those players have plaid all their cards, the winner of the game is the player whose dot scores total is highest.

Numerical scores of cards are as follows: Queen of Spades: 13, all other black face cards 10, all black number cards their own numerical value. All red face cards are -10, and all red number cards are negative their own value. Jokers are 0.

—description from the designer

name: The Original Ski Game
description:
Let's go skiing with Alberto Tomba!!!

What's it all about.....

During the game you will play the part of a ski instructor in a large ski resort. The snow is perfect, the slopes are inviting and the facilities for the apres-ski are excellent. In other words the perfect ski surroundings.

Being a ski instructor is a popular profession and your competitors are awaiting their chance. Time and again you must prove your professional skills.

During the game you should try to score points off your collegues from the other skiing schools in speed, strategic insight and technique. Of course, you must not act recklessly as you must try to keep your pupils attentive while at the same time producing some results. What will you do? Will you conquer the black slope with the best pupils from your class or do you vote for team building and aim at getting all your pupils on the slope at the same time? Maybe you want to win the game by putting the other teams in a position where they cannot ski any further? Maybe you will decide on your goal during the game and let the situations you meet on your way guide you. It won't be easy to cross the finish first. On the way competing colleagues and unexpected obstacles may cause extra problems. So keep a cool head.

Have fun and good luck!

—description from the box
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Dark Metal
description:
A mercenary company is stranded within a star system as a cold war heats up and results in the destruction of the only wormgate in and out of the system. Not wanting to stick around and get caught up in an unprofitable war, they take a 100-year loop out into deep space and back in stasis. They awake to find no new wormgate, fractured civilizations, and broken cities. The Captain's first order of business is to find some real food to eat. And to figure out what the frak is going on.

Dark Metal: Mercenaries in the Deep is a solo or co-op, open miniatures science fiction tabletop adventure RPG. Players can create their own squad leader and allies, or select from one of the pre-made character sets to get started a little quicker. Movement is either distance or hex based and the board is created by the player based on the scenario's instructions. The gamer provides their own minis, terrain, and dice from their existing collection to create the experience.

Players go through a series of missions and scenarios linked together with progressive narrative elements on their journey to investigate what has happened within the star system since they left. They will grow in abilities, knowledge, and equipment as they are sent out on mission after mission. Player builds range from heavily armored warriors bristling with weaponry, to lithe bio engineered splicers dashing across the terrain to engage in close combat, to half metal cybernetic beings aiming high caliber weapons downrange to plink off enemies at a distance.

Dark Metal will be initially available as a print and play game with optional accessories.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: 小さきモノのフェーデ (Chiisaki Mono no Fehde)
description:
In 小さきモノのフェーデ (Feud of the Little Ones), two players act as gods competing for a store of faith by manipulating cards on a 6x6 chess-like board.

The cards come in three varieties: Units, or characters you can place and move to fight; Objects, which are buildings or other stationary items; and Actions, which affect the board without staying on it.

Each round, players draft Units, Objects, and Actions in turn, and then play some of each. In the War phase they get enough turns to move each unit once. Victory is achieved when you destroy all your opponent's units, get over 1000 Faith, or by having the most Faith at the end of four rounds.

Playing Units and Objects is free, but when units are destroyed they give Faith to your opponent, making stronger units riskier. Actions give you an immediate advantage but cost Faith, so getting the timing of everything right is of critical importance.

—user summary

name: JIYU The board game
description:
Theme: Feudal Japan in a fantasy setting where the Samurai and Yakuza are in heavy conflict

Game-play: A chess based game with RPG elements to keep the gameplay fresh and everyone on their toes. 5 Hero cards each represented by tokens with their own unique movement. Buff/Debuff cards that change the way they react to situations and also the ability to construct walls to block players or lay traps.

Goal of the game: To assassinate the clan leader or eliminate all present enemy board heroes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Civil War, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Miniatures, Print & Play, Territory Building, Wargame

name: Big Time Golf
description:
Congratulations! You and a friend have just made it into the lofty ranks of professional golfers! You’re about to play your first tournament as pros, but the two of you decide to play a round on the golf course a few days early. It’s a fairly tough course and bragging rights are on the line, so you really want to win this “friendly” match!

Big Time Golf isn’t just “choose your club and roll the dice” like every other golf game. While it does feature club selection, it’s card-based with press-your-luck gameplay, and has an unparalleled degree of player interaction. So grab your golf bag and let’s play!

—description from the designer

name: Wehrmacht: The European Theater of WW-II
description:
A strategic game of the European Theater of World War II. In many respects it appears to be a simplified version of John Prados' Rise and Decline of the Third Reich; it has a similar production system, in which the powers earn production points for what they control and spend them on units and other things, covers a similar array of military options, and has turns of the same length (three months). There are many smaller details which are the same, e.g. having only armor units exert a zone of control.

Five scenarios are provided. Four differ only in length - they cover from Summer 1939 to Spring 1945, Winter 1945-6, Winter 1940-1, and Winter 1941-2 - and can be played by from two to six players. The fifth scenario covers the same period as the first one but players are free to make any alliances they wish; this requires six players.

A few optional rules are provided, such as having Turkey and Spain enter as minor allies, building new production sources, partisans, etc.

name: Kick Punch
description:
Kick Punch is a wrestling inspired card/board game for 2-4 players and takes 45 minutes to play. Easy to play but takes skill and luck to master. Kick and Punch your way through your opponents using your unique wrestler and their skills to become the king of the ring! Fight your friends, destroy your enemies in Kick Punch!

Players play cards at the same time to attack and defend against the other wrestlers in the ring. Knock out your opponents to get the top spot in the ring and gain power to be able to activate your wrestlers unique skills. The first player to reach 20 power wins!

—description from the designer

name: Mini Space Rogue
description:
Strike it big by answering the frontier’s call! With space pirates swarming, you see the perfect opportunity to make a name for yourself. Rocket toward adventure! Explore a new star system filled with salvage, missions, technology, and pirate blasting! Your friends can eat your stardust when steal all the glory in this grand galactic adventure!

Mini Space Rogue is a competitive exploration and looting game with a modular board and spaceships. It includes dice rolling, pick up and deliver, grid movement, hand management, modular board, exploration, variable player powers, and worker placement.

Buy diverse loot, but find it hiding out there, too, and unlock new powers for your ship. Compete with other players for the shiniest ship and the longest list of the most fantastic feats. Discover new places and take your crew on a voyage through warp gates, black holes, and even board other ships and cause a ruckus!

The goal of the game is to earn the most Glory Points. The game ends when one player has achieved the goal number of points.

Objective
When a player earns 23 Glory Points (GP), play 1 more round and end the game. Every player with at least 23 GP wins and the player who achieved it first is the most glorious.

Round Order
Movement Phase
The current Captain moves their ship pawn up to 3 space tiles.
In turn order, each subsequent player does the same.

Action Phase
Players simultaneously perform any of these actions up to once in any order (if order ever matters, go by player order closest to the Captain):
Charge your shield any number of points
Trade with an adjacent player
Move any number of crew in your ship
Use any number of cargo items, bays, and weapons
Interact with your tile
Board an adjacent player

End Phase
Update the Glory Point Tracker.
The first player passes the Captain token to their left.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Campus in a Box
description:
Let’s build our own college together! Lead a department of student workers to enact your strategic plan across campus. Construct buildings in your name and convince your friends to visit them. Convene surprise committees and focus all the attention on you because it’s a race for whomever will have the biggest measurable impact on campus before the end of the school year! Lead a department and assign your student workers to gather resources. Use these resources to complete your department’s strategic plans and graduate students to have the biggest measurable impact on-campus. The goal of the game is to earn the most Contribution Points (CP)

Assets
These four sets of tokens complete Strategic Plans, earn additional student pawns, and graduate alumni. There is a hard limit on how many assets tokens there are (23) and once they are taken no more can be taken from the Public Supply until players return them. These are the four assets: Blue Labor, Red Satisfaction, White Prestige, and Yellow Approval.

Money
Use Money to construct buildings and enact Strategic Plans. There is no limit to how much money can be in the game. If players must use more than what is provided, keep track in any other way.
Special Regulations

Strategic Plans
These cards can be held face down or face-up at the discretion of each player. Keeping them confidential ensures other players don’t strategically monopolize resources you need. To complete a Strategic Plan, return the asset and money cost from your personal supply to the Public Supply or bank and retrieve the listed reward. Draw from the four face up cards unless instructed otherwise. Always replace a drawn Strategic Plan card with a new Strategic Plan. Put completed Strategic Plan cards under your Department Identity card and these remain secret until the end of the game.
If instructed to reset the Strategic Plans, shuffle the face-up four plans back into the deck and draw four new ones.

Committees
These will give you benefits or hinder other player’s progress. Go to the Alumni Center to play these and discard them after use. Players have a hand limit of 4 Committee cards and must discard down to 4 immediately whenever they exceed this limit. When the draw deck is exhausted, shuffle the discard pile to create a new one.

Constructing Buildings
Player 1 chooses a building to discuss. Starting with Player 1 and going clockwise, each player commits any amount of money towards the construction of a new building. Continue to go around until all players are satisfied with their contributions. If the total money committed meets or exceeds the building’s listed cost, move all contributed money to the Bank and build the building. Otherwise, return all player’s money and discard the building in question.
Continue this until all three buildings have been discussed.
When the draw deck is exhausted, shuffle the discard pile to create a new one.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Where is Mei?
description: Mei lost her way. Her older sister Satsuki and her class mate, Kanta, are searching for Mei. The game ends when one player finds Mei. Roll the dice, choose movement cards and explore the board to find Mei in this My neighbor Totoro themed game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Civil War
description:
The play is by months, which you mark by turning the calendar. Months on blue card such as March and May are North’s time to move. In the alternate months, which are red, South moves.

The game is designed so that its course will resemble the American Civil War, with North eventually overrunning the Southern states. Par to do this is 51 months. If North does it in that time, by May 865, he wins a the game. If he does not, South wins the game.

The war is over when South no longer holds any two of the state capitals shown on the board.

—description from the publisher

Each side brings their divisions onto the board, move them in their turn and resolve battles with dice.

—user summary

name: Exploration: Conqueror Spaceship Pack
description:
This expansion adds a new ship type for more strategies and increased replayability.

Components:

4x Conqueror Miniatures
4x Conqueror Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Point to Point Movement, Take That

name: Exploration: Recover Spaceship Pack
description:
This expansion adds a new ship type for more strategies and increased replayability.

Components:

4x Recover Miniatures
4x Recover Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Point to Point Movement, Take That

name: Exploration: Super Maneuver Spaceship Pack
description:
This expansion adds a new ship type for more strategies and increased replayability.

Components:

4x Super Maneuver Miniatures
4x Super Maneuver Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Point to Point Movement, Take That

name: SAM la pagaille: promo cards
description: Five new cards distributed by the publisher: 4 Cats and 1 Brown Fox. These cards allow to play with three different rules.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Animal Suspect: Promo cards "-18"
description: Six cards that can be add to the Expression stack of cards, to spice up the game.

name: Karibou Camp: Decibel add-on
description:
Three extra cards for the game. Céline the singer brings mayhem to the camp!

The 3 special "Céline" cards may replace 3 Scouts cards for a special Karibou Camp challenge. When a player plays a "Céline" card they shout "Céline!". All Card-swaps stop immediately. Next, one animal flees the hand of each other player because of the high pitched sounds; the player who played the "Céline" card picks a card randomly from each player's hand and discards it. The player then draw a new card from the draw pile, and play continues.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: The Anarchy of Power
description:
"Nothing is more anarchic than Power" said Pier Paolo Pasolini many years ago. The Anarchy of Power tells the history of Italian First Republic, from 1946 until 1994 when the coming of Berlusconi to power inaugurates a new age, the so called Second Republic. The game is a pure Euro-style, where players will play as families who will make machiavellian choices and moves to get power by interacting with events both concerning Italy and international ones, factions (from Mafia and Vatican to US and USSR) and characters from this very interesting historical period.

—description from the publisher

name: Mummy Match: Consonant Matching Game
description:
Mummy Match is an educational children's game designed to teach reading and letter sounds and also adds a memory element.

Players roll a die and move their pieces around the board. Each space displays a word starting with a different consonant, and the player must find a matching word from an array of face-down cards on the board. A match allows the player to roll again and continue moving. No match means the player's turn ends. The face-down card is replaced either way, giving other players information. Cards are color-coded in groups to narrow down the choices. The first player to move all the way around the track and return to the starting space wins.

name: Ad Gallia: An Ancient Variant for On To Richmond
description:
The rules were designed as an ancient variant for On to Richmond American Civil War Miniature Rules primarily focusing on Roman, Gauls and some late Greek Successor States. Complete rules for organization, operations, combat values, movement, fire power, melee, and morale are included. Also, special units and conditions of the period, such as elephants, chariots and war engines are covered.

This expansion for On to Richmond American Civil War Miniature Rules was first published as an article in Vol. VIII, No. 1 of The Courier magazine (1987).

name: ZigZag Pocket: Expansion #1
description:
This mini-expansion adds 6 new cards to ZigZag Pocket:

Deck swap: You can swap your deck of cards with that of another player.
10 seconds: Instead of distributing a first card to each player, put 4 or 6 cards in the center of the table. The owner of the card then has 10 seconds to make the exchanges he wants.
Card theft: The player can steal a card at random from an opponent's deck.
Card master: At the beginning of the turn, the card master looks at the 4 first cards and chooses who to give each card to.
Look at a deck (2 copies): This card allows to see the deck of any player.

name: Renaissance Rivals
description:
Compete for knowledge, favor and glory as one of the greatest artists the world has ever known! Renaissance Rivals is a 2-4 player card-driven game that can be played in about an hour, combining streamlined tableau and deck building with an innovative system of tactical movement. Players take on the role of artists of the Italian Renaissance as they move around a "map" of Italy (represented by a 4 x 4 grid of cards), using the cards drawn from their decks to obtain Commissions and complete eight unique Masterpieces. On a typical turn, you will draw four cards from your deck to generate Influence points (which allow you to acquire Commission cards) and Advancement points (required to complete your artist’s Masterpieces). Every time you acquire a Commission, you must decide whether to add the card to your deck to generate more resources in future turns, or add it to your Palette to unlock the Skills that will enable you to obtain more valuable Commissions and complete more prestigious Masterpieces. Different kinds of Commissions trigger movement in different directions, so you need to be strategic about the order in which you acquire them. Furthermore, each Masterpiece can only be executed in its designated city (or "map" row), so completing all eight will require strategy and foresight!

The game ends when any player completes all her Masterpieces, or as soon as a player obtains the most highly prized commission, the rebuilding of the Basilica of St. Peter’s. Victory Points are scored for Commissions remaining in each player's deck and for each completed Masterpiece, and the player with the highest total is the winner.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Print & Play, Renaissance
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Movellans
description:
This expansion adds Movellans to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, three Movellan faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Slitheen
description:
This expansion adds Slitheen to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, three Slitheen faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Ogrons
description: This expansion adds Ogrons to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures (cards sold separately) to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Vervoids
description:
This expansion adds Vervoids to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures (cards are available for free download) to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Headless Monks
description:
This expansion adds Headless Monks to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, three Headless Monks faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Kitsune of Foxes and Fools: Shivo
description: This was a promo character created for distribution at Kitsune Kon in 2014. The character promo card can be used in play just like any other character in Kitsune: of Foxes and Fools.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Goetia: Nine Kings of Solomon – Scrolls of Qumran Mini Expansion
description: Scrolls of Qumran adds a new card type: "Scroll" which gives players the ability to trade resources.

name: Goetia: Nine Kings of Solomon – Familiars
description:
The Familiars expansions adds custom wooden meeples which represent familiars (bears, hawks, lions, dromedary etc) which players can acquire from the outskirts.

Familiars are played together with a follower, and will give players extra abilities, for instance:

Immediately take back your follower
Gain 2x cubes
Send opponent followers back to the outskirts.


When a player has used a familiar, at the end of the round, that familiar is returned to the outskirts so that it may be acquired by other players.

—description from the publisher

name: 無限合体ロボット (Mugen Gattai Robot)
description:
無限合体ロボット (Mugen Gattai Robot) is a Japanese card game of combining robot parts.

In the year 204X, Japan is under threat from outside forces. The government responds by building a series of defence robots to protect the people. But Japan is too small to store the robots intact, so they must be kept in pieces and re-combined as needed.

The players work to build a robot out of a variety of components in order to meet the oncoming threat. The main robots form a series of specialities: land, space, ground, air, underwater, female, force, flame, and almighty. But in the game, these parts are inter-changeable into infinite combos. So players try to build the robot with different characteristics by combining parts from all types.

The game has 12 story cards (the players work to resolve five of the stories), and 48 robot parts. A complete robot has a head, torso, arms and legs. Players are dealt five robot cards at random and then draw and discard cards to try and get a whole robot in their hand that will resolve the story.

When everyone has a robot prepared, they are shown. the one that scores highest against the target wins the round and takes the story card. The robot parts are shuffled and redealt and the game continues. the winner is the player who gets the most story cards.

The robot deck includes a computer virus card. If theis is included in the game, it disrupts play by making random changes to a player's hand. Their neighbour discards a card at random from their hand, disrupting their plans.

The designer intended players to enjoy the experience of building robots like the anime of their childhood. The game can be played by young children by just experimenting with robot combos.
user summary
categories: Animals, Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Modern Warfare, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Hier spielt die Musik
description:
This is a game for 2 - 6 players with 3 different games for different age Groups.

On the one hand, they provide for early-age, playful use of musical instruments and, on the other hand, fun, information, education and entertainment for the whole family.

The first game: discover musical instruments
is for children from 5 years old, they can playfully discover musical instruments and additionally train their memory.

The second game: getting to know musical instruments and their secrets
Here are children from 8 years and their parents try to collect as many pictures of instruments as possible in the exciting cube race. Attention: Only those who correctly answer a question about the respective instrument will receive the picture card.

The 3rd game: music party
This variant is intended for teenagers from 12 years and for adults. Who can best assert himself with wit, brains and charm in the big wide world of music? The communicative form brings a lot of humor, fun, creativity and a lot of information about the current music scene into play.

—user summary

name: All American Basketball
description:
The game follows basketball in method of play, and in rules. Each player has five tokens, representing either the red or blue team,-two forwards, two backs, and a center. A ball is also furnished for use in play.

The spinner is arranged with five circles marked: Goal; Pass; Dribble; Break; Tip-off. Player call their plays before spinning, and when the arrow stops the spin is read and the play carried out.

The player who has the ball continues to spin and play until he loses the ball by an interception or otherwise, or until a goal is made. Then of course, players spin once more for Tip-off.

—description from the publisher

name: Realm of Chaos: Wrath and Rapture
description:
Wrath and Rapture, Rage and Pain, Violence and Grace. All of this and more can be found in the Realms of Chaos: Wrath and Rapture. This incredible set unleashes the uncontrolled fury of the Blood God, Khorne, and the seductive temptation of the Prince of Pleasure, Slaanesh. Not only do you get a host of daemonic minions that serve these rival Chaos Gods, but there are no less than three booklets that introduce new background and rules for both Warhammer Age of Sigmar and Warhammer 40,000! Here’s what you'll find in the set:

- 38 Citadel Miniatures, including the following:

Daemons of Khorne
1x Karanak, the Hound of Khorne
10x Bloodletters
3x Bloodcrushers
5x Flesh Hounds

Daemons of Slaanesh
1x Infernal Enrapturess
10x Daemonettes
3x Fiends of Slaanesh
5x Seekers of Slaanesh

- A 24-page Wrath and Rapture booklet, describing the endless and ever-shifting dimension utterly devoid of reason and logic that is the Realm of Chaos (if such a thing is even possible). The concept of the Great Game played (and fought) between the Dark Gods is introduced, in which Khorne and Slaanesh are two of the fiercest rivals. There is an entire section of the nature of daemonic names, and there are also three tables of such names for you to generate for your Daemons.

- A 24-page Denizens of the Warp booklet, which introduces tales of murderous conflicts fought between the daemonic legions of Khorne and Slaanesh in the 41st Millennium. Also included are three Echoes of War missions and a campaign to help you refight these battles, as well as Stratagems and a full set of datasheets for the models included in the box.

- A 24-page Bane of the Mortal Realms booklet, describing an exciting storyline that led to bitter war between the rival Chaos powers and providing a trio of battleplans to refight them. It also includes full sets of warscrolls for all of the Khornate and Slaaneshi miniatures in the box, as well as their allegiance abilities and warscrolls, and two warscroll battalions.

- A double-sided token sheet containing two 9" range rulers, a Prey of the Blood God marker (used to identify Karanak's prey), Khornate and Slaaneshi wound markers, and six numbered objective markers.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Castle Board Game
description:
In the Castle Board Game narrative, the King of White and King of Black have grown too old to fight. Yet, their years of backstabbing and bitterness have lead to yet another war. Since the Kings can no longer fight, they have fortified themselves inside their Castles to defend themselves. In Castle Board Game, the kings do not move from their positions in the center of the back row of the board. Each king directs his armies to achieve victory by capturing the opposing king.

In order to counterbalance the huge disadvantage of an immobile King, walls have been erected to provide defensive advantages for each Castle. Additionally, a new character, HouseCarl, has been added to protect the fixed position of the King. As you embark on this new journey, beware of spies that can sneak through Castle walls unnoticed. Prepare yourselves for the dynamic adventure in strategy that is Castle Board Game.

—description from the designer

name: Hurricane
description: Hurricane is a collaborative game where you are trying to survive hurricanes by purchasing different protections. You can purchase these for different amounts of gold that you get every day. You win if you survive five hurricanes. If you draw a hurricane card, then the power of the hurricane (written on the card) is subtracted from your protections points. If the ending number is positive, then you survive. You lose if a hurricane destroys you. Can you survive the Hurricane?

name: The Sound Cypher
description:
The Sound Cypher is a game that was developed out of a love for good music. In its infancy, the game started off as a light hearted rivalry between two people to see who had deeper music knowledge and better taste. Over time the rivalry evolved into a living room game shared amongst friends & family. Now, it’s coming out as a card game that people of all ages can enjoy.

There are three editions ready for release including the Open format edition, R&B/Soul edition, and the Hip-Hop edition. No matter the age or music preference of the players, The Sound Cypher is easy to play and fun for everyone in the room!

To start the game, the first player picks a card from the deck then reads it out loud. They then have 90 seconds to play their first song. The second player has up to 2 minutes or until the end of the second verse to play their song, and so on.

Voting is done in one of two ways. Players can vote for their favorite song by placing a card in the designated area at the end of each round; the player with the most votes wins. Live voting can also be employed via the audience as the game is in progress. At the end of any voting option, the best song wins.
The Sound Cypher has rules that must the adhered to be eligible to win each round. Some of the rules include:

No use of search engines or online sources
Song played after time limit not eligible to win
All songs get to play for at least 1 minute
Players can only vote for themselves once
Ties are settled by the greatest number of YouTube views
Artists can only be used once per round
Songs can only be used once per game
The card dictates the type of music for each round


So, whether you’re 7 or 70, a casual music listener or a die hard music fan, a group of complete strangers or old friends The Sound Cypher is a great way for everyone to enjoy music in a way they never imagined. After playing The Sound Cypher you’ll never listen to music the same way again!

—description from the designer

name: Spaß an Zahlen
description:
Recognize, name, compare and arrange numbers. With the help of this little card game children of preschool age can easily learn the numbers from 0-35.

—description from the publisher

Spaß an Zahlen was part of the game package Stadt Land Spielt! Mini Games 2019.

name: Chess Kingdom Knight & Dragon
description:
With a fun 3D pyramid structure and colourful wooden components, Knight & Dragon aims to introduce the ABCs of chess and develop fine motor skills, attention and memory.

Players must guide their Knight through the Chess Kingdom and up a high hill to reach a tournament that is being held at the Ruby Castle. On the way they must overcome intricate traps and battle a dangerous dragon by gaining and playing crown chips - on the reverse these have chess pieces of varying value by type and they are stored on the player's shield panel. Players progress around and up the board, traversing the traps using the chips which serve to stop the marble held underneath their wooden knight from falling. Battles between Knights and the dragon compare the relative values of the white and black chess figures on the Knight and the Dragon, the latter represented by dragon chips. To win the battle the player must knock down the black figure with their white figure or figures of the same or a higher value. The game ends when no more dragon chips are left in the bank and the winner is the player with the most points value left on their shield panel.

The game box also includes a colourful standard chess board and cardboard stand-up chess pieces.

The game was developed by Alexandra Kosteniuk, the 12th Women's World Chess Champion, and includes a book of Chess Rules written by her that includes puzzles to work through and a glossary of chess terms. "Let me welcome you to the exciting world of the Chess Kingdom! Go for it, always move ahead towards your ultimate goal! I wish you success in both games and everyday life.

—description from the publisher

name: Bad Doctor Expansion: 4 Starting Patient Cards
description:
These are 4 Starting player cards that you can choose to play instead of the base starting player cards given out at conventions. These are:

You'll Shoot your eye out, kid
Stomach Bug
Sports Injury
I think I need Glasses


You can choose one or all of these to your game.

name: The King's Challenge
description:
The King, his court, and a visiting Frenchman are bored on a long winter day. The King challenges them to a series of races to the top of a hill near the castle. The servants of the castle - the players - are to help the racers. There are great rewards for helping the King win a race? Will you end up helping him?

The King's Challenge is a hand-building game in which players compete to play the best 4-card hand to the table as early as possible over 7 turns. But, there is a catch - the hand must have a card from each suit. Rewards for the winning hand decrease the later it is played in the round and bonus points are awarded for stronger winning hands.

Have three of a kind? Great! But do you have a card from the fourth suit to play with it? Have a straight? Excellent! But do the four cards cross all four suits? Should a weaker hand be played earlier to try to win more points, or should it be held to potentially build a stronger hand that is more likely to survive to the end of the round? These are just some of the challenges to be faced when playing The King's Challenge.

The Patriot Edition (The President's Challenge) and the Texian Edition (The General's Challenge) of the game vary the theme from a King and his court to President Washington and other patriots and General Sam Houston and other Texians of the Texas Revolution, respectively.

—description from the designer

name: Zombie A Social Club: Carte promo Road N Troll
description: A promo card, from the neutral faction, featuring the French youtube chanel Road N Troll. Can be add to the game and be played as a neutral regular card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Zombies

name: Cube It
description:
Cube It is a game of numbers. A player rolls two percentage dice to obtain a number between one and one hundred. Then, (s)he has three turns to equal that number exactly with five six sided dice using mathematical operations.

The game contains two D10 and five D6. The D10 are the percentage dice as one has numbers 00 to 90 and the other 0 to 9. They roll these to get one number (called the Target Number) that must be matched exactly by rolling five D6 and using any mathematical operation among them. Players score points based on being able to do this with few throws of the D6, if the target is prime, or if some of the five D6 are not needed.

The game works fine solo, and competitively can be played where everyone uses the same dice to come up with best and fastest answer or where each player rolls individually for the best total score.

Game comes in small plastic bag.

—user summary

name: Happy Doomsday
description:
Have you ever had thought of the perfect scenario to end the world? Well, this may be the game for you. Players will take turns devising scenarios of the apocalypse in many different ways, shapes, and forms. Then they will create resolutions to the players scenarios--and decide which is best. The game is accessible for most ages and skill levels and incorporates elements from similar storytelling games, however depending on the players, the game may not be suitable for all ages.

At the start of the round a player is chosen as the creator of the problem. the creator is dealt three problem cards and the other players are dealt three resolution cards. Now the game begins.
