The creator will choose one card they would like to play from their hand and tell the story of the problem in detail, creating a scenario. the players with the resolution cards will choose which word or person they will select based off one card in their hand. Players will explain how they will avert the crisis in front of them and the creator will choose one winner that gives the best resolution to the problem. The winner then becomes the next creator.

Welcome to Happy Doomsday. We have taken the time to ensure the game is a fun experience for all ages and enjoy a healthy debate on your scenario for saving the world. Different people will play different ways, feel free to use your favorite figures and icons to keep the game fun. Welcome to Happy Doomsday! Players will be dealt cards representing different things, for some they may be iconic characters from popular culture, others a simple answer to a complex problem, the game uses your imagination to drive the game play and varying outcomes.

Happy Doomsday can be best described as a role-playing multiplayer problem-solving party card game; or simply a Post Apocalyptic Party Game, where creativity is pivotal to winning. Happy Doomsday fuses traditional role-playing storytelling elements from its predecessors with a competitive party game format. The game uses a Judge System, one player per round is the Creator they will form the Doomsday Scenario, the other players from their hand of five cards must devise of scenario to the other players.

—description from the designer

name: The King's Storm Challenge
description:
During one of races for The King’s Challenge, a storm arises. The players must work together to rescue the King and his court from the storm.

The King's Storm Challenge is a two player (or two team) cooperative game included on the reverse side of the game board for The King's Challenge. It has only ever been released as a part of editions for The King's Challenge, but it otherwise operates as an independent game. The theme for the Storm Challenge varies with the theme for other editions of The King's Challenge - The President's Storm Challenge and The General's Storm Challenge.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: GearMan GO!
description:
It's the marvellous, it's the super, it's the amazing... GearMan GO! race'em-up!

GearMan GO! is a fun comic book race game for 2 to 4 players of all ages.

Races are unique each time with the random Action spaces, modular hex track boards, cars bumping and changing gears.

Cars are driven by rolling various black and white Gear dice looking for doubles. Move your car one space for each dice of each double thrown into the matching color space on the track.

Try to stay in the highest gear possible by avoiding the POW and BOMB spaces. The lower your gear the less dice you roll. Drive over the WOW and SUPER spaces to gear up or boost to top gear!

Customize and build your own circuits with the modular hex boards or for further playability you can also add the GearMan GO! Expansion Pack which extends the circuit with more hex board straights & curves and adds two additional cars.

Races can comprise of 1 to 3 laps. First player to complete the set laps wins.

—description from the designer

Playable free at Tabletopia.com
https://tabletopia.com/games/gearman-go
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Mythical Beasts
description:
Do you know the difference between a minotaur and manticour? A chimera and chupacabra? A kelpie and a selkie? Learn all about these incredible creatures, their amazing powers, and the unbelievable stories behind them. Dozens of detailed illustrations, 15 life-like replicas, and a Minotaur"s Maze board game bring these magnificent magical creatures to life.

—description from the publisher

A roll and move game to make use of the monsters provided. Land on certain spots and take thematic actions based on the monsters. Get the sphinx and answer a riddle.

—user summary

name: Hit City Hustle
description:
Hit City Hustle is a tabletop card game that requires strategy, memory, and a little bit of bluffing to come out on top. Players have only 2 actions per turn, so play goes fast. Players will move cards around in a field of nine, discover potential targets, position cards in their own hand, draw new cards, collect coins, and attempt to whack rival Clients to earn victory points.

There are only 2 kinds of cards in Hit City Hustle: Clients and Hitmen. Clients are recruited and used to earn coins. Higher value Clients can earn more coins, but are also worth more victory points to rivals. Hitmen are recruited and then paid to eliminate rival Clients. Higher value Hitmen are stronger, but more expensive to activate.

Cards remain facedown for most of the game. This allows plenty of opportunities to bluff about the value of a Client or a Hitman. Bluffing allows bold players to get a leg up on the competition. However, rivals can call anyone’s bluff by paying a coin. Get caught bluffing and your action is forfeited. Special rules on unique cards also affect play!

Once a player reaches 15 or more victory points, finish the round so all players have had the same number of turns. Finally, count all players' victory points and whacked clients to determine the winner!

—description from the designer

name: Galactic Presidency
description:
In the year 2130, after multiple wars between the planets nearly destroyed the galaxy, the ruling governments decided to resolve control of the galaxy through means of combat in the arena. Every ten years each planet sends its strongest candidate to win votes through skill in battle and the determination of the government's leading senators. Only after the blood and death that such an election as this can bring will a candidate be named Galactic President.

Galactic Presidency is a complex strategy game that uses both cards and dice. In each round candidates (players) utilize an Alien Power and have up to three senators, each using a unique weapon, battle for supremacy in the GALACTIC ARENA. All senators start with the same amount of health for their "head, body, and legs." A senator is killed when they no longer have health in one of these areas. Besides the use of Combat Cards there are also random events that can help or hurt all senators and will in some cases kill them. Candidates can win "Electoral Votes" but the vote value is kept hidden and is only revealed and counted if there is no clear victor at the end of the game.

The game can be played with 2 to 5 players, 12 years or older. The playing time is between 1.5 and 2.5 hours depending on your modifications to the rules - its easy enough to lengthen or shorten your game time. Our game is designed to promote "enjoyment through creativity" as well as keeping the potential to win the game even if the player had all of his senators killed.

To win the game a candidate must win two of three rounds, which is when one candidate is left standing, or have the greatest number of Electoral Votes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Political, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Missing Persons
description:
Missing Persons is a turn-based game that includes 18 cards and five 'missing people' in the form of player pieces. Your goal is to be find the missing persons during your round, or the rescue mission, and save one of per round. There are a total of five rounds, each round you have the opportunity to save one missing person.

Shuffle the 18 cards to form a face-down draw deck. Remove the top card of the deck from the game without looking at it. Each player draws one card from the deck. This is the player’s hand, and is kept secret from the others. On your turn, draw the top card from the deck and add it to your hand. Then choose one of the two cards in your hand and discard it face up in front of you. You must apply any effect on the card you discarded. All discarded cards will remain in front of the player who discarded them, keeping them visible to all playing. Since this is a game of deduction and reasoning, this will help players try to count which cards are remaining. After applying the card’s effect, the turn passes to the next player, this game is played clockwise. A round ends when the deck is empty at the end of the final turn, the player with the highest rank hand saves the hostage. If there is a tie, the player who discarded the highest total of cards is the winner, even if that player was previously eliminated. The winner of the round oversees the next investigation and will shuffle the cards and begin another round.

Missing Persons is a Search and Rescue game that is similar in play style to other deceptive based games. Your goal is to rescue as many of the hostages in play as possible.

—description from the designer

name: Cahokia
description:
In the year 1100, centuries before European contact, Cahokia was a vast and sprawling city. Located along the Mississippi River, the city was known for its earthen mound monuments, sophistocated culture, and expansive trade routes. At its peak, it is estimated that Cahokia residents numbered in the tens of thousands. It is also speculated that Cahokia may have been larger than London at that time.

Cahokia: Rise of the Mound Builders is a worker placement game that takes place in pre-Columbian North American. Players take on the role of influential families who help to cultivate the Cahokia and its earthen monuments. During the game, players will place their matriarch and patriarch pieces, as well as their growing family member pieces in order to hunt and gather for food, and valuable resources. In addition, the players will use their workers to craft jewelry, build buildings, and erect large earthen mounds.

The goal of the game is to earn the most victory points. These points are earned in a number of ways, including mound and building construction, crafting jewelry, earning trade goods, and earning wealth.

Monks mound is the largest of the earthen mounds at Cahokia. It will require all of the players to contribute to its construction. When Monks Mound is complete, the game ends. The player with the highest score wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Dorks and Orks
description:
Lead your party of Dorks to fight through a horde of Orks. Whoever collects the most loot wins!

Dorks and Orks is a custom dice chucking game where players send Dorks of various character classes to fight off Monsters. Players will earn Copper, Silver, Gold and Platinum for their heroics.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Minikin Saga: Branches
description:
Help the Minikin, a small colorful mouse, to get food from some Magical Branches that can grow lots of fruits; but beware of the nasty spiders that are going to eat your food before you get it.

A cute short Solitaire game to carry out to any place, move through the Cards and organize them to get them before the nasty spiders eat them.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: James Last Party: Partyspiel
description:
This is a simple roll and move game. The players start as couples which are mixed up or separated in the run of the game. It's a pledges game too. When all players have arrived at space P the winners are determined by the roll of a die. The first player or couple to roll a 6 wins the game an the appointed prize.
Swingers couple game.
—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Das lustige Kunerol Wettrennspiel
description:
The players start on space 1. The first to reach space 100 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. Some spaces hinder or Benefit the players, or cause the winning or losing of game tokens.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spyfall: Dracula's Castle
description: A 8 card location expansion to Spyfall
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Criminal Underworld
description:
You’ll be in charge of sending out attacks, setting up defenses, running side businesses, managing your organization’s money, trading goods, making alliances & deceiving enemies. This is a headquarters defense/money management game where each decision you make has a consequence. Anything goes in this game.


HOW TO PLAY



A turn consists of players using money they've earned to play 2 cards from their hand of 5 cards. Once the 2 cards are played and replaced from the deck, their turn is over.

Depending on what two cards were played a variety of things could have happened. If someone played a criminal activity or trade card, they got money from either the black market or another player. If a defense card was played then it was used to defend the headquarters or a business. If an offense card was played then another player was attacked. If a business card was played then the player gained a new way to generate money each turn. All this while negotiating deals with other players and trading cards and money. And any deals made, can be broken. This is the criminal underworld after all.


HOW TO WIN



The aim of the game is to be the last player standing. Do this by eliminating all other criminal organizations. You eliminate a criminal organization by bringing their power down to zero. Once all other players are eliminated you win.


GAME STORY



The criminal underworld of Palm City has been operating without interruption since the city was first founded. The criminal way of life is sewn into the fabric of these people’s culture. Due to this, both the city and the criminal underworld within it have thrived. Leaving plenty of room for each sector of crime to have its own fully operational organization with its own established leader. All cyber crimes are initiated by the Shadow Crew. Weapons coming into the city go through Hell’s Angels. Drugs are manufactured and distributed by Los Zetas. Protection is given to businesses from the Buscetta Family. The art of assassinations are strictly Yamiguchi-Gumi. And lastly prostitution is an option in this city. The girls are protected and managed by The Richardson Gang. That was before, this is now. Business can only get so good without expansion, and with the city’s potential capped out, there is only one option for bringing in more money. Start dipping into the other sectors of crime. With the Buscetta Family selling drugs and Shadow Crew dealing weapons it is only a matter of time until someone feels like they’ve been wronged. A matter of time until they feel their piece of the pie is getting smaller. That’s when war begins. And when the dust settles, only one organization will be left standing. Times are changing.

Welcome to the Criminal Underworld.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Nineveh Card Deck System
description:
Nineveh, unlike any deck of cards in existence today, is a card deck system consisting of 67 cards and features more than 20 unique card games for 1-13 players.

Resurrected from the ashes of the ancient wicked sin city of Nineveh, after the Babylonian conquest of 612 B.C., comes the root of all card games, the NINEVEH CARD DECK. This patent-pending deck offers a multitude of easy to learn, fast-paced competitive games. Battling for points dominance, there are 1/3 more blue point cards (33), but the red point cards (22) have more overall point values. The powerful Mercy & Wrath cards add a unique twist. Games include one-of-a-kind solitaire, 1v1 duels, heroic team-play games and intense group party play (including poker games).

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Educational, Game System, Math, Memory, Party Game

name: Vanagloria Galaxy
description:
Vanagloria Galaxy is a Sci-fi board game in which the best strategy has to be planned and unravelled through the numerous possible combinations.

Vanagloria Galaxy is a strategic board game for 2-6 players with territorial control elements, set in a galaxy called Vanagloria.

Each player is in charge of an army of Dreadnoughts, with the objective of conquering specific strategic areas (called Platforms) to arm, reinforce, increase the number of Dreadnoughts and especially obtain points to achieve galactic supremacy.
Vanagloria Galaxy is a game based on few rules and high levels of difficulty due to the planning involved, which will probably be destroyed at the end of each turn by opponents’ actions, being basically similar to chess. Fundamentally the result of the game depends on your choices, as a good choice can result in a win or otherwise. This is why you have to foresee your opponent’s moves and always chose the move that can best counteract your opponent’s possible moves or chose moves that can most easily take you to victory.

The game has numerous possibilities in terms of the order of Turns and many combinations of Game Tiles to create boards that are always different, so that each game can be a totally different experience from previous ones.

The game can also be varied in scale, due to the adaptiveness of the board to different numbers of players.

—description from the publisher

name: S.O.S. Special Operative Simon
description:
"When instinct is the last defense
Against threats unforeseen,
I takes a cunning master thief
Perchance to save a queen."

The Sly line of games, until now, has featured Jack Sly, cunning master thief, in his rise to become the most legendary jewel thief in history. But now, the story diverges, with a focus on Jack's twin, Simon Sly, who has been recruited to protect the Queen of an African nation from her enemies. In the meantime, can Simon subtly help his brother pull off the most incredible jewel heist in history? With his own life and his duty to protect the queen tugging him every which way at once, can he rise to the challenge?

Special Operative Simon is a card game akin to traditional Cribbage. In gameplay, there are a series of Target cards valued 9-15, featuring various spies Simon encounters, some more dangerous than others. As you combine a limited supply of 14 cards (valued 2-7 with a variable Ace) against these targets, you will only have the opportunity to retrieve these cards when meeting targets precisely. Therefore, the challenge is to complete all of Simon's missions with a dwindling supply of Combiner cards, and not let the Combiner cards run out too soon.

While its roots are traditional, the game features character artwork designed to bring players into this world of spies in the 1940's.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Deduction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Lost City of Z
description:
An old-school style solitaire game of exploration and adventure based on the popular non-fiction book.

In 1925, legendary British explorer Percy Fawcett set out with a small party to find the fabled Lost City of Z in the Amazon rain forests of Brazil. They never returned.

Playing as Fawcett, you will lead your small exploration party through the dense jungles and rough whitewater rapids of South America. Dangers you and your party will face include poisonous snakes, hostile natives, disease, starvation, and drowning.

Can you survive long enough to find the Lost City of Z, or will you and your party vanish without a trace?

Game components include navigation maps, various mats, a tables book, and a counter sheet representing individual party members, food, equipment, guns, etc.

The player will move his expedition team's game counter across multiple maps- deeper and deeper into the forest, rolling on multiple tables each turn. Whether the Lost City of Z is found or not, the team must eventually make it's way back to the starting point.

—description from the designer

name: Minikin Saga: The Fountain
description:
The Spirits of Love and Fortune want to get wishes for their favor, so they put their magic to work by influencing the people of the kingdom to make a wish by throwing a coin into The Fountain.

Stardust Saga: The Fountain is a 9 Card Game created in the "Storytime Saga" World, in this game players have a duel influencing the habitants, by playing one of the unique 9 Cards per turn into a 3 x 3 Grid, planning ahead so the "Cards" will throw a Coin of the Player's color to the center of the grid "The Fountain". A fast strategy game of reading your opponent's movements and forcing it to give you the victory.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Path to Prosperity
description:
Path to Prosperity is a exploratory resource management board game. essentially it is a race to build up the largest kingdom. you traverse the board with your own pawn collecting resources until you have enough supplies to build a settlement. once you have a structure in place you receive materials from said structures and expand your resource intake. there are ways to sabotage and frustrate your opponents progress using the soldier pieces. Victory is achieved when one player builds their castle piece.

You set up the starting portion of the board with one of each resource tiles and the starting city tile in the center. placing the player pieces on the starting resources, you decide who goes first and then proceed to travel around the map, you first decide where you want to go on or off the current board as long as it's adjacent to your current location. then if it is off the board you get to draw a terrain tile and place your piece on it, and finish by resolving the tile. when you have built at least 3 settlements 2 cites and 1 castle, utilizing the resources gathered from traveling the board and harvested by your structures, you have achieved the victory condition.

A simple game with a simple objective for family play.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Imagine I can... Flower Fairy Find
description:
The small games in the Imagine I Can... collection of mini-games-in-a-tin are geared at children 3 and up.A game for 2 - 5 players. Contents 27 cards, 1 numbered die, 1 coloured die and 1 fairy die. The object of the game is to collect 5 cards.

Flower Fairy Find: Place all cards randomly face up on the table. Take turns rolling all 3 dice. At the same time, all players will attempt to find and take the card(s) as quickly as possible according to what is rolled on the 3 dice. If the card(s) matching the combination on the 3 dice is already been taken, the next person rolls. Game is over when a player collects 5 cards or when all the cards picked up. In this case, the player with most cards wins.

name: REIVER
description:
Renaissance Period Skirmish Rules - the first title in the planned 'Histories - Raiders' series, by Steve Winter of Dropwing Games.

These rules cover the border warfare skirmishing that took place along the Anglo-Scots border areas throughout the fifteenth and sixteenth century.

'The system includes suggestions for restraining and capturing opponents, looting buildings, and stealing livestock, as well as covering the different types of weaponry used for close and ranged combat.'
categories: Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Mystery In The Library: A Mystery Party Card Game
description:
OVERVIEW:

The other night, when many characters were out of their books enjoying a sojourn in the night air, a crime was committed, grim and grave, right in our own library. As a result, his Majesty Henry VIII — that famous monarch from the English history books — has disappeared. Gathered are the characters that were present at the time of the nasty deed. The perpetrator of this heinous crime will no doubt be revealed as the party proceeds.

HOW IT WORKS:

This is "mystery" not a "murder mystery". It is suitable for anyone aged 9 years and upwards and is good, clean fun. This deck is for 8 to 30 guests. There are 3 different endings, each with a different person who did it. Most of the cards support Version A, but there are additions to the report and Who Did It cards for Versions B and C.

8 SUSPECTS:

Alice (from Alice’s Adventures In Wonderland), Huck Finn, Cinderella, Pinocchio, Little Red Riding Hood, Peter Pan, Goldilocks and Aladdin.

INCLUDED:

5 Host Guide Cards: Invitations, Décor suggestions, Preparing props (optional), Menu suggestions, Preparing prizes (optional), Running the party, “The Rules” (4 sides).
30 Nametags / Descriptions and Dress Suggestions
96 Clue Cards: A1, A2, and A3
3 Special Investigator’s Report Cards
7 Who Did It Cards: Don’t let anyone read these before the end of the party.

RUNNING THE PARTY:

1 Decide if you are using Version A, B or C.
2 Invite your guests and let them know which character you want them to play. Refer them to a special webpage where they can see their character's description and dress suggestions. Tell your guests to read the suspect descriptions before the party as sometimes clues are hidden in them.
3 Put each nametag card (with description on the back) in a lanyard badge holder and give it to each person as they arrive.
4 Read out the Rules Cards (then leave them on the table for late arrivals).
5 Have the 8 suspects read out their descriptions to the group (but not dress suggestions).
6 Hand out the clue cards. Note who it is to be said by (i.e., either a character or “anyone” except the suspects it mentions).
7 Most clues are statements. They can say their clue in their own words as long as they don’t change the meaning. If someone has a question for a suspect, they will have a response on one of their cards.
8 For small parties of 16 or less guests, there are 3 acts and everyone goes around the group and says a clue and repeats that until all the clues have been said for each act. Anyone can go first as long as it isn't a response card. For larger parties, you ignore the "act numbers" and everyone just mingles and talks about their clue cards.
9 Later a report is read out to the whole group.
10 Everyone should write down who they think did it and how and why they did it.
11 The suspects read out the Who Did It? cards.

name: Professor Noggin's The Fifty States Card Game
description: In this Special Edition Professor Noggin title, players travel from Maine to Hawaii and all points in between. Topics include history, geography, and culture. Plus, with the Special Edition, there are double the cards and questions. Prepare yourself for an informative journey across America. Professor Noggins series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects - like The Fifty States. Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions. A special three-numbered die is included which adds an element of unpredictability. Easy and hard levels keep kids interested and challenged.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Trivia

name: Champions of Aer
description:
Everything changed in that faithful night as the gates flickered with an ear-battering hum every soul could hear, opening a way to the forgotten land of Aer. This the last place between the realms offering fertile land and ancient treasures. Yet unexplored and dangerous, the future of your people lies there. Gather your bravest Champions and become the ruler of Aer. But beware as you are not the only one who follows the call.

Champions of Aer is a semi-competitive strategy game for 2 players about might, exploration and resource management set in the fantastic world of Aer.

The players controll Champions which explore a randomized map every playthrough and have to overcome risky challenges. They can choose between five factions with unique play styles, troops, magic spells and quests. Additionally the seasons highly impact their advance as many challenges and the strength of their troops are altered by them.

In order to become the Champion of Aer players have to complete quests, which will reward exploring the map, gaining control over territories and developing their city.

Gaining control over territories is simple but dangerous. The Champions, accompanied by their loyal troops,have to defeat unknown challenges on every map tile. The composition of the troops, spells and the ability to call reinforcements mid-fight are key to overcome the dangers awaiting them. Luckily, by expanding their empire the players can gather better troops, learn ancient spells and even hire more champions.

—description from the designer
categories: City Building, Economic, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Income, Move Through Deck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Transformers: Siege War for Cybertron Convention Pack 2019
description: Three character convention exclusive character pack containing the Omnibots: Sergent Overdrive, Private Downshift, Private Camshaft.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Ozeanien 1: Scotties Unterwasserreise
description:
The goal of the game is to use the water bubbles to cross the ocean the fastest and reach the finish field.
But beware of the algae, otherwise you have to go back some fields!
—description from the publisher

This Roll-and-move game was available for customers of the Danish supermarket chain Netto in Germany from September 2nd to October 12th in exchange for loyalty points.
—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ozeanien 2: Scottie auf Entdeckertour
description:
The goal of the game is to land at least once on each animal field on the hot and the cold board side with Scottie, collecting the two animal figures and to reach the destination of the journey.
—description from the publisher

This Roll-and-move game was available for customers of the Danish supermarket chain Netto in Germany from September 2nd to October 12th in exchange for loyalty points.
—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ozeanien 4: Scottie auf Safari
description:
The goal of the game is to bring the animals as quickly as possible around the playing field into their corresponding habitat.
—description from the publisher

This Roll-and-move game was available for customers of the Danish supermarket chain Netto in Germany from September 2nd to October 12th in exchange for loyalty points.
—user summary

name: Ozeanien 5: Scottie in der Heimat
description:
The aim of the game is that the Scotties circle the stag so that he can no longer make a move. If the stag succeeds in breaking through the Scotties, he has won because the Scotties are not allowed to go backwards.
—description from the publisher

This Fox and Hounds variant for up to five players was available for customers of the Danish supermarket chain Netto in Germany from September 2nd to October 12th in exchange for loyalty points.
—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Ozeanien 6: Scotties Abenteuerreise
description:
The winner is the player who, passes the natural wonders with their character and reaches the finish field the fastest.
This requires not only to be lucky when rolling dice but also to perform fun activities.
—description from the publisher

This Roll-and-move game was available for customers of the Danish supermarket chain Netto in Germany from September 2nd to October 12th in exchange for loyalty points.
—user summary
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Moutown: Additional sheep
description:
This promo adds 9 tiles to the game: 1 Black Sheep, 1 Sheep Beast, 1 Fairy Sheep, 4 Pink Sheep and 2 MultiColoured Sheep (with a Coyote on the back).
Place these new Sheep tiles in the center of the Playground (like the others) at the beginning of each trick.

Rules:

The Black Sheep: John Mc Laine, the Black Sheep, is a tough guy. He has kicked the ass behind so many wolves that his reputation is no more to do. If John squats a Sheepfold, he cancels two Wolves. The Sheep Beast: this traitor has sold his soul to the Wolves. If you have it in a Sheepfold, its deceit is such that it cancels two Sheriffs Colley
The Fairy Sheep: Moumoute is a particularly vain Sheep who spends a lot of time to maintain its fleece. Certainly it costs a fortune in shampoo and other cosmetics,


but the player who owns it marks a Wool Tile bonus of 3 points.

The Pink Sheep: This quartet is composed of Sheep fashions victims. Indeed they have the particularity of being endowed with 2 Attributes instead of one. On the other hand, their atypical Colour is not among the Objectives.
MultiColoured Sheep: These wild Sheep in the desert plains of the Fildar region have very Colourful wool. Each of these Sheep displays 3 Colours of wool! Practical to easily complete the Objectives. However, they do not have any Attribute.
The Coyote: it’s the Wolf version more sly. This deceitful animal hides on the back of the MultiColoured Sheep. Its villainy allows it to play with poor Sheriff Colley so much that this one does not frighten it. In other words, a Coyote in your Sheepfold is not cancelled by a Sheriff Colley.

name: Tug of Words
description:
A Game of Word Strategy

Play the word game everyone will love. Play TUG OF WORDS! It's a dynamic contest of word strategy! Shift, Jump and Place your letters as you attempt to outspell your opponent. Be the first to spell a five - letter word on your opponent's home row. But WATCH OUT! Your opponent is spelling words to take your letters! You'll want to foil his plans by taking his letters. Join the Battle! Join the fun! PLAY TUG OF WORDS.

—description from the back of the box

name: Seek and Capture
description:
Each player has 1 large piece (his Captain), 8 smaller pieces (his soldiers), and 5 red wall pieces.

The Captains start the game on the red spaces, surrounded by their soldiers. Walls are placed at the start of the game and cannot be moved or jumped but must be moved around. All other pieces move one space at a time, one per turn. Pieces are taken by jumping directly over an opponent's piece with a space to land on the other side (like in Checkers). You may also jump your own man and go on to take your opponents piece or pieces. You must jump an opponent's piece if it is left in a space beside one of your own men. The object of the game is to take your opponent's Captain.

The game is over when one players Captain piece is taken or when it is your turn to move and you are unable to.

—user summary

name: Underworld
description:
Underworld is a cooperative fantasy board game about establishing a colony in a newly discovered land that is hostile, dangerous and full of riches. The players will lead a band of rugged adventurers on perilous expeditions to explore the surrounding jungle, delve deep into ancient ruins and eventually descend into the darkest recesses of the earth - the Underworld. Deep in the heart of the jungle and hundreds of feet below the earth, they must contend with horrific foes and terrible afflictions in a violent and inhospitable place. The players must juggle the need to do damage with the importance of protecting the health and minds of their Adventurers. In this age of discovery, a fantastic new world lies before you with all its peril, promise and possibility!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, City Building, Exploration, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Legacy Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: The Mentalist Mystery Game: Red Moon Uprising
description:
The Party Adventure Game! Host a night of Mystery in your home. Invite your friends to take on the roles of suspects along with the Patrick Jane character, for an evening of Mystery and Intrigue.

Patrick Jane: Independent consultant with the CBI. He has a remarkable track record for solving crimes by using his amazing razor sharp skills of observation.

This party adventure contains:

A complete Party Planner with instructions, costume suggestions, tips for having fun and a optional dinner menu.

Invitations and name tags for your guests.

Character profiles with secret clues and backgrounds for each guest.

A CD which re-enacts the sounds of the murder and outlines the plot.

The AUTHOR'S SOLUTION to the mystery.

—description from the back of the box
publishers: Pentalpha Game Corporation, The Canadian Group

name: Lawyer's Edition Technicality Cards
description:
The trivia game for justice! (just us!)

3,000 true-false, multiple choice, and short answer Queries/Responses printed on miniature legal pads.

Suitable for play with any six category trivia game board.
The perfect gift for students and practitioners!

Lawyer's Edition Technicality Cards may be used as a subsidiary card set for play with any six category trivia game board, including the Master Game board of Trivial Pursuit. It may also be played alone, without a game board of any type.
If the game is used as a subsidiary card set of another six category trivia game, the rules of the primary game shall apply , with the colors used to identity the categories of this subsidiary card set precisely corresponding to the colors on the primary game board.
If the game is played without the game board of a primary game, the object of play shall be to accumulate exactly 500 points. A roll of a die (not included) shall determine the category from which a Query is asked. A correct Response shall result in another turn for that player; an incorrect Response in the turn passing to the player to the left.
Points shall be awarded in accordance with the type of Query: 15 points for a Short Answer; 10 points for a Multiple Choice; and 5 points for a True/False. Exactly 500 points and no more shall be required to win. Consequently, strategy and the luck of the draw in answering a combination of Query types shall be important.

—user summary

name: Intrigue No. 1: Drama and Investigation – Deadly Vacation
description:
Turn your get-together with friends into an evening of intrigue and investigation. Become suspects in a criminal case!

Who is the paradise campground killer?

On the morning of July 21, 2002, the lifeless body of Roger Burns, a retired lawyer and promoter responsible for the re-opening of a mini hydroelectric power station, was discovered along the river bordering the Paradise Campground. The victim appeared to have been struck on the head with a blunt object. The body was half submerged.

Who could have done such a thing? It is up to you and your guests to solve the mystery during an evening in which everyone becomes an actor in an intriguing criminal investigation.

—user summary

name: Intrigue No. 2: Drama and Investigation – Deadly Passage
description:
Turn your get-together with friends into an evening of intrigue and investigation. Become suspects in a criminal case!

Who killed the millionaire?

It is June 29, 1928. American millionaire Holden Goldman has an important announcement to make and has invited eight guests on a cruise aboard his private yacht to the Galapagos Islands.
And so he made it! The yacht had barely departed from the port of Lima when the Millionaire announced his recent marriage to his secretary, a woman 30 years his junior! Despite their obvious amazement, all of his guests offered their best wishes to the newlyweds.
After the astonishing news, the guests retired to their staterooms to prepare for supper and recover form their initial shock! Suddenly, they heard a tremendous commotion above deck. The Millionaire was found dead, stabbed to death.
Who could have done such a thing? It is up to you and your guests to solve the mystery during an evening in which everyone becomes an actor in an intriguing criminal investigation.

—user summary

name: Bionicle Quest for the Masks CCG: Rahi Challenge
description: Rahi Challenge, which was released in 2001, was a small expansion for the original base game. It included 90 cards, bringing the total card count from 220 to 310. Unlike the base game and the subsequent Bohrok Swarm expansion, it had no deck box packs. The expansion was only available through 9 card booster packs.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
publishers: The Lego Group, Upper Deck Entertainment

name: Meeple Force
description:
Meeple Force is a "one vs many" 5 player game. With 1-4 players pitting their wits as the heroes of the Meeple Force against the Swarm Lord player who controls the deadly aliens of the galaxy.

The game uses no dice or tape measures, instead it uses good old fashioned skill and dexterity. By flicking your heroes across your gaming space, you will soon find yourselves knee deep in the action of Meeple Force and when it's time to shoot your opponents, place your flickable munitions, from bullets, missiles and chainsaw rockets, on the table and flick them at the enemy!

You can play single missions just for fun for 20 to 30 minutes or have your heroes run the gauntlet of our campaigns, where all 5 players will upgrade and equip their heroes in order to save the galaxy or watch it burn!

However, not only do you upgrade and equip your heroes, the Swarm Lord player will also be upgrading their minions, while any wounds and ammo spent also carry on into the next missions, meaning you'll need to keep your heroes well stocked and healthy until those critical Boss Battle missions at the end of each campaign.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Events, Flicking, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Mechanisms: Thematicisms
description:
The expansion to Mechanisms is finally ready! Themes are worlds which evoke emotion. When combined with mechanisms, games show themselves like a fine tuned beautiful machine. Help us celebrate the artists who showcase these worlds of vivid imaginings by putting your own pen to artistry in Thematicisms.

In this expansion, the worlds of the games we love come to life at the end of your pen. Players will draw cards and combine them to recreate works of art for other players to guess! The player who collects the most thematicism cards, wins!

-description from designer

name: The Bicycle Race
description:
An early British roll and move board game with a Bicycle theme. Players start in one corner of the board and move along a spiral track to their destination at the centre of the board.

There are a number of hazards along the way such as "Tyre Punctured" and "Dog Run Down"!

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Autons
description: This expansion adds Autons to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, three Auton faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Quibbles
description:
The Game of Very Cross Words

Quibbles is a fun and fast-moving word building family game.

In this exciting new word game, players work independently to create inter-locking words in crossword fashion and can re-arrange the position of their letter tiles as often and as much as they need to complete their words.

Object of the Game
To gain the highest score at the end of the game.

Game Play Summary
Players each select 20 tiles and try to use them all in a complete crossword. When the tiles are all used that player shouts "GRAB" and all players must pick up an extra tile.
Bad Boy Tiles are Wild and can be used as any letter.

When a Bad Boy Tile is picked up a Bad Boy Card must also be selected from the pile.

BEWARE: Bad Boy Cards may contain GOOD or BAD NEWS and instructions must be followed.

Play continues until all the tiles have been used and the first player to finish shouts "I'VE QUIBBLED!".

Scores are then calculated to ascertain the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: I Spy: Mysterious Objects Card Game
description: A matching game based on the "I Spy" series of seek-and-find picture books. Players draw cards and attempt to match images on the drawn cards to those on the cards in their hand. The first player to use up all of their cards by successfully matching objects is the winner.

name: Bionicle: Quest for the Nest
description: Bionicle: Quest for the Nest was a promotional board game released in select Toys "R" Us stores. The game was given to the first 75 contestants in an in-store contest as a consolation prize. The goal of the game is to answer "Bionicle" themed trivia questions in order to find the Bohrok nest. The winner is the first player to land on 'Finish'.

name: ZhuZhu Pets: Zhu-oom to the Finish
description: A game similar to Chutes & Ladders (AKA Snakes & Ladders) in which players implement a spinner to move around the board. Each player takes charge of the hamster of their choice in in a race to the finish that encourages children to focus on colors and numbers.

name: Xonko
description:
A card game in which players earn points by using their cards to form words. Players must form words with a minimum of three letters with the XONKO card acting as a wildcard. The first to 500 points is the winner.

—user summary

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Ice Warriors
description: This expansion adds Ice Warriors to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, three Ice Warrior faction cards, and seven new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Mire
description: This expansion adds the Mire to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes one Odin and three Mire soldier miniatures, three Mire faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Gallifreyan Guard
description: This expansion adds Gallifreyan Guards to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, five Gallifreyan Guard faction cards, and five new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Tetraps
description: This expansion adds Tetraps to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, three Tetraps faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Time Warrior
description: This expansion adds two characters from the Time Warrior episode to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes a Sontaran Linx and a human Irongron miniature, two faction cards, and four new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Professor Yana & Chantho
description: This expansion adds Professor Yana and Chantho to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes a Professor Yana/War Master miniature and a Chantho miniature, three faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Return of Doctor Mysterio
description: This expansion adds characters from the episode The Return of Doctor Mysterio to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes a Doctor Sim miniature and a Ghost miniature, two faction cards, and four new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Clockwork Droids
description: This expansion adds Clockwork Droids to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, three Clockwork Droids faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Time Lords
description: This expansion adds Time Lords to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, three Time Lord faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Emojibots
description: This expansion adds Emojibots to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, one Emojibot faction card, and two new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Empress of Mars
description: This expansion adds characters from the Empress of Mars episode to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes an Emoress of Mars miniature and a Friday miniature, two faction cards, and four new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Island of Dr. Culebra
description:
THE STORY
On an island far from humanity lies a secret facility run by a mad scientist. She is the most evil person—the most cunning, the most horrific (and did I mention evil?) person known to woman. Her facility consists of a laboratory, a torture chamber, holding cells, and a labyrinth.

The laboratory is where the doctor performs her illicit experiments. She has kidnapped people around the world to be her test subjects. She not only has figured out how to clone her subjects but has figured out how to crossbreed animals with humans and vice-versa. One of her successful experiments was of a human and a rat. These hideous creatures are known as BREEDERS. They are half the size of an average human. They are fast, hard to detect, and only come out at night to feed on unexpected prey.

The loud sounds you hear could only be the screams and moans of agony coming from the torture chamber. The torture chamber is where the doctor analyses each subject's tolerance to pain and suffering. She will push their limits until they break or die. Out of the hundreds of corpses that did not pass the test, only six have made it thus far.

These six subjects are known as REAPERS. They are creatures that take on the form of a human and an animal that have been genetically modified and mutated. They are in their holding cells where they await to be released into the labyrinth and unleash their terrifying acts of evil. They are trained to prey on human flesh and they will stop at nothing until they do.

While these are some of the ghastly things to come out of the doctor's laboratory, it does not end there. Some of her experiments consist of chemical solutions that alter one's abilities. Thus, giving them supernatural powers. This supernatural ability can range from running five times faster than a cheetah to being undetectable like a Chameleon. This chemical solution is called GEN-13. GEN-13 derives from 12 separate chemical solutions plus one unknown. When the unknown is used on a creature, it becomes the ELEMENTAL. The ELEMENTAL has the power to claim all 12 chemical solutions if present.

The doctor is now looking to abduct new test subjects around the world to continue with her GEN-13 experiments. This evil doctor is known as Dr. Culebra.

OVERVIEW
In The Island of Dr. Culebra, you play the role of one of Dr. Culebra's test subjects. You and the other test subjects will need to plan, strategize and work together to escape the labyrinth. You and others will be injected with a serum that has a chemical solution that alters your abilities. You and others will use your new ability to overcome obstacles, traps, and creatures in hope of finding a way out of the labyrinth. Will you and others be able to meet the challenge and escape the Island of Dr. Culebra?

OBJECTIVE
The object of the game is to escape from the labyrinth of Dr. Culebra's Island. The labyrinth consists of obstacles, traps, and creatures. You will need to find the exit before the time runs out.

—description from the publisher

name: Alien Evasion
description:
THE STORY
In a galaxy far, far away, lies a planet that are occupied by different but cute little aliens. This planet is so incredible that they all left their planet to come here for their yearly vacation. But little did they know, the planet is doomed for destruction and approaching a supernova.

OBJECTIVE
Collect your aliens and rearrange them in a away that makes it efficient and sufficient to launch your rockets. Escape with as many available rockets as possible to gain Victory Points. Be the first one to gain the most Victory Points to win the game.

Will you be able to meet the challenge and help these aliens return to their home planet and be known as the biggest hero in the galaxy?

—description from the publisher

name: Guardians Waltz
description:
Guardians Waltz is a co-operative tower defense game set in a fantasy world. The players each choose one of the 8 characters with different characteristics. The goal is to defend the castle from invasion by the monsters, who are generated by dice rolls.

In each round, draw the Happening Card and apply its effect, move and generate monsters, and take player actions. The players win if they manage to defend the castle until the end. The game can be played solitaire.

ファンタジー世界を舞台とした協力型タワーディフェンスゲームです。
プレイヤーはそれぞれ特長を持った8人のキャラクターから1人を選びます。
ダイスロールにより発生し、城に向かうモンスターの侵攻を食い止めるのが目標となります。
毎ラウンド、ハプニングカードの取得と効果の適用、モンスターの移動と発生、プレイヤーの行動を繰り返し、無事に城を守りきればプレイヤーの勝利です。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Top or Drop
description:
Play either the highest or the lowest cards and at the same time match colors. If you are the first to get rid of all your cards you win the game. With special cards and personal strategy you can increase your chances to win.

—description from the publisher

name: Flaming Continent: Record of the Three Kingdoms – Ver. Lord Expansion
description: This Expansion is MoDian (Chinese App like Kickstarter) Stretch goal reward. Add 5 more lords, famous treasures and Generals from Romance of the Three Kingdoms.

name: Sorrow! Death of a King
description: In Sorrow! Death of a King, the King has died and all the Kings men struggle to empty out the Royal Treasury first and to become the new ruler of this medieval Kingdom. You play cards to represent your court supporters and Archer mercenaries as you struggle against your opponents to rule the court and gain the most money by whatever means from the dead King's treasury and to purchase the support needed to become the next ruler of the land.
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Variable Player Powers

name: いろかるた (Color Karuta)
description:
いろかるた (Color Karuta) is a color-building game in which players take transparent cards in five colors (CMYK and white) and overlay them in an attempt to recreate a color presented to them by an opponent or a color on an object in real life. The order in which you stack the cards matters, so build with care!

The game includes Ukiyo-e postcards that can serve as targets to match in color should you not have anything else appropriate within reach.
user summary

This is a game to create colors by combining transparent color cards.
透ける色カードを組み合わせて色をつくって遊ぶゲーム
publisher's summary

name: CarlSpies: Big City Living – Expansion Pack
description:
Owning CarlSpies Deluxe will make your family above average. However, adding The Big City Living Expansion Pack (a 30 card add-on to the full game) will increase your family's above averageness by 10x !! The expansion pack includes cards for things like Toll Booths, Street Musicians, Graffiti, and other stuff you might see around large metropolitan cities (seems obvious?!)

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Travel

name: Sport Billy
description:
Based on the famous cartoon hero Sport Billy, this is a simple roll the dice and move vintage board game. It was made in Greece from Stam Toys toy company, probably in the early 80's.

It can be played from 2-4 players. The winner is the first player who reaches endpoint by the exact number. There are some spaces on the board, with different symbols upon them. When you reach a space with a symbol of a dice you can play again. The blue circle symbol means that you have to go 6 spaces backwards, the yellow circle means that you lose your turn. Moreover, when you reach a space with a blue star upon it, you move 4 spaces forward and you can play one more time. When you reach a space with a red star upon it, you must go back in the beginning.

—user summary

name: Metro: International Fair Promo Tile
description: The "international fair" tile is to be inserted in the draw pile. It represent the cities where lies the main European trade shows. It has the 4 colors of the métro lines.

name: The Descendants of Volos
description:
Update: Because of file size limits for uploading files, here is link to the newly published game tutorial in PDF. Available both in English and Polish: http://spinningdice.pl/game-tutorial/

The Descendants of Volos is a competitive roleplaying adventure board game set in a fantasy realm inspired by Slavic mythology. Players will play the role of one of many characters called Velevits or "The Descendants of Volos". They are born with mysterious abilities. Their common special ability is the presence of 3 souls (lives).

The main goal of the game is to become the most powerful and authoritative character within a limited amount of time. You can do it by gaining victory points throughout collecting the achievements and influence tokens (those you get by completing randomly generated quest sequences and solving cases for your organization). There is no "best way" of winning this game. You'll have to improvise, adapt and overcome! This is a competitive game, so not only you should collect victory points, but also try interrupting the other players.

When traveling around the peninsula, your character will fight various monsters, face various situations, grow in strength, collect unique gear, fulfill the quests, and become an influential and respected member of their organizations.

The game is focused on adventures, PvP (Player vs Player) and plenty of PvE (Player vs Enemy) combats. Large and modular map gives incredible replay value. 800+ adventure cards stuffed with unique elements like trinkets, weapons, armors, enemies, side quests and situations. The character evolution is full of choices. Spending skill points on any attribute like strength, agility, intellect, or vitality will shape your combat abilities.

The game can be played by 1 to 4 players and the number of players only slightly affects the playing time, as unique game rules allow half of actions in each turn to be performed simultaneously. It means that you're playing almost all the time, and the waiting time per turn is minimal. There are also special mechanics designed for players who end the game prematurely, so even though they lose, they can still play by becoming a "minion master." The powerful monsters that were quietly sitting in the dungeons, have been now unleashed and are crawling out and chasing the remaining players. The intensity of the gameplay grows, and the player that lost prematurely can now take revenge, or simply troll the remaining players. This and much much more unique solutions will be revealed before the kickstarter campaign.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Map Deformation, Memory, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Barbarian Mints
description:
You play as a lone barbarian in a land of trees, sand, and mountains. You are on a mission to reclaim your throne from a conniving usurper, but you must travel through the unforgiving lands of danger and peril. Use and carefully upgrade your skills as you travel. By the time this month passes, when the moon has gone through its phases, it will be too late.

Players hold all the cards needed to play in their hand. Taking into account the player's skill value in addition to the values on the cards, each event on the cards will have a level of difficulty. Beat that difficulty, and the player succeeds! Fail and the repercussions could be loss of health, water, gold or be forced to retreat. Hex by hex, the player makes their way back to the city where the throne awaits!

Deeply inspired by the 1981 game Barbarian Prince, I've made this game in an attempt to capture the fun and excitement of exploration, adventure, and wilderness-living; while avoiding a dense book of tables and the somewhat arbitrary nature of the classic 1981 game. All the wonder of exploration, condensed into a mint tin, with only cards, paperclips, and the player's sense of adventure!

—description from the publisher

name: BrainBox: Peppa Pig
description:
​This brilliant BrainBox features Peppa Pig, her little brother George and the rest of her family and friends in a whole variety of situations, from playing in the rain to dressing up, riding in a hot air balloon to washing the car, and is great family fun.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.
Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun.
publishers: Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft.

name: Brainbox: First Letters
description: BrainBox First Letters is designed to give pre-school children a head start. Each sturdy double- sided card shows three images with their initial letters on one side and just the images on the other, with the question, “What letter?”. The object of the game is to look at and talk about a card, then turn it over and try to remember the initial letter of each image. If the letters are named correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.
publishers: Albi, Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft.

name: Revenge of the Mortals
description:
It is a dark time for the Mortals. Creatures have driven them from their cabins in Camp Murkwood and pursued them all the way to the Forbidden Island.

Evading the dreaded onslaught, a group of fighters led by no one has begun to resist these creature threats with weapons stolen from the mad scientist armory.

These scientists, obsessed with their next great creation, have dispatched creatures to continue the hunt. But this time, the Mortals plan to fight back...

Revenge of the Mortals is a stand alone game in the Campy-verse where players will take on the roles of different Mortals facing 8 rounds of Creature attacks. Armed with unique weapons, players will need to form squads to combat these creatures, and lucky for you, your party of friends are here to help. But in the end, there can be only one hero of the story.

Your goal, in Revenge, is to score the most valuable Relics and Treasures by defeating Creatures. Revenge of the Mortals is played over the course of eight rounds. Every round a new Creature threat is drawn and each player will play a Weapon card from their hand in an attempt to survive the threat and possibly score some sweet Loot. Players can work together as a squad to overcome these threats or turn on each other in order to score more points. Players will negotiate, and then play a card from their hand face-down in front of them. Once everyone has chosen or The Sands of Time has run out (in which case a card must be selected randomly), each player reveals their chosen card simultaneously. Players will either survive the threat or lose Health. Can you survive the night?

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Snakes Zombie Apocalypse
description: An action RPG set in a world destroyed by the Zombie Apocalypse. With preset scenarios, create a character and upgradable game layouts. Snakes Zombie Apocalypse allows rich replay and customization to go along with leveling and growing as a character.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Ars Universalis: Verkami Extra Characters Blister Pack
description: A blister pack with three extra characters for the game: Bernini, Tesla and Ockham. Each with its own illustration.

name: Promise Tested
description:
Before the Great Cataclysm the realms of Promise are being attacked. Ancient decisions and strange forces have come against all the realms. You must overcome these tests to save all of Promise. Explore the realmscape in search for Artifacts, Knowledge, Allies, and Resources. Gather what you find to help you in your quest, or deliver them to your realm to bring prosperity. Use whatever you have to save the realms of Promise Tested.

Promise Tested is a an expansion for Promise Reborn that takes the normal game and turns it into a solo or cooperative game. If you can Bury 10 Tests before there are 6 Tests in the Test pile, all the players win. Otherwise, the realms of Promise fall and all the players lose.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Promise At War
description:
Before the Great Cataclysm the realms of Promise were at war with one another. During this war, you were selected to explore the realmscape in search of Artifacts, Knowledge, Allies, and Resources to help your realm achieve victory. Gather things to help your war efforts, deliver things to your realm to reinforce it, and attack you enemies during Promise At War.

Promise At War is an expansion for Promise Reborn that takes the classic deck-building game and turns it into a player vs player battle royale where the last Realm standing wins. Play up to 4 players at the table and see who wins the wars of Promise's brutal past.

—description from the publisher

A copy of Promise Reborn is required to play this expansion.

name: Pocket Bible Pictures
description:
Similar to the popular game Pocket Pictures, this version has you sketch a word chosen from one of five biblical categories (miracles & events, objects, people, places, phrases & parables) and others guess the word from your simple sketches.

—user summary

name: Wake Up Sheeple
description:
Wake Up Sheeple is a conspiracy theorist's card game about finding the truth. The game has players take the role of the General Public and the Mainstream Media. Each Mainstream Media player must use their own Subject and Motive cards to tell the General Public what actually happened during an Event drawn from the event deck.

This game is not simply a fill in the blank game. We encourage players to craft their own insane truth to explain what happened and answer the question which the General Public has posed.

The General Public player will choose the winners for the rounds by picking the story they choose to believe. They may choose the winner by whatever criteria they like.

The winning player will keep the Event card for scorekeeping. A Mainstream News Player is considered to have won the game by having a set amount of News Stories accepted into the mainstream - that amount may be 3, 5, 10, or as many as players like.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Political

name: Kings of War: Clash of Kings – 2019 Edition
description:
The world of Mantica trembles once again as armies march to war. This year’s annual organised play supplement includes all of the balance tweaks to continue to keep the game fun and competitive. There’s also new magic rules, stats for new epic monsters, rules for playing grand sieges, and stats for using the brand new units from Kings of War: Vanguard in you games of Kings of War!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Habitation: Sucrerie
description:
In 1680, on a small Caribbean island: Martinique
The rich settlers, the enriched buccaneers and even the religious orders lured by the hope of huge profits built many Habitations, these farms, true pre-industrial establishments technologically far ahead of their time, who not only exploited vast sugarcane fields but also slaves.

The game shows us to understand the economic complexity and the consequences of social injustices by testifing the daily life of such a Habitation, a strictly hierarchical microcosm, a dehumanized society where the thirst for freedom coexists with the thirst for profit

In Habitation sucrerie the players play a neutral role as observant but nonetheless active minds which can influence both objectives of the Békés (Habitation masters) and the slaves, by an alternative asymmetrical game system mixing worker placement, aera control, hand management and exploration.


To win, players will have to control together the pawns of both sides and after 9 periods capitalize the most victory points in each of the two sides.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Semi-Cooperative Game, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Wissen & Quizzen: Retter und Helfer
description:
In this card game 3 assistants "Käpt'n Quizzo" (KQ), "Reno Retter" (RR) and "Helli Helfer" (HH) guide through one of 3 different game modes.

Knowledge: Learn about rescue systems specified on 26 different cards with RR.

Trivia game: All players answer KQs questions and score victory points. KQ announces the winner at the end of the game.

Card Game with HH

For all games the Tiptoi pen is required.
The Cards can be combined with any of other Game of Wissen & Quizzen Series for more variety of trivia themes.

name: Movie Clichés: Action Edition
description:
Some movie clichés are necessary, others just the result of lazy screenwriting. But they're always fun to predict and spot! That's why we turned 75 of them into playing cards!

Two styles of play ("Cliché Bingo" and "Name the Movies") are the meat of the game - but you can surely come up with different scenarios.

The Action Edition is available as a standalone edition and as part of the complete edition (action, horror, comedy, sci-fi and fantasy clichés).

—description from the designer

name: Movie Clichés: Horror Edition
description:
Some movie clichés are necessary, others just the result of lazy screenwriting. But they're always fun to predict and spot! That's why we turned 75 of them into playing cards!

Two styles of play ("Cliché Bingo" and "Name the Movies") are the meat of the game - but you can surely come up with different scenarios.

The Horror Edition is available as a standalone edition and as part of the complete edition (action, horror, comedy, sci-fi and fantasy clichés).

—description from the designer

name: GearMan GO!: Expansion Pack
description:
It's the marvelous, it's the super, it's the amazing... GearMan GO! Expansion Pack! A fun comic book race game for 2 to 6 players of all ages.

Expansion Pack includes white & black cars with their gear tiles, gear cubes, lap cubes and lap tile. Nineteen more track tiles with grass on the reverse including the new hairpin tile. Requires GearMan GO! base game.

Races are unique each time with the random Action spaces, modular hex track boards, cars bumping and changing gears.

Cars are driven by rolling various black and white Gear dice looking for doubles. Move your car one space for each dice of each double thrown into the matching color space on the track.

Try to stay in the highest gear possible by avoiding the POW and BOMB spaces. The lower your gear the less dice you roll. Drive over the WOW and SUPER spaces to gear up or boost to top gear!

Customize and build your own circuits with the modular hex boards with further playability added by the GearMan GO! Expansion Pack which extends the circuit with more hex board straights & curves and adds two additional cars bringing the total players up to six.

Races can comprise of 1 to 3 laps. First player to complete the set laps wins.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder on Paradise Island
description:
The time is the present and Carrie Bean, owner of the proposed new all-inclusive resort "Flip-Flops" has invited her guests to a house party at the Cliff House Hotel & Restaurant on the beautiful West Indian island of Paradise. Before the party Carrie Bean took her usual afternoon stroll along the clifftop but a short while later she was found floating in the Caribbean sea. Host your own party and find out who is responsible for the murder on Paradise island.

—description from the back of the box

name: Farting Cows And The End Of The World
description:
Gas building up around the cows eventually might explode! Spread them out before we're all killed!

The community is concerned about all the gas building up around the cows. Eventually it might explode! Move your cows to an open pasture where they can air out their farts before they kill us all!

You will each start with a set of cows and terrain cards. Each turn, you will either place a terrain card or maneuver a cow. The cows will each take up a different amount of space. Terrain also varies in usable space. Terrain that allows more maneuverability is worth more victory points at the end of the game. Cows are movable as long as they aren’t farting. Once they are farting, they are won’t be movable for the remainder of the game. Cows can also take up more of the usable terrain space by farting, so time those gaseous releases appropriately. The game ends after any player places their last terrain card on the table, with one final turn for each other player. After that, the player having the most cows on any given terrain card will claim the victory points for the space.

—description from designer

name: Presto! Presto!
description: A fast paced word game. Everyone plays at the same time, trying to sort cards into a predefined order based on the letters included of the depicted object.

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Fires of Pompeii
description: This expansion adds characters from The Fires of Pompeii episode to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, three faction cards, and two new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Papal Mainframe
description: This expansion adds characters from the Church of the Papal Mainframe to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes three miniatures, three faction cards, and three new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Pauv' Mery
description:
Pauv'Mery is a parkour game. The goal of the game is to make the number of tour of the island agreed at the beginning (1, 2 or 3 rounds). The first explorer to perform the tricks wins the game. The dice is used by the other players can influence the final move.
—user summary

A handful of adventurers explore the island with the lush flora and fauna of Pauv 'Mery.
They will realize quickly that this journey requires to use strategies, alliances and defense to be the first to have explored this distant country ..
—description from the back of the box (translated)

Une poignée d'aventuriers part à la découverte de l'île à la faune et à la flore luxuriantes de Mauv' Mery.
Ils réaliseront rapidement que ce périple nécessitera de jouer de stratégies, d'alliances et de défense pour parvenir à être le premier à avoir exploré cette lointaine contrée...
—description from the back of the box

name: Keeper of the Wurdz
description:
The object of the game is to play four of your words from your word cards out onto the board, and score a higher number of points than any other player when the game ends. Each player has 4 word cards, each with 4 words on it and each word 5 letters long. However, each word is an English word spelled out phonetically. On a player's turn they play one of their words out to the board using the letter tiles, similar to Scrabble except players have access to all letters at all times. Once a word is played all other players can make 3 guesses among them what they think the words actually is. If they fail to say the word correctly, the current player earns an additional 10 points.
