Regardless, players earn points when placing words based on the squares on the board they lay their words. After four rounds, the player with the most points is the winner.

This is game #5 of a series from Things Unlimited.

name: Monster Problemen
description:
Monster Problemen ("Monster Problems") is ‘serious’ card game for age 8 and older in which players learn about problems caused by poverty and potential solutions for such situations. This is done by seeing text one side of the cards, the other side shows monster heads (problems) and limbs (solutions) that can be combined if they are of the appropriate color (type).

Cards are drafted from an open tableau, with 2 cards per player per round being offered, plus 1 starting player card that can be taken. Players choose 2 cards during their turn. Then flip over the cards to see the monster head or limbs. Monsters heads need 2 to 4 limbs to be completed. At any time players can rearrange their monster heads and limbs. If the drawing pile is too small to fill up the open drafting tableau the game immediately ends. Each completed monster is worth point equal the amount of cards it consists of. The player with the most points wins the game.

This is a co-creations with the Kids Council of the municipality of Groningen. The game will be distributed to primary schools in the city. Drawings are made by the Kids Council. Graphic design and art implementation done by Marco Westerkamp.

—description from the designer

name: Mind's Eye
description:
Mind’s Eye is a 2-3 player staring contest game made of 18 identical cards.

Players simultaneously play a single card pointing the colored eyes they wish to use towards the other player(s). Winners will take the losers cards based on the color of the eye. Play until all the cards are in one player’s hands. That player is now the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Let's Sort It Out
description:
In Let's Sort It Out take turns picking and sorting recyclables, trash and compost to gain points in this set-collection game. Watch as they come down the conveyor belt. Collect the best cards to fill your bins. But watch out for hazardous materials! They will contaminate your hand and hinder you in the game.

—description from the designer

name: Save the Whales
description:
An exciting game played on the high seas to save the world's threatened whale population.

Drop anchor in Pago Pago, Darwin, Amchitka. Fiji, and other interesting ports of call.

Navigate the far reaches of the Pacific in search of whaling fleets.

Contains two versions: 1 for 8 years and Up, II for 12 years and up.

Contains playing board of the Pacific Ocean, 2 dice, 8 plastic ships, 32 whale cards, 29 Davy Jones Locker cards, 16 confrontation cards, and a rule sheet,

name: Gaïa: Paquet Promotionnel
description:
This mini pack includes 8 new city cards for the first or second edition of Gaïa:
the Brandenburg Gate, Paris, the Forbidden City, New York, Saint Petersburg, Biskupin, Cracovia and Venice.
The first seven replace the cities of the game having the same characteristics (these are alternative illustrations). Venice is an additional city, to add to the Life cards. This is the only city to be laid on a Sea tile.
This pack is included in the third edition of the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: The Treasures in Anubis Tomb
description:
Rumor has it that there are precious treasures in anubis tomb. As a secret agent, you are dispatched to the tomb and try to access those treasures. Unfortunately, you are not alone. Another agent has already skulk into the tomb. He/She might ruin your plan!

To steal out all the treasures, you found that you need to complete the mysterious board in the tomb. Place treasures to the board sounds easy, but the treasures are cursed, the chambers stumble at every step and the mummy has woken! Everything is getting worse and dangerous.

The Treasures in Anubis Tomb is a 2 player game, which is playing 45 minutes. A game plays 3 phases and each phase plays 4 rounds. Each round, each player takes turn to take a treasure from the tomb and place the treasure on their board, which consists of a 4x4 grid area. After placing the treasure and depending on the number and color shown on the tile, player is allowed to take a card from pyramid chamber to score points.

As the game goes, players try to increase their scoring round by round and level by level. Because each round the mummy moves forward to chase players on the scoring track. If player couldn’t manage to score more points as game moves, they probably will get caught and get punishment by mummy! Take the useful treasures and place them with plan. Then you might successfully move all the treasures from the tomb and win the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Pattern Recognition, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Scratchees: Shark! Shark!
description:
awesome SCRATCH-OFF games!

3 Different Games Inside!

Free! Dr. Scratchov Scratcher! Inside

Get Free Stuff!
By collecting points on very game card

You are pearl diving in the Bahamas when you discover a fabulous oyster bed full of rare black pearls! They are worth thousands of dollars each! Even though the natives tell you these waters are shark-infested, you put on your scuba gear and dive anyway! The first player to fill his sack with 16 pearls wins the game! Be careful!

Take turns looking for oysters with pearls in them by scratching any oval on the ocean bottom. You will see:

Oyster! - Black pearls are inside! Scratch a circle on the big oyster to see if you found 1, 2 or 3 pearls! Mark the score by scratching this many circles in your pearl sack.

Starfish - Clue: at least 1 oyster (and usually 2 or 3) are near this space because these starfish eat oysters

Crab - Your opponent gets to take 2 turns in a row because a crab bit your finger and you have to shake it off!

Shark - Look out! A shark zooms up from behind and bites you! Scratch-off one FOOT, LEG or ARM to show the damage each time you are bitten. If you are bitten 6 times, you lose the game

Nothing - Look elsewhere next turn!

—user summary

name: Scratchees: Battle Fleet
description:
5 Different Battlefleet Games

Free! Dr. Scratchov Scratcher!

disposable games to scratch, play & throw away

Objective: You are in a fierce naval battle in dense foggy weather. Your mission is to find and sink all five of your opponent's ships before he does the same to you.

Preparation: Each player scratches the center of the battleship on their own side of the card to reveal their color code of ships in the game. One player has red ships, the other player had blue ships. Each player has one Battleship (four sections long). two Cruisers (three sections long), and two Destroyers (two sections long).

How to Play: Beginning with the red player, take turns scratching any one square. By doing so, a player both removes the "fog" and takes a "shot" at that square. Because of the fog, a player may accidentally hit part of his own ship, as sometimes happens in real life. Be careful!

When all the sections of a ship are hit, the ship is sunk.

The Mine: When either player hits a mine, it explodes, and that player immediately scratches all eight surrounding squares if they haven't already been scratched. This will usually cause damage to both player's ships.

—user summary

name: Scratchees: Count Dracula
description:
5 Different Count Dracula Games

Free! Dr. Scratchov Scratcher!

disposable games to scratch, play & throw away

Objective: You are in the dare dungeon of the infamous Count Dracula, searching for the famous treasure of jewels know the be hidden in his caskets. The player who gets away with the most jewels of his own color by the end of the game wins.

Preparation: Each player scratches one of the two skull eyes at the bottom of the game card to "see" which color jewels they are seeking. The "blue" player is player number 1 and is searching for blue numbers representing sapphires.

The "red" player is player number 2 and is searching for red numbers representing rubies.

How to Play: Player number 1 starts the game by scratching one of the six circles (hiding places) in the bottom of any of the caskets. The following things may be discovered:

BLUE NUMBERS - You have discovered that many sapphires.
RED NUMBERS - You have discovered that many rubies.
BAT - You immediately lose your turn
CRUCIFIX - The value of all jewels in the casket doubles.
DRACULA - You awaken Dracula! You must close the casket without taking out any of the jewels. Immediately scratch off the three boxes in the lid and subtract one point from your score for each sapphire or ruby found in that casket so far.

A player may continue his turn as long as he wishes. But, when the player uncovers a bat or a Dracula, it then becomes the opponent's turn.

To collect the jewels discovered in the casket, you must be the player who successfully "closes" the casket's lid. When the casket is closed, the other player's jewels and any remaining uncovered treasure are lost forever. Remember, no points are scored until the lid is closed.

You may attempt to close a casket at any time as long as at least one hiding place has been scratched. To close a casket, search for the word "close" in one of the three boxes in the casket's lid. Uncovering a "squeak" in the lid caused the player to lose his turn and the casket remains open.

When you close a casket, chisel the score on your tombstone scoring area. When all caskets are closed, the game is over. The player with the highest score wins.

—user summary

name: Scratchees: Bermuda Triangles
description:
5 Different Bermuda Triangles Games

Free! Dr. Scratchov Scratcher!

disposable games to scratch, play & throw away

OBJECTIVE: An invasion of UFOs is hovering over the Bermuda Triangle. You operate a series of Coast Guard Rescue Stations located just outside the area.

YOUR MISSION: pilot rescue choppers into the dangerous Triangle in search of human survivors. But don't let the UFOs zap you out of the Solar System.

HOW TO PLAY (solo version): You have enough choppers for six rescue flights. Start each mission by scratching the triangle in front of any rescue station, indicated by a black dot along the sides of the large triangle. From there, fly in any direction by scratching any triangle that is next to the space you currently occupy.

Continue flying through the triangles in search of human ships. You can move one space at a time, in any direction you desire. Some spaces will be empty, but others will reveal the following:
DINGY - 1 person aboard

ROWBOAT - 3 people aboard

YACHT - 7 people aboard

CLIPPER - 10 people aboard

UFO - Zap! A UFO abducts you and all your passengers back to Andromeda to work as slaves in a pyramid factory. This ends that mission and you score no points. There are about half a dozen UFOs hiding in the triangles, mostly near the outside edge.

RADAR - Radar indicates that a ship larger than a dingy lies in the direction shown within four spaces.
MISSION - Uncovering an "M" give you fuel for an extra mission, if you can return safely from your present one. If your are capture by a UFO before returning, you lose the extra mission and all the survivors on this trip.

To rescue survivors, you must get them out by flying off any side of the Triangle without running into a UFO. This ends the mission and allows you to score 1 point for each survivor you picked up. You can fly out of the Triangle right away, or take a chance searching for more survivors before heading out. Each mission must start from a new rescue station and, since you don't want to waste fuel searching an area twice, a new mission path cannot cross over an old one.

Rescue 50 or more humans to win the game.

TWO PLAYER VERSION - The game plays the same except that players take turns for 3 missions each. The player rescuing the most humans wins.

—user summary
